GOax5XGhyWYU0XyADMPNug.text: Been going Sushi Roku for five years only one of its the best , freshest sushi in town also great service and friendly staff !! You won't be disappointed plus General manager and other managers are amazing to get along so please go there and see for your self! Cheers Roku!!

FrKjRwamvU2SNKcTZg6lWQ.text: So far this has been the best sushi I've had in Phoenix. If you can overlook the loud music, you'll appreciate the ambiance which is young and classy. Lots of beautiful women and clean shaven men to look at which made this evening worth the steep bill.

EmjZDVy9ynioeeZTiUpMBQ.text: I love coming here. Not only do they have great ambiance and yummy food, but the service is great and that's what brings me back. Staff is always courteous and accommodating. The first time I decided to check this place out, I called in and talked to a woman named Julianna. She was so sweet and very inviting, offering to give me directions to the spot. When I came in, she greeted me and remembered me from our conversation on the phone. She also gave me DELICIOUS recommendations from the menu such as the rib-eye wrapped asparagus. I had a lot of questions about the menu and she had an answer for every one of them which impressed me. Julianna alone made my visit so great that I decided to keep coming back. She's my go-to gal at Sushi Roku and has even helped me coordinate a dinner for my friends and family. I love Sushi Roku!

jAzc_yBDhj3SyvazciRbcQ.text: I wanted to give the review about a 4 star because there was a wait so the night started off not so good. We waited about 30 minutes before being sat down. After that it only went up from there. Jon served us and did a great job explanation the different dishes and recommended terrific dishes (even though I am not a big sushi fan). In all, bill was not too expensive and dinner was great.

qx9u2wHf_7og44eaPMsoAg.text: Amazing service, so impressed. Crystal was both gawgeous on the outside and in and had impeccable service. Such a pleasant environment, the folks at this place, Mike and Nicole thank you for being so lovely with us. Perfect example of what good food and service should be. Thank you!

2xkqK1LvH44juzchrMi1ww.text: Stopped by for happy hour on Sunday and everything was great! The bartender was very nice and accommodating. The food here is delicious. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in old town.

7I41ga5Vq3ZlHNUlsrvWfg.text: The food was delicious, but the service, while enthusiastic, was slow.  We had the tofu appetizer, which was very fresh and flavorful.  I especially liked the tofu with the truffle.  We decided to get entrees rather than sushi for our meals, so I can't say anything really for the sushi despite it being part of the restaurant's name.  The entrees had a very generous amount of food on them, and were pretty tasty.    Part of the price tag on your menu is reflected in the atmosphere, and while the meal I had was good, I probably could get something with similar quality for cheaper at a different Japanese fusion type restaurant.

Aa1RBPDm6U0CCjAW1OS6Ww.text: Sushi Roku is pricey and I'll lead with that because it's probably the worst thing about the restaurant. Once you get over the price the experience goes up from here, I love how trendy this place is, and they have a fantastic selection for sushi as well as wine. The staff are pretty friendly, although the one staff member I dealt with didn't know a lot about the wines on the menu so that was a little frustrating. All in all the location is great, the food was delicious and the experience I had was great. Would I do it again, absolutely!

SbSHXn_rmmKnLIQUwk3Oag.text: I am freaking out over how good this Hanabi is (Spicy Tuna over Crispy Rice). I can't even. I literally ordered another! Lol.

XepnmFaKBDSpQXKIM4xjrw.text: I went here even though I can't eat ra fish. I was very happy that my server, Jon, guided me through the menu and suggested dishes that I could eat. His knowledge and service were both memorable and made my experience amazing. Will definitely be coming back as long as Jon is there.

FgBG5XoiINCg3Z7LP5oYqQ.text: Great atmosphere and great sushi! Fun part of downtown Scottsdale, very lively place. The sushi chefs were awesome and the reviews were right.... freshest sushi around!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ynqcYl0g1PvimGb4bCGUqw.text: I was underwhelmed by very average sushi. The rolls were smaller than the norm and overpriced for being such. You are paying for the lounge ambiance with an uncharismatic wait staff.

yNK-baJNffJb_ORh76R7eg.text: From the moment we were sat, we waited for almost 10 minutes to be greeted by our server.  The restaurant was empty by the way...we were the only poeple in there.  When we asked about the menu, we got the vaguest descriptions of the sushi rolls.  Being the only table In the restaurant, we were surprised that our order took extra long.  The server never came back and out drinks were not refilled.  Part of our order was finally delivered but our appetizer was not to be seen.  We were finally told that there was a problem in the kitchen and a few minutes later the appetizer and second roll arrived. You would think. Being the only table in the restaurant, everything would be perfect.  Not the case.  Maybe that is why they are so super slow for lunch?  We'll go back to RA next time. :(

RvyUzoUa-eftov1_rpzYWg.text: Very Swanky Restaurant!  The sushi was decent and the cost moderate.  I had the seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll and asparagus/spicy shrimp roll.  Spicy tuna was definitely the best of all three dishes.  I'm not sure what kind of spices are in the roll, but it's definitely very good.  I would go back.

TApzC21LNeEWT5ukQROwSw.text: Never a dull moment eating here. The Filet/ Wagyu wrapped asparagus is a must try, served on a hot rock table side where the sauce is poured at the table presenting a cool little show. Some of my other favorites are the Hamachi green chillies and just simply a chef's selection sashimi plate.

XBydFnNNDewMmt_jKcLSEA.text: Hands down the best spicy tuna roll everrrr.  Fun atmosphere, great waitstaff, awesome lighting.  :)  Will definitely go back.

50PW-cksdNZjpYcriGC20A.text: Had a blast! Made it a girls night two evenings ago. I made reservations through their website for 9pm on a Saturday night "girls night out!" It was VERY busy so I was glad I had made reservations. We were able to get seated on time, however we waited a while to get our food. There was only one person at the table who ordered Sushi so it is not fair for me to rate the Sushi even though she said it was good. The rest of the table ordered drinks and main entrees. I am not a big meat person more of a veggie lover, though I spilt a  Teriyaki Steak which included Mash Potatoes, Rice and Sauteed Veggies. Along with Tempura Vegetables. Everything was great! The quality and quantity was reasonable for an upbeat Scottsdale restaurant. Our waiter was energetic which made it more fun.   Overall the restaurant was very clean. The staff was well groomed. The scene was hip, young and vibrant.  The bar is small but very packed. Great variety of food selections for those with different food preferences and large selection of beverages. The restaurant is attached to the W hotel so you can mix and mingle in the lounge or upstairs in the patio bar.

dty7YTPHTXW2PDZ9wJFI6Q.text: Im not one to write reviews. However, the staff, the service & food at Sushi Roku was excellent. And far exceeded my expectation. First off, Stephen Dean coordinated a party of 14 for my daughters prom. He was professional, super accommodating and very nice. His turn around time for responding to emails was extremely prompt.  He created a perfect menu that all the kids would like. And made sure everyone had plenty to eat. Lastly, the service was impeccable and funny. As parents, we all know kids eating at restaurants don't usually get great service unless their parents are at the table. My daughter (who frequently dines out) said it was the best service her and her friends have ever had. The service was quick and they were well attended to. Not to mention the food was excellent. A big thank you goes out to everyone involved in making my daughters prom memorable!

RCNr9-kQIgEkjgKXQNEfzA.text: Food was ok nothing spectacular for the price. The Vegas roll was not on the menu but the chef made it for us. I do admit that was nice and it was a good roll. The specialty drinks were good as well. We were here for a friends bday and this is when it went downhill. It took 15 minutes to receive our drinks, it took so long we would order our second round before even finishing our first. Our server rarely came around and was not very educated. Sadly I am giving them two stars not for the food but for the service we received. With paying that much for a meal/drinks I expect much more then what sushi roku provided. I do not think I will be back.

VaJ4IyAoO6tzzYiKANJtKA.text: Sushi was good, our waiter CJ deserved 5 stars - he was knowledgeable and very friendly

W8dw_sh1h4Sa0sH8cZDWBw.text: Stopped by randomly for lunch this weekend with a girlfriend, and it turned out to be the highlight of our day. Our server, Rob, was excellent and super knowledgeable about the menu. He gave us some great suggestions - all delicious! Definitely try the wrapped asparagus, grilled salmon, tuna tartare, and the mochi is the perfect dessert. Everything was spot on, I couldn't be more pleased :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0Pe7Wn7cCo_4hPblJf7VXA.text: I am giving this restaurant 2 stars, because the service was amazing. The food gets one star because Yelp does not have zero stars for food. The chicken fried rice tasted like refrigerator and didn't have an Asian flavor due to the bland flavor and lack of seasoning. The sauteed brussel sprouts were really over cooked and very dry. This might have been the intent but they should go more for the soy sauce and vinegarette flavor.  We could only stomach one bite of the tempura sushi that again had no flavor and required us to request what flavor did we order. Anytime you have have to verify your sushi type, is not good.

i5lsjc_jWQFI8xFYv-ndQw.text: Not happy. Staying at The Sanctuary and  called for delivery. Ordered $85 worth of food and received enough for 1 person. Called and was told "we have the best sushi in town". VERY overpriced and poor customer service.

ceSKrUjyhu4wYyHYn9y2DQ.text: Always a great meal.  Our waiter Esteban was very personable and made great suggestions.  He seemed very passionate about the menu and the specials.  Would definitely recommend this place.  This is our fourth or fifth time coming and we will definitely be back.

dYm-sA5FGkR6aH8DsJQNPw.text: By far the worst service we have ever experienced. We will never go back. We had a reservation we made weeks ago for 12 people. Saw our waiter twice in 2 hours. Ordered a drink and had to ask the manager for it 45 minutes later. Some people got sushi rolls 45-60 minutes before others. No one ever apologized or came to check on us. Will never go back. Don't waste your time or your money.

jmIbHwKCM4dDfHsEVPtaSw.text: Not worth the trip. The sushi did not taste great for the price. Ambiance was cold. On top of that the service was poor. We had to send one of our orders back because they forgot to put the hot sauce on the side (our kids asked for not spicy). They forgot one of our sushi orders and the appetizer came after our entree. You go in happy and go out disappointed.

Eg9hllgmuQfvtV8kV99sfw.text: We had 3 birthday at the same time last night everything was awesome nice place and great service perfect hospitality but I forget to ask our servers name and her food runner they were very nice and kind and perfect service I like her smile and her patience .

7Lm-VNwZkrCYmriSAJbIaA.text: Love this place!!!  Went in for the first time and didnt know what sake would pair with our meal.  Thankfully Bianca steered us in the right direction!!!  The Albacore Tataki was amazing and the atmosphere was great.  Will return for sure.  If you go to Sushi Roku order the Albacore Tataki and ask for Bianca if you can!!!

iUn0k-NrcuvJ8RULjNYWtg.text: Just average, health inspector in which caused delays.  Would have been nice to offer edamame or something to help with the unusually long delay.  Check took forever despite very light lunch traffic, had to finally wave waiter down to ask for it.  Sushi sampler ok, egg sashimi included which shouldn't count!

eiaDVfQu1WmLGI2sLkmqAg.text: If you know great sushi, this is what You are are searching for!   They have a great knowledge of the saki and the sushi is just perfect... stick to the sashimi and carpaccio.

_b72VXpn0-ALOnFL0eFhvg.text: Extremely disappointing, I went with a party of 9 for my sister's birthday this last Saturday. Everything was going wonderful until a food runner was grabbing plates and spilled sauce all over my hair. I made it very clear that he spilled sauce on my hair, chest and shoulder he apologized and tried to wipe me down with what smelt like a dirty napkin. I told him it was okay and that I was going to the restroom, he then told me he would bring me a wet rag. In the restroom my attempt to rid my hair of the soy sauce was a complete failure. I returned to the table expecting a wet napkin of some sort that may work better than the wet paper towels but the gentleman was no where to be found, and never returned to check on me. I normally would of gone home showered and shrugged it off, but it was my sister birthday and I had to troop along the entire night (4 hours) in misery, smelling like thick, goopy, sticky, soy sauce.  Thank you so much for a wonderful experience at Sushi Roku  (oh he also spilled sauce on my friends hair so not only did he spill sauce on my hair and I made it known he continued to not be careful and spill more on my friend!!!)

9jBr_JyBjHro5kt2OqJR6g.text: I totally love the sushi here. My favorite is the baked crab hand roll I just wished they included  this one on the happy hour menu

c6rHbv4MXMuWsL2CSGgbGw.text: The customer service we got here was incredible! Came during happy hour on a slower day and the staff took the time to explain the full menus as well answer my boyfriends 100 questions about it ( we had never been here before) and all of the food was delicious! I would especially recommend the avocado hanabi!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wH7Bh6qUsot_NG4hbKiwCw.text: We went here for dinner since it's located next to the W and seems to always be hidden to me. The atmosphere was amazing. Dim lighting candles lit, very upscale, modern, oriental and there's also outdoors seating. Their food was good and the service was also good. It's a really good date place and to meet people.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Q7sqroNLlXeBtKHRm6JtXQ.text: Service here is first class, his knowledge of the menus was impressive and suggestions spot on.  Pricey but you will love every bit.  Love the decor such a gorgeous restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

m_WtYXlp-GL5ruc_HjrV0g.text: Sushi was delicious. Service was terrible. We saw our waiter twice. Had to ask 2 other waiters just to get water. Got our miso and salads AFTER our sushi. Disappointing considering there are many other sushi spots around that can surpass their service level.

4RvKW_oLFdaXF88eMOGwvg.text: Visited on a Monday evening. Easy reservations via Open Table at the time requested. Seated immediate at a dark intimate half circle booth with a view of the chefs preparing sushi. The wait staff was friendly, prompt, and put up with our sake bomb messes all night.   Food was well presented and tasty. Ordered seaweed and cucumber salads which were not the expected traditional versions but still good. Excellent Yellow tail small dish followed by various rolls. It's a fun swanky place for date night. A bit pricy and non-traditional but that's what you'd expect for a W Hotel restaurant. Enjoy!

wVWVTIraB4GVMlj7XW01dg.text: This review is tough, because I had a pretty good experience the first time and I really don't like giving poor reviews but I felt I had to share.  I've spent my time working in the restaurant world and I try to be very easy/understanding because I know it can be stressful.   First experience a couple months ago was great, I'd give it 4 stars. Atmosphere is upbeat and fun, food is creative, it was good but high priced for what you get.  I went back because I had a good time, my second visit was terrible.  Our server Michelle was very rude (we're very easy/kind/not demanding), she snapped at us, messed up the order multiple times, and wouldn't even divide a check between two couples.  Every time we asked for something she'd snap right away "NO" and acted as if we were an inconvenience.  It was really disappointing because I brought friends and bragged about the place to come celebrate a special occasion, and it turned out terrible. I rarely leave a poor review but my overall opinion is good is decent, little too high priced, but worst service I've had in the last 2 years .

YEOEDkm8XUZSSBEdY5pouA.text: Perhaps the best sushi we've ever had- rivaled only by one special dinner in NYC. An amazing experience of flavor, service and ambiance.  The main restaurant has nice ambiance but a very "club" feel with loud music so we asked to sit out on the patio where we could hear each other talk. Giovanni was our server and he quickly suggested that given some "guidelines" he'd be happy to select our dishes - a surprise for each dish, and pushing us out of our standard "Philadelphia roll" boredom. We said yes, and were then treated over the next three hours to a set of masterpieces from Brussel sprout flakes to fluke quat to oh toro to tuna tartar and more, finishing with a flourish of zen smores for desert. Each dish was presented by Giovanni with nuanced descriptions and clear love of Japanese food. The flavor of each dish built in the one before, was multi-layered and delicate- we were laughing with amazement at how many ways by the end we had eaten truffles, for example.  A masterful evening, and we plan to come again soon for sake tasting. Fantastic restaurant!

OpYXTrTiUue5ozZZwdclow.text: I went here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. There was literally no one in the restaurant. We were sat in a giant booth for 6, just the two of us, it was very comfortable. We got water right away and our waiter was super nice. The only thing I liked about this visit was the waiter. He was helpful and friendly.  The water had a horrible aftertaste to it and the people that came in after us noticed it too. If there is a problem with the water, dont serve it. The food was just ok. The kicker is when we got our bill for $60! It was lunch! Highly overpriced for the product. Probably won't go back again, but hey, we tried it.  I also want to add I am a vegetarian and the only vegetarian item on the menu was vegetable tempura for $11. It was mostly broccoli which I don't like. I ate maybe 3 pieces. The bento boxes offered for lunch don't have anything that I could eat.

Rlap4agiTApZGKcIGgIy9Q.text: Delicious sushi, lively atmosphere and attentive wait staff.  I came here with my boyfriend last week and we had some of the best sushi in Arizona thus far.  The spicy tuna roll was our fave! The atmosphere was really comfortable and the music was well-fitting for the over all ambiance.  Our server, Clayton was very attentive, helpful and had an outgoing personality.  Will definitely return and ask to be seated with him again!

1Xfcb-6Zg0C3IxqDvdjkpw.text: The staff was not very friendly, we kept having to ask for our stuff we ordered a couple of times to wait staff. The green tea was burnt so it was very bitter. The Sashimi pieces still had skin on them so eating them was not a great texture. I had one piece It was so fishy I almost threw up in my mouth. The brussel sprouts where not very tasty and greasy. The Korean bbq short ribs were so salty we couldn't eat it. They wouldn't split the bill so it made it a long difficult process for us to figure things out. The price is very expensive for service and quality. I get better service and sushi from hole in the walls. The only good thing we had was the oysters so that's why they get 1 star.

OgR1flpPkYZFCuokIeQpQA.text: Went here for the dinner the other night.  Sat at the sushi bar and enjoyed several pieces of very fresh sushi.  The Saba, Salmon, Hamachi and Halibut were very good. The pieces could have been a bit bigger, but the quality of the fish was excellent.  Will have to try some of the other menu items next time, but wasn't really hungry since I had a big lunch earlier in the day.

BtI61YhFSTfuIJw2NICOXw.text: This elegant restaurant is located in the W hotel and its entrance was a bit hard to find at first, but just go into the valet area and the door is right there.   My bf and I came here for dinner on a Friday night and it was amazing! Our server was very helpful and efficient. She was on top of things and gave wonderful recommendations. The restaurant manager even came out to make sure that we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our meal. Really classy, Seriously, their sushi was some of the freshest I had ever had! We had an assortment of sashimi. The grilled salmon was my favorite. It came with mashed potatoes and hijiki seaweed.   The creme brulee was to die for! The perfectly torched sugar gave a nice sticky crunchy bite to the creamy filling which was adorned with mixed berries. It was a pack of sweetness and tartness. Truly, a wonderful way to finish off an incredible dinner.

qADHEBpkmmEOeJsGk1fcvw.text: MY FAVORITE SUSHI IN TNE VALLEY. Dope happy hour pricing and EXCELLENT service. Stoked for half off everything this Thursday June 15!!!

3l_O_Bzy6HVioja2Fp9H7g.text: I came here with a group so we tried a bit of everything. We ordered multiple rolls and there's really not much to critique here. The sushi was fresh. There wasn't an overwhelming amount of rice. And overall, they were good portion sizes.   What I did love was this crispy spicy shrimp that they offered. It was lightly friend shrimp so it didn't make you feel full and bloated with unnecessary carbs. And the shrimp were whole pieces instead of the cheap "popcorn" type. It was a good portion for sharing and we even placed another order because it was so good!  After that, we headed upstairs to their rooftop lounge. One thing I love about Scottsdale is the dry heat. Even though it was 80+ degrees out, it was so refreshing to be outside sipping on a cocktail.  The space is huge! It's great for a wedding/group outing of 50+ people. If I worked in the area, this would definitely be the spot I'd choose for happy hour :)

3J4DV91nB-CLZsmwfoiv0Q.text: The menu had some really great looking things on it but the actual food didn't deliver.  We had...  1.  Filet wrapped asparagus - some of the lowest quality filet meat (if it really was filet) I have ever had.  So chewy and fatty that I had to spit out several pieces.  Kind of awkward when the server picks up your cloth napkin and a bunch of chewed up meat balls come flying out of it onto the table.  2.  Albacore sushi - tasted very fishy.  That's all I have to say about that.  3.  Eel and avocado roll - eel was fishy and chewy (kind of a mix between and the filet and albacore)...the rice was hard.  4.  Chicken stuffed peppers - extremely salty and oily.  5.  Truffle oil edamame - excellent!  6.  Green tea - excellent!    The atmosphere is great and it's connected to the W hotel so there is some fun people watching but don't count on good sushi.

P4I9b8rMONfhowrvlxYhQw.text: Beautiful restaurant and beautiful people in a beautiful hotel.  It's rather dark and loud, but I'm assuming that's the entire trendy feel they're going for.  Cocktails were good, I had the Pear Martini but I tried the Lychee which was even better.  We were a group of 10 for a bachelorette party, so we opted to share a ton of appetizers and sushi rolls:    Edamame:  extremely oversalted Yellowtail Sashimi:  9 extremely thin slices, delicious Mixed Vegetable Tempura:  anything fried is good Shishito Japanese Peppers: Awesome, except some of the peppers were unexpectedly too spicy Crunchy Spicy Tuna: one of my favorites Caterpillar:  My favorite (I love eel) Baked Lobster:  Too much mayo (I'm not a big mayo fan)  We had some girls that were vegetarian, and there was a ton of selection for them, as well.  Great restaurant option if you're staying in the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pbGYkuL7GEa5IpU0mLsGng.text: Had dinner here with a party of 25 people and it was an absolute disaster! Customer service was horrible and would they would not split the bill. Horrible experience for a friend's birthday party. We will not be back.

kRLHZbMi0Q4-fK4Z0ejo1Q.text: Less than Average sushi, wannabe Vegas vibe, trashy clientele. Highly disappointing. Upon ordering our server told us we couldn't order one of the items we wanted because it was no good. Another item was not acceptable to her either because it was the "cheap version" of a souped up roll on the menu (that was double the price). Our server was extremely pushy, rude and inattentive. We ordered 4 sushi rolls and water (7 dollars a BOTTLE!) and our total came to $100. We are local and never coming back!

0CvPIdVKXNyb4gw3Rgqd8g.text: Expensive and yet the food is marginally above average.  The waitress is hot and the fellas are handsome!!  All around a nice place but dam, don't try so hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fancy pants!!

cUUz2V9_4YPAjkaZysvGnw.text: The crunchy tuna was mushy so I decided to go with an even easier dish, chicken fried rice. It was over seasoned with so much pepper but some how some pieces got none of the seasoning and was burnt. They even over poured on my mixed liquor causing me to miss out on all the mango and spice that my Mango and Spice Was supposed to have. I gave this 2 stars because the service was top notch but the place was pretty empty. I won't be back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The over poured mango and spice drink.

74V50r4hSTzz1MQEUdzLqQ.text: So I came here with a friend for happy hour after wanting to come for happy hour for a long time. The deals seemed very good, almost too good. Turns out that they sort of are. They have tasty drinks for cheap, which are definitely a good deal. I had some drink that was fizzy and had fresh strawberries in it... very tasty indeed. My friend and I split two apps, the tostada sort of thing with raw sushi on it and the pork belly on top of the rice cake, on special for 6$ each. They both sounded good and were recommended by the bartender. The tuna tostada was ok, but overwhelmed by a huge amount of pureed avocado. The portions were a little on the small side. Neither of us would order that again. The pork belly thing, on the other hand, was crazy delicious... I would definitely get it again, but the portion was small... like two bites. Anyway, I would go back for happy hour, but it might not be my first choice.

-1dijslgSPhsmEKGvo3f5A.text: Hands Down a great fun place. Great food on and fusion options for sushi. Very posh, good service, but can be a tad slow on getting a drink ordered but overall great atmosphere.

bHte4dYHLXJfCQllJZSKQA.text: I've always felt there are two items that are consistent indicators of the overall quality of a sushi restaurant... saba or uni. I took the saba test and Sushi Roku got low marks. The fishier the saba generally the less awesome your sushi meal will be and sure enough, my saba was pretty fishy and the overall meal was edible, but not stellar.   Granted I was eating sushi in landlocked Scottsdale, so perhaps the joke is on me. Alas I was tired from my travels and was in desperate need of food, so I can't say I thought about my dining decision before going in.   The interior is pretty sleek (as is the decor of the whole hotel) so I'd say it'd still be a fun spot for a date. Our server was pretty cool too.   Final word: If you're staying in the hotel, don't feel like branching out, and have no price sensitivity, it's fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Booths
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside

qdrYeoU7wOg3eAv7VJq8hQ.text: Loved the atmosphere - two separate areas that are both trendy. We sat in the area with the sushi bar which was more romantic. The service was great - we didn't have to ask for someone at all (granted it wasn't a busy night).   Our favorite things were the blue fin sashimi and the knife jaw snapper sashimi. We also ordered another red snapper sashimi, yellowtail diced chilies, yellowtail roll, tako rolls, spicy octopus roll, Katana roll, and Makato roll.  We ordered the Passion fruit and spice and honeydew drink which were both refreshing. Overall a great experience, fresh fish and good service.

s9fVJq0NquRtCdW8JflpaQ.text: Overall: good but meh.  I have been staying at the W in Scottsdale for work for the past month, so I've eaten here a few times.  The sushi is pretty good, but honestly nothing spectacular.  Pretty standard special rolls.  Definitely nothing wrong about it.  I have also had the chicken entree.  The eggplant appetizer might take the cake at this place.    The overall vibe reminds me of the W hotel.  It's trying a little too hard to be trendy.  Dim lights (like, too dim... I've bumped into a couple people here because I can't see two feet in front of me.   Can I get a little more than 2 watts up in here?), modern decor, etc. etc.  It's a good go-to for hotel guests, but I wouldn't travel out of my way to go.

jkPlQOEd0aOPQcBWABVU-w.text: My friends and I had all purchased tickets for the W's New Year's Eve party and were really excited to have some sushi at the swanky sushi roku beforehand. Our server was amazing and we had a great night but sure enough two days after we have all be vomiting consistently. Although we cannot be positive our illnesses came from the restaurant we do know that we have not all shared a common meal at anywhere other than this restaurant. Will definitely not be returning. Very disappointed in what I had expected to be a top of the line sushi restaurant.

S8-ypSwK8fUuMId9UPfxOA.text: Took my girlfriend in for dinner for her birthday, the service was amazing, they wished her a happy birthday by name and service was impeccable.   The food was delicious, we had the prime rib for dinner and bananas foster for dessert  wish we could have taken pictures of our meal but it was gone too quickly haha.   Over all it was an amazing night, although it was a bit pricey it was definitely worth it for a night out.

FGyHCCMgZdvC6l2BJ30P0Q.text: While staying at the Indigo on business, I was referred to this place by my hotel bartender after I asked for a simple sushi place close by.  Simple it surely was; there were only a few people at the sushi bar and maybe two or three couples at the tables. Actually it was a bit boring, but then again, a quiet, no-frills experience was what I had asked for. Perhaps Wednesday is a slow night.  What I gleaned from my experience was:  1. High sushi quality, on par with what I have found elsewhere in Scottsdale.  2. Good service; I was asked very frequently how things tasted or if I wanted anything further. You might say this was due to the slow night, but I have certainly experienced poor service at restaurants under the same conditions.  3. Low prices, certainly relative to what you get in this neighborhood. I believe that for six nigiri pieces, a roll, and a small sake; the total including tax was $27. Not too shabby.  The high quality I had expected out of a Scottsdale joint; the high value I did not. The only reason this place did not receive 5 stars was that it had a bit of a strong smell. Not fishy, more reminiscent of fried food. Perhaps a tempura order went out of control; things happen. It was not unbearable... yet I could smell it on my clothes later that evening. Then again, I am sometimes overly sensitized to smells. Rest assured, will still go back to Sushi Roku next time.

QEoa9eC1TNcA6Tj0CaoWlA.text: Wow all I can say in 50 years of going to restaurants.  This was by far the worst I have ever experienced.  I cant even imagine or describe the pain we went through last night. This place needs to close . It is ripe for the movie restaurant gone wrong. We were seated at 7:30 for reservations at 7:15 table not clean ok not the end of the world. It took 30 minutes to get menus and acknowledged we were there then another 45 minutes to get drinks. We left at 9:45 waiting for our rolls we ordered around 8:25 PM. The W Hotel should be embarrassed to have them as a tenant. The manager assured me this is not the norm and gave me the employee discount. I am ashamed that I subjected my wife and daughter to this place. Should be avoided at all cost until they revamp close and re-open.  Rick

QiVA_hpRxv0C7gXoDLo-0A.text: After over 10 phone calls and over a month, Sushi roku corporate 310.271.6000, finally returned part of the charge. But please save your receipts folks. Had I not, I would have been screwed.   Also, I agree that the food is very over salted. No need to sauce things so heavily if you have good fresh fish. Which might be the issue.

5ZxoahrZ1zatMwkADtwv8w.text: Dinner last night a TOTAL DISASTER. Hostess overwhelmed and incompetent, not acknowledging waiting guests and being untruthful when she did. Seated over half hour past booking time. No service then for 20 minutes then another 20-30 minutes for drinks. Every table surrounding us complaining. After 21/2 hours we left without receiving our entire order. Manager FINALLY stopped by and said he would have our food served. We received about half, he comped dinner but we could not wait any longer and went home. Never again.

ySjIgwpcuiddaoAQHawbUQ.text: A must for Sushi when in the Old Town area. Great apps, fresh fish, great Saki. A little pricey but worth it

e_LocLKkO1Ktbd-v67C2qg.text: Ordered to go, food was ok. As with any sushi I am sure the food would have been better had I gone in person. I will update my review when I make it there!

Po5K19cLb2dlsjV6hSEfQA.text: The five stars is for their service and their sake, the sushi isn't the best I've ever had, but the ambiance at this location is intimate, inviting and sexy.  A very open concept with the sushi bar being at the center of the restaurant. the lighting of the restaurant focuses on the sushi bar itself,highlighting the chefs as they create beautifully plated dishes. We love the Sunday and Monday offer of 1/2 off all sake bottles! Some of the finest selections can be found on their menu.  The manager sat with us and even provided tastings of some of his favorites all because I asked, " what is the real difference between..."  in turn, I received a full lesson and explanation of the polished rice process. LOVED that!  A 5 star " as good as it gets sake bar" experience for Sushi Roku

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big Boss
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Born Gold on ice
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Extensive sake list

mVPPBx9OdipJEE0jEgM54Q.text: Sushi Roku was delicious and a dining great experience. They accommodated our large party quickly and happily. Our server Kristen was amazing! Kristen greeted us with a smile, was very helpful and very attentive to the needs of every individual within our large group!

8egWoSECBVdRX8gP8-YbPQ.text: Always love coming here! Great atmosphere and great vibe. Recently came to celebrate my birthday. Our server Kris was amazing!! She even sang a quick "happy birthday" to me when she brought out the desert which I thought was super cute, most would have just dropped it off. She continued to check on us and was super friendly and genuine. We will definitely be back!

hWXmhNhsWKwWOy3M4393XA.text: I want to give this place 3.5 stars. Please note that my Yelp rating is higher because I round up for my reviews. This place is probably the better sushi places in the phoenix area. The atmosphere is very romantic. The lights are dimmed yet there is enough light fixtures to set the mood. It's a sophisticated environment. This is the effect place for a romantic date night, a first date or a night out with the girlfriends.   I will have to say that as far as the food it's not that great compared to sushi places in Washington DC or New York. However, considering this area (phoenix or for that matter Arizona) it's good sushi. It's very westernized and not truly a Japanese style sushi restaurant. So don't expect too much. A lot of people thinking they are eating authentic style sushi in the restaurant... (that's a different rant for a different time and place...)   They offer a great listing for cocktails! My favorite was their lychee drink. Their sake is on point too. With that being said, on the weekends, this place is packed with people drinking. There are a lot of drunk people eating dinner. It gets pretty loud and hectic...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4E_zli9pK7L_EMYT4x5FEA.text: Phoenix is in the middle of a desert, but the fish here may suggest otherwise. The chef's choice nigiri sampler is as fresh as what you would find on a coastal city, and the garnishes on the nigiri are distinctive, innovative, and absolutely delicious. I also loved the Chilean Seabass and Roasted Cauliflower- two dishes I try at most restaurants I visit- and I was definitely impressed. These are classic dishes done extremely well, and while the bits at the bottom were soaked in sauce and overly salty, they were still happily devoured. Restaurant vibes were great as well-clean, modern, and a great spot for dates/business dinners/when you feel like getting fancy.

VRjPpIq4c-aXT76TFIJDog.text: Solid "meh."   I think this place definitely gets a lot more hype than it deserves.   Ambience = trendy and inviting   Mixed drinks = delicious  Sushi = bland, nothing special, & pretty limited selection of specialty rolls compared to your average sushi restaurant  I had the crunchy spicy tuna roll and it was just ok. It tasted fresh, but overall pretty flavorless and the temperature was weirdly lukewarm.   A friend ordered the Katana roll which was significantly better than the crunchy spicy tuna, so maybe it was that roll....  Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to return here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. If you want something bland and lukewarm, try the crunchy spicy tuna roll!

ud5iO0x6taUgaRaJr4u99w.text: Jacob is incredible. He was so intentive the entire night; we felt like we were his only table. I've worked in the service industry, and I know how difficult it can be. He should be awarded and recognized for his kindness and impeccable service.

ZQl9CqdXt9aruzM74NQ6Mg.text: The food is really good it is nice and upscale. My group tried it on "National Sushi Day" so the whole menu was half off which was a great deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bbq Salmon

qb7py2i-2_7OXSZn_-AtQQ.text: Some of the beat Sushi  we ever had!  Very fresh, the menu is creative, and the staff are on their game.  Definitely try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

v_HOIF1U6L4NMHOcQ4DRMw.text: This is the first time I go to a Sushi Restaurant and I love this place so much. It has such decent atmosphere and delicious food as well. The one thing remarkable was the Hakutan Ramen even though it's a sushi place tho. I'm a ramen lover and this is the best broth I've have so far. The service is friendly but little slow. It's okay since they're so busy. I'll definitely come back for more.

MhvdD8JhwpaLX55FqYwnnA.text: Wow. Great food. Good music. Decent price for what you get. The toro was to die for. The real MVP was Robert. He was friendly and made great food suggestions. A great employee who deserves recognition!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lQ1wbdElyj2P_kDv7KWG6w.text: Great sushi and even better sushi chefs. Thank you Toby for being such a good time. Loved the atmosphere and the sushi was amazingly fresh

DX_vp_V8YW5gosEF_2Ka6Q.text: Omg so cute for a romantic date. The sushi was great and the oyster appetizer is bomb.com.

-cgmRTG3510uev5__JJ7IA.text: I felt that the sushi was good quality but overall, the food and drinks are still overpriced for what you get at Sushi Roku. I tried the chef's nigiri set, which was beautifully plated with interesting flavor combinations, like shaved Parmesan on tuna and Yuzu jelly on another fish. It was good, I prefer more traditional places that focus on the fish and less so on the ambiance.   Happy hour (bar seating only) seems like a good deal here, but otherwise the extensive sake list is not that accessible unless you're willing to spend a lot more than what it's worth. I don't think I'd be back (unless with a group for work on company dime). Sushi Roku definitely has decent sushi and a fun vibe if you're looking for a more trendy upscale restaurant, but it just isn't really my thing.

2j0rTju5zpH4ZiGlRXJtqw.text: The food was delicious, and came out super fast. They seemed to time sending out the food from the different kitchens very well. Also our server, Kristen was awesome!! Made celebrating our anniversary very special :).

zeuaFMecsdnoyAcpsGjk4g.text: I've been to many restaurants, and this server named David stands out amongst the best.  Thank You

9Qv5b4c6gPN0nWGx-Rs3qg.text: My family and I have dined at Sushi Roku on a few occasions and have had the pleasure of having "Bianca" as our waitress almost every time. She has always delivered excellent service & is great at recommending items to fit our taste buds. Whether it be a glass of Kistler Chardonnay...or our newfound favorite Yuzu Salmon Roll. She even spoke to the chefs to have them add jalapenos to our roll when we wanted a little "kick." Overall, Sushi Roku has great food, ambiance, & excellent service due to employees like Bianca.

1o8R3ILS0NMzEZhSGCvhnw.text: I was recently in Scottsdale celebrating my bachelorette weekend. Our group of 14 ladies dined at Sushi Roku and all of us highly recommend the restaurant! It was the perfect place for a special night out, and my maid of honor who planned the dinner said the manager was easy to work with. He arranged a pre-fixe menu and every single dish was exquisite! Great value for what we paid. We were seated later than our dinner reservation and the managers brought out a round of drinks on the house, which went a long way in making up for the delay. Dan, the manager who took care of us, is really professional and friendly, and made sure that our group was well taken care of.   Delicious food and drinks + great service + beautiful ambience = perfect night out with my friends. Thanks for everything!

g_GzON8vo99WXb3oW91iMg.text: Came in town for a long weekend & was recommended to try this place for the best sushi. It did not disappoint! From the great service by our waitress Kylie to the awesome ambience of the restaurant we definitely enjoyed ourselves and hope to be back soon.

ZpE33FiLZQNm7tPOur4RsQ.text: Placed an order on uber eats, an hour later I'm informed it's canceled. If you're not able to fulfill an order, at least inform the customer in a timely manner

bCO85vd-L2qALm4kIR0K3Q.text: Excellent sushi and supreme service!  Courteous, efficient, and delicious. Beautiful ambiance. The happy hour Menu is perfection. Thanks Raelin. Your service was impeccable. Cheers

Txc78SzsMKIOnn7_NlGZEQ.text: Very fresh sushi. Great variety on rolls with some unique takes. The waiters are always very friendly and give great suggestions. The cocktails were fantastic, freshly made and presented great. I've been here several times and have enjoyed everything I've ordered. This time we ordered the bento box with sashimi and shishito peppers. The sashimi was very fresh and we received 2 pieces of 3 different fish. The shishito peppers and a great sauce- they could have been a little more spicy. We also did the sushi lunch combination which offered a good variety of fish and the baked crab hand roll which came out nice and warm and melted in your mouth. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dyh_h1b6fRNiCcOvVovDwg.text: I go here for lunch a couple times a month because our office is just across the street. I've tried just about every nigiri on the menu and it's always fresh and impeccably prepared. (The octopus was really tough once but that happens with octopus sometimes.) The lunch bento boxes are delicious as well.  The happy hour menu has a great selection of appetizers and drinks. My favorites are the chicken skewers, hanabi, and California hand rolls.   Overall, I highly recommend Sushi Roku if you're looking for good sushi in the Phoenix area.  I'm from Vancouver where sushi is king, and Sushi Roku is one of the few Phoenix restaurants that comes close in comparison.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. maguro
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crab sushi...always the best thing in my order!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AJYhArI6c9fH8HXAWfCbfg.text: This is probably one of the worst restaurants I've ever been in. Sat at the table for 15 minutes without being offered water or drinks, food came out before drinks, they screwed up my order and then said "it would be too much of a hassle and time to make it right again" - even though our food actually came out super fast in the first place, even before drinks - so basically screw me. My friend had food poisoning after eating the cali roll and crab hand roll. Will never go back or recommend this place to others.

6y56Gr1gr7GchBfLRZWkVw.text: Todd, you were right. This place is like a nightclub with sushi. Just really expensive and really tan people friendly. Meaning-fake tans, over priced, underwhelming.  Service was fine. Seriously. Meh

7JkKOUkTpEzIE7xCV6XlbQ.text: WOW!   That's the only way that I can describe my experience at Sushi Roku last week.  My parents were in town and I wanted to show them an amazing night and I can honestly say that they left blown away by our experience here. Neither of them are major sushi fans so to win them over is no easy task, they are already talking about making it a tradition to eat here.  From the minute we walked in the door we were treated as royalty, being greeted by the manager (Mike Kirsch) from the get go is a refreshing change of pace, he assured us that if we needed anything we would be taken care of. Mike checked in multiple times throughout the night to make sure everything we needed was being addressed and of course, it was!   From the second I exited my uber to the minute I walked out the door we felt special, which is not typically a feeling I have when exiting a restaurant but this place is truly amazing.  I'll be back soon! Mike Kirsch and our server were off the charts, I need to get that mans work schedule because anytime he's there you are sure to have a world class experience.  Thanks to everyone at Sushi Roku in Scottsdale for an incredible night!

3XsGCO2FBRhZTNzUGu3gVg.text: My daughter and I visited Sushi Roku for dinner and we had a wonderful dining experience.  We loved the atmosphere, food, and service.  Our server Klayton was friendly, charming, knowledgeable, and very professional.  We highly recommend this restaurant!!!

OaFqUuCN1IgRDmgw7Ku-cQ.text: Went in the other night to check this place out with my wife, hands down best sushi in the valley.  The manager brought us an order of their Pork Belly on top of crispy rice, the sauce was amazing to compliment such a well rounded dish.  Energy in the building is awesome to see in person.  The sushi quality is like nothing you will find in the valley.  I forgot to get our servers name but she was a lovely young lady!  We finished off the night with after dinner cocktails, the list gave us quite the choice to pick from.  I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a good sushi dinner.  Amazing.  Keep it up!

IgxCz6rLRv0y2ktqg1J6Mg.text: Amazing food and great atmosphere! Sarah was above and beyond accommodating.  I can't eat gluten, which makes sushi restaurants next to impossible. Tons of GF options.  If my table ordered something not GF Sarah made sure to let me know as it came in. She was so kind and made this experience truly something to enjoy! Thank you! ( five times, Mike! That girl needs a promotion) ;)

Xba32TBpNJQOhyLG7nVXOA.text: Sushi Roku is easily the best sushi spot in Scottsdale. In addition to the wonderful flavors, the service is top notch. I'm writing this review because our server, Jon, gave my friend and I astounding service. He gave us a variety of recommendations and really helped us through the menu as it was our first time. All of our food came out perfectly and tasted even better. We will definitely be back soon!

maacQzlcpAQ-mus0XMTJhQ.text: Grade A sushi quality.  A few specialty rolls...outstanding. I came for lunch. Pleasant staff though service flow was rushed.  I detest all courses being delivered at once.  Other than that the dishes were beautifully prepared and presented. I'm really a fan of the crunchy spicy tuna roll!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

CuWRZnIh3aCdX7B1PP7EBg.text: Ambience is nice, great music and decor... Located in the W hotel. Sushi is a bit pricey but very fresh. Menu is confusing and not much explanation is given. Alcoholic beverages are great as well, I ordered only 1 pear martini and it was STRONG!!

6D3vJa7dcBYNsy54l3L7gw.text: Pretty good drinks, but FUCK the wait for the table and the extreme douche crowd. Yuck! Food is alright tho.

e-uEK9dLOrKGqBLS92LM9A.text: Yum, nice ambiance , Dan is the best really makes sure your visit is right. I come here often. Logan is the greatest , very attentive . Friendly.

O0zC17wmp5H5n7hmBcITSA.text: Unfortunately our experience here didn't go well. I'll start off by saying the ambiance and food is great and there is so much potential. The staff however very rude and degrading. First off in case your not used to it make sure you know they serve free tap water. Hostess makes it seem like regular water but charges saying it's bottled. Water had no ice and was not chilled if there wasn't a need for ice. 6$ water. The waitress made us feel like we were too poor after I asked for tap water and was not friendly. Staff stared at us after that repeatedly. Left feeling in a bad mood. Food is great. Go for sushi. Not the service.

Oz-bCuVApp1bP4qAXuC1WQ.text: Great spot to end a wonderful girls trip in Scottsdale!  We came on a Sunday night and were all pleasantly surprised when we found out that Sunday was all night happy hour!  Woohoo~  We ordered a variety of rolls and nigiri specials, they were all delicious!  A couple of stand out menu items also included the tuna tartare crostini and the kobe beef sliders.  As for drinks, the strawberry fizz and pear martinis were both delightful.     I honestly don't get the negative reviews, my girlfriends and I had a great dining experience.  I liked it so much that I wished there was a location in the DC area.

2JmEqhZqKdveMyy0bQMWzg.text: Prepare for long waits, being ignored and incompetent staff. Food was good but between screwing up my order (they gave me a menu that was no longer valid so I waited twenty minutes for an order that never came) and a bartender who ignored my existence, never again.  Updating. The manager comped my meal and the food was good. Upgrading to three stars until I try again.

OHPpyvuAVmzdStlVInMBug.text: Food was tasty but not outstanding. You're paying for the upscale and  trendy atmosphere (though I wouldn't expect any less from the W hotel).   Fellow yelper Dorothy C. and I came here for the lunch specials.  We shared the sashimi salad which came with 6 pieces of sashimi, iceberg lettuce, and ginger dressing and also split the bento box with miso cod and veggie tempura. Servers are very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. sashimi salad
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. miso glazed black cod
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. bento box with miso glazed black cod &amp; tempura

gaOdLGfK6_czScSC6bPZHg.text: We ordered the Japanese peppers--so great!!! I could've ate the whole thing!! We had a number of rolls that were all good, but my favorite would have to be the spicy tuna roll. One of the rolls that was ordered wasn't favorable so the management made it up with additional rolls. Awesome location in the W and close to great night spots in downtown Scottsdale. Will return!!

DvB0eCUdkYeZfbk4kRRiDw.text: If I could give zero stars, I would.   I came here with a group of girlfriends for one of their birthdays. Each time we ordered a new glass of wine, it took at least 20 min to come out, one of our appetizers was the very last item to come out (about 2 and a half hours after we ordered), and the wrong order was brought to our table at least 6 times. We had to wave down multiple bussers just to get any type of service, and although the manager comped a round of drinks, both the server and managers seemed to want us to just get frustrated enough to leave.   And the cherry on top is that we refused the dessert that we had originally requested since it was a birthday celebration, so instead they brought us a round of shots. We didn't ask for these, nor did we want them as all we wanted to do was get out of there and end our terrible experience. The entire tray of shots was spilled on one of the girls at our table, and to our party it was hysterical after the horrendous dining experience we endured, however, the person who spilled them should not have been laughing like he was.   Our entire bill should have been comped and I probably wouldn't be writing this. I reached out to the GM, and gave him a chance to rectify this situation but apparently he could care less about his customers experiences just as his employees. It's no wonder where they get it.   All in all, I would never recommend this restaurant, or go back. If you want mediocre sushi and terrible service then you'll probably be fine, but I expected much more from a restaurant associated with the W hotel.

tqzto3kxcq6L7RTM1w9lRg.text: Located at The W Hotel in Scottsdale, AZ, Sushi Roku is a hip, lounge-y, fun Japanese restaurant.    I had the pleasure of staying at The W for a training seminar I was attending and my coworker and I were addicted to Sushi Roku as soon as we got there.  We ate at this restaurant on 3 different occasions and were never bored with their food or atmosphere.    We tried a few appetizers; spicy edamame and a shrimp dumpling soup which was to die for!  So flavorful, I could have eaten just that...but ofcourse it didn't stop there.  We also had a few of their speciality rolls *don't remember which ones...sorry, as well as some sashimi and the Miso glazed Sea Bass with mash potatoes...yummy!  All were very good and I would have again, but I have to compliment the waitstaff, bartenders and manager who made a lasting impression.  We dined at the bar our last night and everyone was SUPER friendly and made us feel like apart of their 'Sushi Roku Family'....you guys rock!  Till next time...Irrishai-mase!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chilean Seabass

8aB62jCFT986U4tG5WbIwA.text: Sushi Roku stakes claim to an amazing ambiance. The modern vibe and styling of the W Hotel that Roku is located in, carried over and translated very well into the restaurant. I loved the upscale and hip vibe! My party and I decided to each order a roll... We're from California and are spoiled with our fresh seafood. There was a question mark on how the sushi in Scottsdale would compare to that of the bay area. Everyone was VERY pleased with both the portion sizes and the quality. The lobster roll was a table favorite. For dessert, we ordered the dessert spring rolls. They were amazing!!!!!!! Um... think spring roll filled with berries. banana, and paired with vanilla ice cream. Now, imagine what heaven would taste like, and there was our rolls!  Next time I find myself in Scottsdale, I would absolutely return!

MAdFBffIIRvesMPxEIsH4g.text: The sushi is good but the service is below average. Drinks are way overpriced. Service is SLOW. Atmosphere is good.

MZWMEEMr4MnJnd5XmViUlA.text: Best sushi house I have been to in town. The noise level was quiet but not so quiet where we could hear the table across from us. Our waiter Tim was fantastic helping us choose several kinds of rolls and sashimi, Tim even brought the food out over the course of 30 minutes allowing us  to savor the different flavors and have them smoothly blend through out the meal. Aftwards we were treated to a lovely frozen lemon tart and finished with a warm hand towel.

SEwrfihT5XJxPywT9n-Hgw.text: Well, after being in AZ for the week and being pleasantly surprised at the low price of our restaurant/bar bills, we finally ate/drank a $200 meal. Hubby insisted on trying a sushi place in Scottsdale because of the sheer number and high rankings. I dubiously complied. While you won't find anything exotic or too creative, you will find a solid selection and freshness as long as you remember there's no ocean front property in AZ. The sushi chef was a young man from Japan and the waitress was super nice. The restaurant is located inside a W Hotel with a corresponding atmosphere. Here are the turn offs: 1. I caught something moving out of the corner of my eye on my chopstick. I chased the bug down under my plate and didn't know what to do but smash it with my napkin. I did not want to look too close, flagged the waitress down and she took care of it wiping down and replacing my dinnerware. 2. Shishito peppers are drowning in a sauce that is overwhelmingly sweet and even more overwhelmingly salty. The menu does not indicate they are in a "sauce" and I expected them sprinkled with sea salt as I've usually had in other places. 3. I had the great misfortune of being seated where I had a bird's eye view of someone who was obviously a regular and her dinner companions shoving their tongues down each other's throat. Sigh, judgmental yes, but just not what I want to see while eating dinner and nothing the restaurant can do about that. Keeping in mind the context, if we are ever in the mood for sushi in Scottsdale again, we would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shishito pepper drowning in an overly  sweet, overly salty sauce.

1YRIHA0BBljt28i9QI17Bg.text: Was very happy with my sushi - great fish quality. And fun/different rolls. The waiter suggested some of the daily fresh nigiri specials and they were delicious as well.  I think the hamachi was some of the freshest tasting fish I've ever had - I could have eaten it until I exploded!  And not going to lie...was not so sure about ordering sushi in the desert :)   Their bottles of bubbly were decently priced and they had a good selection. I LOVE the sushi and champagne combo :)   The waiter was very attentive without being bothersome, even after it started getting more and more crowded. It did get pretty loud toward the end of our meal but it's in the W so not surprising.   I would definitely return.

r8u6qhGMwTovG__YOSbLVw.text: Review is for takeout only: -called at 615 on a Sunday to place a takeout order and was put on hold for 10 minutes before the hostess took my order -was told my food would be ready in 35-40 minutes -I arrived at the restaurant 45 minutes later and waited another 20 minutes for my food (which was just edamame, brussel sprout chips and two sushi rolls) -stupidly did not check the food handed to me as I was in such a hurry to leave, but they gave me a shrimp instead of eel roll -will never order takeout here again

38YDtL1YvDjGNaf-8fSknw.text: Great find for us only being here for 2 nights. Probably top 3 sushi I've eaten. Adam our server was excellent. Recommended some great dishes. May even come back tomorrow night to try rest of menu.

2p0LgVgrwbculanef0qyXA.text: Our waiter sucked. Never told us his name never once smiled. Continually pressured us to order our full meal right away. The restaurant wasn't even busy. He also disappeared for long periods, yet other tables had attentive staff waiting on them. Once he found out we weren't ordering cocktails he stopped trying altogether. The food itself was nothing in particular either. Same as Roka Akor sushi wise. The food wasn't as good as Sumo maya though. Overall massively disappointed in the whole evening (especially considering a vey basic roll was $18.50, we had two appetizers and two rolls coming to $80) and won't be going back.

9C0y_LK5HOaNSm6ve2DbjQ.text: Wife and I visited the W Scottsdale for dinner, it is a party scene, restaurant is quite loud and happening. The sushi was really good. The service was a 3 of 5. Bachelor parties next to us, some real broskis looking to get turnt! Food was really good though, if you are looking for a party scene with good sushi this is your spot, not a quiet dinner with your grandmother.

XWDNLejt2a5sWRdRe-Jewg.text: Solid spot, crystal makes great drinks. I stay down the street but this sushi spot and customer service will Make me change my hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JRW4fLiFdCOx_K0FREDtlQ.text: Atmosphere was great.  Made a reservation and was sat immediately.  I ordered the garlic edamame, which was amazing! Also ordered the baked lobster roll...excellent.  Overall great experience, drinks came out quick, and staff at the front desk were extremely friendly.  Only thing is our waitress could have been a bit warmer....seemed like she had a lot going on personally and didn't smile nor was she friendly enough.

8it_QNewZGg5SkqdQlYK_w.text: Living down the street we stop by for happy hour a few times a year.  The spicy tuna and salmon rolls both cut and hand are superb.  Other appetizers such as pork belly, Kobe beef, hummus, and fried chicken are also good.  It is not a cheap happy hour but good food is not cheap.  The Japanese beer is a great change of pace.

BETDP4C2XIymB3VwIz7hKw.text: Awesome i an extremely picky on sushi ant Roku is top notch. Service was great and manager made sure we were taken care of.

IP_fTUhy9wIcP-2CRpmJ0A.text: Anytime I am in Arizona I visit Sushi Roku it is a must for me. I love how friendly the staff is but most importantly LOVE Dan the GM, congrats on the promotion Dan you more then deserve it! Today I visited Sushi Roku Scottsdale looking forward to the food, friendly staff and of course seeing my favorite person Dan who sadly wasn't there at the time but still myself and company enjoyed ourselves. The food was amazing as always and Sarah our server was phenomenal, she is so genuine just all around an asset to the company, I also had the pleasure of meeting the manager on duty Steve he was also great and very sweet! Steve had heard about my horrendous Experience at the Sushi Roku in LA ( Santa Monica) as that is where I reside and took care of our dessert as he felt horrible knowing what my experience was like at the Santa Monica Location. I was thrilled to know there was one in my area, I talked so highly of Sushi Roku Scottsdale to friends of mine and told them there was one in Santa Monica and decided to show them what all the hype was about, only to walk out embarrassed as the Santa Monica location was just terrible the service was awful and the food was less then mediocre the menu also wasn't completely the same, they didn't have the miso glaze popcorn shrimp tempura ( which Dan got me hooked on it's seriously amazing) and they didn't have creme brulee. So all in all I have come to the conclusion that if i want Sushi Roku with high end level of service, amazing food and phenomenal staff I guess I have to drive 4 hours to get it! Sorry I missed you Dan but your staff most definitely kept it consistent even with you not there major kudos! Until next time! -Ashley

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. It&#39;s dark in there so use flash! Always a selfie!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pinot Grigio of course!

MjsY2tijyKapNQNY8D_iBQ.text: What a phenomenal sushi experience! My first time here and with an awesome well versed sushi chef Aaron. The crab roll and dipping sauce melts in your mouth. The Gensai, Katana, Senshi and Tuna Jalepeno roll were all delicious. If you have a chance, order the hand rolls and ask chef Aaron what he would recommend -he won't disappoint! It was also a delight to see Ben Le- a familiar face as well who keeps good company and is talented with his chef Sushi knowledge as well.

vEuvkAi3DeZ6KcwoWGZvLg.text: came here last week with one of my girlfriends for an early birthday dinner while we were both in town & had an amazing time! Our server was Kris, she was so cute & courteous. We are both servers so we can be picky about the service we receive but she was spot on & gave great recommendations. We started with the roasted cauliflower, & shared 2 rolls: the katana & the gensai (which Kris recommended). Both were amazing! the fish was fresh & the gensai roll was perfectly spicy & so refreshing. She also recommended the Yuzu cocktail which was excellent and so different ive never seen anything like it anywhere else. At the end of the night, even though we decided against dessert, Kris brought us the chocolate lava cake since it was my birthday. We had an amazing experience thank you so much for making my birthday so special!!

wDf1q1ymiiC3agH3CWbSdw.text: Fantastic experience. This is a classy place with good ambiance, mostly friendly staff, and delicious dishes. While significantly into the pricey side, a great place to take a date or a business dinner. It's dark, you're not sitting right on top of the people next to you, and it's not too noisy.

0LWlQmhZMfk2RkZpnqJ2Yg.text: Once of my favorite Sushi restaurants in Scottsdale! Never disappointed, amazing service, great atmosphere. Highly recommend

nMDQhn7D-QkkNAb2cf-eFw.text: Mia was an AMAZING waitress!! This was our first time coming and she made our experience thee absolute BEST! The food and drinks were amazing and so was the service. Everybody from the host to the staff bringing the food out! Simply impeccable!! Thank you Sushi Roku!

hG0dEwITBBnwHhTHA4s0vg.text: My guess it deserves a much higher star rating, except for the terrible service. That is the shame of the industry. As it has such great ambience and I can see where there be a draw but it took me a half hour to get served 10 pieces of sushi.  The waitress she was very sweet I didn't get any alcohol just got water in it was refilled wants the sushi was very good but they were small portions.  I guess since it's in a hotel this is it would be referred to as the touristy place and I don't think I would be returning to have sushi here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sushi great, service........ehhh
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sushi great.......service eehhhh

RJ6XghFyTYyO22z3R9OyNQ.text: Deliciously fresh and creative twists on sashimi et al. Friendly staff. Very much a date night place, but it's the quality of the food that's its selling point. Along with the helpful and friendly staff.

hciuYyDGI4Iqhjhr7NiviA.text: I would have given 3 or 4 stars (longer than expected wait, strange kitchen closing and fire department issue), but Kris and Guillermo made the evening worth it! Thanks for a great experience -- and good sushi :)

7NkNShG4p84BR7Gl2xJ9oQ.text: Great food, great service! Came for dinner and had such a wonderful experience thanks to our server Kristen, she's the best! Definitely coming back.

DdKySBGNmK7xo5gEeeybew.text: If you're looking for a place with a good vibe, rich ambiance, good crowd, and delicious cuisine this is your place to go. The food is tapas style so you can order a lot and share with your table. Also, the cocktails were very enjoyable, especially "the ish"

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The ish

9N_r1-Jm-VMlikY2oX3Krw.text: Looking for good sushi in Scottsdale, word of mouth and other Yelp reviews brought us to Sushi Roku yesterday. Quickly seated, our server Rob recommended the poke bowl, which I ordered. It was delicious. My friend had a cut spicy tuna roll, which was also perfect. My iced tea was always full. Rob was attentive without being intrusive. I will absolutely be coming back when I'm in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EhsBy6lbc_ZrwABP8LY70A.text: My wife and I went to Sushi Roku for our anniversary.  The food was excellent and the service was even better.  Our server Sydney made our anniversary very special.  I would definitely recommend going here for any special occasion!

IF1FkZIB5ACP_4A2hgX6Pg.text: 3 girlfriends and I had dinner here Saturday night, no occasion, just celebrating a girls weekend. We had a cute booth with a good view of the whole place, right in the middle of the fun. We ordered a carafe of sake and Sapporo. Really tasty and fairly priced. The food was amazing! We ordered edamame, Brussels sprout chips are amazing and buttery and crispy- loved everything about it, a few different sushi rolls and potstickers. The potstickers weren't my fav., but everything else was delicious!!   Toward the end of the meal the waitress brought out a few yummy shots, on the house, as well as a yummy dessert! The hospitality was unexpected and a nice treat! It's a great ambiance/environment for a girls night out, birthday or just a date night. Staff was friendly and food. Mae out relatively quickly.  My only minus star is for the bathroom :/ it is so confusing to find the men and the women. They share and entrance and then split off, but there is no sign to which side is which. So i definitely walked in on a man peeing. There is also a shared sink/wash up area, which I'm not a fan of. Privacy and separation is nice.  Otherwise, great place!

lYO2J4VP1MZHMOQdgtKwLA.text: Alex the bartender was amazing!! He made my drink just the way I like it and he kept them coming. Every time my drink was running low he would ask if I needed another! That's what I call a True bartender!!

eXx8iZW56sHCahvXrNCmXA.text: Schyler and Kris were wonderful, great food and service. Highly recommend the Chilean seabass and A-5 wagyu. Party atmosphere and great vibes! Right in the heart of old town!

7tmn9ynWqWhmIyUoR77F7A.text: It was a great, fun, very lively atmosphere. Sat at the sushi bar and the food was amazing. Baked crab with champagne butter (still drooling) The food was amazing, the chefs were excellent but the waiter was incredible. So friendly, so prompt and very helpful with our first time at Roku. Everyone at the sushi bar could not stop raving about Skylar's service. Please see to giving recognition to Skylar, as he went above and beyond!

VA06V98Os1IwJ1rrvjTWpQ.text: I was recently part of a massive party that was fortunate to have Kristen as our server.  She created the most fun, laid back, and curated experience for us.  We opted for "family style" and in a group of 18 that included vegetarians, pescatarians, gluten-free, dairy-free AND a pregnant woman, Kristen made sure to provide options for everyone.  She was on-point from start to finish and delivered a stress-free and intimate experience at Sushi Roku.  I highly recommend requesting Kristen for large and/or out-of-town groups!

tlE1UaQ72s7rMmh__4qusg.text: We had a premium dinner for a large group, and Kristen our server killed it! She handled the menu selection, made sure our entire party (including several dietary restrictions) was taken care of from start to finish. Highly recommend!

Hy6bTlCRAAvQuTNqZu7FAQ.text: Love this place. Lisa and Lee ( bartenders) are so amazing. Every time we come here (usually once or twice a week) it never disappoints. Great food and great service. If you're ever in the area and crave top notch sushi this is the place. I love this place

6pfowQCfgW8BDiqcd0yftg.text: Food is always phenomenal.  I just ask the waitress to have the chef surprise us.  I come here everytime I have a client meeting.  This time I had the pleasure of meeting Daryl.  Daryl was hilarious and extremely attentive.  Great job Daryl!!!!

vCSZZVfvjO48Cf90Q7p8pw.text: Have come here a number of times and always great sushi.  We have always stuck to our usual orders but chose to venture out tonight with Julia as our server.  We couldn't have been more pleased with both her suggestions and her service!  She made this the best experience!

7gHBQZxGAe41B7EJ0eRGQw.text: This place are boom I just love everything here the sushi are amazing will come back sure

k4GOMc4TuGVl0tpRYocEGA.text: I ate here a few days ago and I need to admit, the food was great.  It was a friend's birthday so I expected to blow it out. I regularly eat at higher end restaurants so I expected it would be somewhat expensive since its in the W hotel.  To start I must say, the food was all delicious although the portions seemed smaller than typical for sushi restaurants.  We were suggested by our waitress that" usually" she picks the menu based on a few questions she had for us. Of course you know in that situation it's going to be more expensive.  We ate had sake and beer and it was great, until we all said we were done. Our waitress dropped off another dish and said she had already put the order in before we told her we were full.  Of course we said it was fine.  Then 10 minutes later another dish shows up.  At that point we objected sending it back. I think we were all surprised when our bill was just under $800 for the 5 of us. Maybe I'm just out of touch with high priced places but that's just too much for what we had.  Of course we paid and took care of our waitress but I don't see a return trip anytime soon.  I think I'll just go to the French Laundry in Yountville, CA next time.

yIZvXVGgSVcK_BcbdCq4kg.text: Oh where do I begin ...  So we arrive -- 10 min before our reservation time of 9p. We didn't get seated until 40 min after the hour. To be squeezed in a booth -- set up for 6. Although our party is of 7. Asked for an additional place setting 2x before received.  The waiter, an underaged looking young man, id's us after getting our drink order, and takes 15-20 min to return with said drinks. And serves us tap water after clearly stating bottled.  The food... Sushi- subpar... The entrees- burnt... He said it was "smoked" ... Yea no, it's burned buddy. Drinks - weak! The people... So, this woman has her child.. Yes child ...  sitting at the table with underwear and no shoes and she's making out with this gentleman while her child is damn near naked. (Side eye) Shall I say.. Never again!

KY2_zkb4-z8NwgHudIKR-w.text: Swanky looking place inside the W Hotel --- ooooh...ahhhhh!  Let's check out the exotic cars parked outside -- ooooooh...ahhhhh!   Let's try out the food............ ..... ..... ..... ..... ..... .....  Pretty cool place to hangout if I wanted to be seen with cool crowd I guess (my mom said I was cool....) I didn't think their sushi and rolls were to too exciting. I guess they had to please the crowd and what's hip and cool.  The only thing exotic is parked outside, not on the menu.  Pretty basic and mediocre at best. Nothing I haven't seen.   Service was good overall and attentive.  Ambience is like a lounge and smooth.  I felt like I back in Hollywood Blvd hanging at Katana's. - Enjoy

CJyzUtVER1www7Dnu_RmXA.text: Great sushi place, probably the best in Scottsdale.  Great ambiance and design, good service and great manager.  The W is pretty much always on point with its restaurant partners.   Try the diced Chilies and hamachi. Amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Diced chilies on....something.  Delicious.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Z1EFOtbQFo0mRuDRefNXuA.text: The service was decent however the food was horrible. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday the sushi was so fishy he couldn't even eat it. I got a California roll it was soggy and poorly prepared. We have had better sushi from Fry's supermarket I am giving one star for the birthday ice cream dessert.

fN5GzMTQT2XjEvq2KaU3WQ.text: I recently took my wife to Sushi Roku for a long overdue night out. Several friends highly recommended this restaurant not only for great food, but for its outstanding customer service as well. Although the bar was set high from the outset, both my wife and I could not have had a better experience.  We were not that familiar with Sushi, or many other items on the menu. Fortunately, our server Nicole, did an unbelievable job in clearly explaining everything to us and even made perfect recommendations that made our dining experience top notch. It was almost like she knew exactly what our taste buds would prefer.   No more long delays in taking my wife for a romantic night out.    Sushi Roku is now a scheduled weekly destination.  I'll be sure to ask for Nicole as our server.  So nice when your server is as helpful and pleasant as her.   I'd recommend Sushi Roku in a heart beat!

JpHaLnr7v3ZgTz_nSatnSw.text: Came here for a birthday party of about 20 people.  The sashimi was so small I ate all 4 pieces in one bite.  After that disappointment I got my sushi.  I got the jalepeno roll.  Wasn't very spicy.  All in all average sushi.  This was a birthday party for 3 people I will add and by the time they brought out the birthday cake over half the party had left as we had finished our meal about an hour prior and there was only a handful of people left.  At the end of the night the wait staff tried to charge us all for items we didn't order which included $65 dollars in bottled water.  After we disagreed we asked to speak to a manager who shrugged the whole thing off and walked off during our conversation (possibly to admire his over priced suit in the mirror) leaving us wondering what the outcome was.  About 20 minutes later we decided to finally leave.  Not paying for overpriced bottled water.  This place is probably perfect for you if you want to get drunk and go upstairs and listen to horrible dance music after a average to below average meal

6xdbhXVLpek7SrHt62mvjA.text: Pathetic service. We made a reservation for dinner this evening at 6pm. 90% of the seats were open in the restaurant when we arrived. They seated us the worst table in the restaurant. They refused to move us to another table when there were plenty open.
