This is so unusual where in other restaurants if you don't like being squeezed into an undesirable place, they move you on request. We left without having dinner there and went elsewhere . We would never consider them in our future dining plans. 100 Rotten tomatoes.

9joSZo8gS1ULsQMK5vNE-Q.text: Had a late night snack as well as breakfast while staying at the W on a business trip. Both in the evening and morning, took the staff nearly a half hour to serve me after ordering with very few customers while the food is great, service needs to improve.

Haiea5d4ZQsxQ9SJwsEKTw.text: We were at the w waiting for Gretchen rossi's fashion show to start when we decided we would get something nearby to eat. Roku sushi is connected to the upstairs pool area, so we walked down to see if they could fit us in. It was very busy as it was a Friday night. However the hostess was able to find us a table outside. The servers and server assistants were all very helpful. We ordered drinks as well as the sushi for two people platter. Three people asked to take our drink order and three people asked if we received our order. The sushi came out first which raised a flag to ask where were the drinks we ordered.  When we finally got the drinks everything else went smoothly and the sushi was very good. The server also took it upon herself to surprise us a molten chocolate cake dessert for our wait on the drinks. Very kind and generous and I appreciate the empowerment. I know things like this happen, so I was very impressed she went beyond the call of duty to keep a certain level of service. I would say this was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sushi for two
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Molten chocolate cake

zreOyAlRE7MlPsccNA8QGg.text: For an establishment as highly ranked as the W Scottsdale, I was very disappointed with the food at the pool and the breakfast both served from the Sushi Roku kitchen.  The food was unpalatable, over garnished with lettuce, and sub par for a restaurant anywhere.  When I returned my food I was told that they know that the "huevo ranchero is bad, but you know how proud chefs are of their food..." Huh! Interesting...

mGc2jSMBUgxZ-ov2_3LlGg.text: I would have given a higher rating, but after the waiter spilled a pitcher of ice water on two of the guests at our table, in front of a manager, and no one even acknowledged the incident.  (Management and service seem to be the consistent reason for poor reviews.). I just can't imagine why I would recommend anyone come here.  Oh and FYI, I posted the same review on OpenTable and it never was shown.  Apparently they don't post unfavorable reviews for the restaurants they work for.  So if you are looking for an accurate rating, don't trust their system.

vVLxkxzVOeGe-ub2qVNgMw.text: Moving from Santa Monica to Scottsdale had its drawbacks, one concern being my access to high quality, fresh sushi. It goes without saying that the food is exquisite from the menu staple items, to the daily specials, and the sake selection! All of the employees are knowledgeable and friendly as they guide you through the menu to ensure a perfect meal. The team is lead by a great manager, Mike Kirsch. I booked a New Years Eve dinner at Roku for my girlfriend and I. Needless to say, it was extremely busy. Mike took the time to swing by my table several times to check on us and step in with refills and food drop offs when the wait staff was tied up. He helped make New Years a perfect evening! I've been back several times since, and have had the pleasure to meet the other manager Dan who hosted a business meal for me. Dan held the same high standards as Mike and guided us through a fantastic evening. This is by far my favorite sushi spot in town for any occasion. Don't miss out!

_MEff_L7ynEPlc83piWT4g.text: Kinda pricey but food is amazing. Located on the first floor of the W Hotel in Scottsdale, this is the best place for Japanese food.  Very well presented but of course the prices are a little higher than I like to pay for Sushi.  Very dark atmosphere but that goes for the entire hotel so it's no surprise the restaurant is dark as well. Very comfortable seating and great service.  The waitress always was attentive to my needs. (and attractive too!) Since I am only here for work I try to take advantage of the immediate area but I always end up back at this place.

irNjSuPoh6KzxSpxUlNwHg.text: Best sushi ever! I have not always been a fan but our waiter knew exactly what to order for us. The prices are up there but worth it for the quality of fish. Our waiter Jon was super friendly and knowledgeable. Can't wait to go back!!

oobpVO04eq1peR2wQ10QMA.text: I first ate here two years ago and thought it was very good.  I love the Sushi Roku's in Santa Monica, Hollywood and Pasadena.  My recent lunch there surpassed all of these and any expectations from my first visit in 2010.    Here's what I ate, all prepared by a young sushi chef named Moon, who is in my book a rising sushi star:  Uni sushi - this was two pieces of uni of the highest quality, sweet and unctuous, simply perfect  Spicy scallop hand roll - sweet and fresh scallops, so fresh they were almost a bit crunchy when bitten into, and the sauce was subtly spicy, but not overly hot.  The nori they use here is of the best quality - it crackles when you bite into it, but does not shatter.  Eel and avocado hand roll - Uber-rich, sweet and addictive.  The avocado was at its peak of ripeness, the eel sweet and almost melting, and the sauce, which Moon told me was cooked down from sea eel, lent a sweet and an umami flavor to this wonderful roll.  Baked crab hand roll - My favorite dish of the day.  Beautiful crab (it tasted like Alaskan king, but not sure), baked with garlic butter and wrapped in soy paper.  If you love crab, you MUST order this.  I need to have it again.  So good.  Service was great, I  enjoyed speaking with Moon about all kinds of food topics, and the sushi bar is a pleasant place to while away a midday hour.  I went on a slow Sunday afternoon and am so glad that I did.  It can be quite a scene on weekend evenings (lots of pretty blonde women in tiny black dresses), but come for the food, too!  Highly recommended.

wyEAZckKWGGvGLyGat5bKA.text: A perennial guest at the W Hotel this is the only dining option... Consistently disappointed in the lack of attentive service / food and beverage wait times. The focus on the "scene/crowd" overshadows all else and is definitely not accommodating to the solo female business exec based on my experience at the bar/high top section.  Recipe for satisfaction = (- expectations + patience + sugar daddy)

bsQtIfroY4RCguXmjRz7lg.text: Overpriced and average food.  The service was surprisingly slow for the restaurant not being busy.  I doubt I will done there again.

a7P3wQm7NL4H8g1PoNQP3A.text: Great service and great food.  I was in a party of 6 and we were very taken care of. The server was super nice and made the best suggestions. All the staff was fast and efficient, being able to clear plates as soon as they were empty. Refills were promptly taken care of too.  Food we had: - 16 piece sashimi of various fish, some were first time tries for me! - Brussel sprouts. They were super savory with bacon pieces, yum! - shishito peppers, delicious with a little kick at the end - tuna carpaccio was flavorful - yellow tail sashimi with diced chilled, super tasty with the sauces! Reminded me of carpaccio  - king crab handrolls were exceptionally good. I loved the butter dipping sauce on it. They bring out kind of last to coat your palate better.  - beef wrapped asparagus was really good with the teriyaki sauce and cool hot stone on the bottom - we had the flute sashimi special that came over ice. The dipping sauce had a little bit of a kick but it went really well with the cold fish. It was hard to take off of the lead though :(  Dessert: - we got the platter to share that came with the lava cake, creme brulee and a banana egg roll. The creme brulee was really tasty and not too sweet. The others were okay. I wish the lava cake cake with ice cream though to balance the chocolate in the middle. - we also got mochi. You pick 3 flavors and the ones we got were red bean, green tea and passion fruit. These were tasty but melt really fast! They cut each one in half too so it's easy to share.  Wine on Sunday as well as sake were all half off if under $130 so we got red wine and tried a sparkling sake called Pouchi Pouchi. It's a bit dryer with a hint of sweetness.   Bathroom - my coworkers told me the men's restroom has a picture of a lady looking at your package in there.. Seems interesting! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. From left to right: Brussel sprouts with bacon, 16 piece sashimi and shishito peppers.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork belly over crispy rice

jk9_Nn73KG4Nj3OK-LsroQ.text: To start, the atmosphere is definitely a 5. Well decorated and definitely buzzing.   So why 2 stars you ask? Well here we go, We made a reservation for 2 for New Year's Eve some time ago and we were seated literally right at the entrance door at a high top table. Ok so still not a 2 star problem right, yeah it keeps going folks...we are down to 4 stars now.   So second the food was good, not what I expected from a restaurant at a location as this. When it couldn't fit on the table, the waiting staff didn't make much effort to make room but rather just left plates angled on top of each other. I like to give solution and not just complain, so what I would do is maybe give a little more time between serving dishes or make efforts to make room for it so things aren't spilling. Ok so we are down to 3 stars.  Now here's the kicker...the drink order we put in as the first thing...never came...she didn't even come check on us once the entire time. On any day but especially nye, not acceptable.  So there you have it, 2 stars. Pick a better place or come here for the hustle and bustle and no cares about service.

biTe4hfWlo_Oy0nsGmyQqQ.text: Always a great meal at Sushi Roku. Good cocktail list and delicious food/sushi. Our waitress Kris was very helpful. Some favorite dishes -- miso eggplant, popcorn shrimp tempura, spicy tuna tempura roll and katana roll. Also for drinks -- try The Ish.

QmlahJFP3pClfG-1twapuA.text: Menus online are not the menu inside. The menu inside is well over priced. Be prepared to argue to get what was promised online. Food mediocre. Bar manager was crass when I called her out. Will not go back.

qN4oQFD7isyWcdMrGzJYiw.text: There is a great vibe here! When you go request James. He took his time explaining saka to my GF and I so we could make an excellent choice. The food was great and James's service made it even better! We will.be back for sure. Definitely check it out the next time you are in Scottsdale!

eq_70NnygF3y8xpm98olHQ.text: Food was okay, went for happy hour and the menu was very limited and serving size was not a lot at all. I am not sure how the regular menu is but usually when I go out for happy hour at home "San Diego" the portions stay the same as the regular menu but the price is less. I am not sure what their usual menu's like but I hope it's better.

a-lCwduJ7qK4JVAJ0czX1g.text: We happened to have dinner here 2 nights in a row. The ambiance is young, vibrant, cool, and "clubby," not by chance, as Sushi Roku is part of the W Scottsdale and is adjacent to the hotel's trendy night spot. The food was consistently better than average: both nights the waiters suggested their version of chicken tenders as a house specialty, and both nights we weren't sure why. Some items were pretty good, like the sea bass and the spicy edamame. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. It was pretty good; I would just warn any serious foodies that they may be a little disappointed.

R2_HAbf33rCotEgCKCywDQ.text: One of those places where you're paying for the ambiance. I am a die hard Nobu fan and sushi lover so I was really excited to try this place. But everything just seemed to be a miss. Their wagyu gyoza were pretty good but nothing to brag about. I got the king crab chef's special roll. For $27 it was whatever. Garlic aioli on a sushi roll is a little much. My girlfriend had the white lotus roll and it had a really weird smoky flavor. The waiter forgot to put my Hamachi order in so that took forever. It was good but the sashimi was paper thin so again not worth it. Not worth the money. IF I ever were to come back, I would just try sashimi and nigiri.

vzCLPy8oOK7q0Vhn1LlgLQ.text: We ate here late one night after we checked into our hotel. The food was delicious. We decided to go the non-sushi route and started with the house ginger salad and the avocado hanabi; the hanabi was like a delicious avocado fri, is there was such a thing! We also shared the spicy ramen, which was some of the best ramen my husband and I have had. If we went again, we would order all of these again!

ZheQ81bQceOAmzSvfV73rw.text: I come here a lot to eat with friends.  The sushi is always amazing but...  The service is terrible.  It will be dead and the service is still terrible.  Takes 30 mins to have someone come to your table after being seated.  Then 30 mins to get water.  30 mins to bring your drink.  Dishes left all over the table.  They bring a dish all the old dishes I have to hold them while they place them and give them to someone.  I'm always dressed up.  I risk getting my outfit dirty being their buss boy.  We started to order 2 drinks at a time when we go now.  To be paying $800 and more every time we come to get sushi service should be amazing.  This has been going on for years here.  Hire a top of the line restaurant manager and servers and more help.  Such a great location and food service is ruining your restaurant.  Get it together and fast.

aJmzbFAYrztVGOgEwFZkmA.text: Atmosphere here is definitely a 5, especially if you like the swanky/loungey type place.   Service was decent.  However, considering the atmosphere and the price, the food does not come close to matching. We started with the shishito peppers and the tuna rice cracker, which were both pretty good. Then, we had 2 rolls, which were unnecessarily jazzed up with extra sauces/oils and the flavor was fair at best. We also had the ribeye, which actually was quite tough and fatty and pretty low quality considering the steep price.  All in all, this place is a nice destination if you are seeking atmosphere; however, if you are a foodie and are expecting a quality meal to match the steep price, you may be sorely disappointed.

YDVHAJacbvhPB65LPBawtQ.text: Alex was amazing. His sake and whiskey knowledge exceeded expectations. I am very familiar with classes of sake and the bartender knew even more than I did.

dy2M6KyM0RkB-eSr7ykeoQ.text: This place has a great mix of fresh sushi and cooked options! Located in the W hotel, it has a great date night or happy hour atmosphere and the staff was extremely attentive and friendly. We ordered the Katana and baked Lobster roll along with the wagu gyoza and loved everything! They also had a great selection of mixed cocktails and we both enjoyed our selections.

kgwCD_Rj_zXDYu7jcZ1Nsw.text: I'll preface this by saying that this location is inside the W Scottsdale, and I ordered it up to my room. That being said, I wouldn't think it'd be too hard to get a bowl of spicy miso soup and 1 sushi roll executed, but I'm not sure of the quality and/or freshness (you are after all, in Arizona). The sushi had a very fishy smell yet no real flavor, and the soup was lukewarm and also lacked flavor. Clearly not worth the surcharge let alone regular prices, but you live and you learn. I think this sushi is best served in their dark swanky restaurant where you aren't that concerned with what it tastes like. I made the mistake of turning the lights on...

Kez-nmIlKQIWmGm1ShGYFA.text: This place is AMAZING!! The sushi is 10 out of 10 ! Tony ,rob , Martine,  ! The whole squad is exceptional and the atmosphere is incredible !

iFv5yeqEd-Tg5RlRQIwLCA.text: Your treated like a king in this spot amazing sushi and Toni,Rob,& Martin treat you right and make you feel right at home

kj0Lhnl-b1SEkvH9iWnngQ.text: Best Sushi in Phoenix by far, and great service to boot. Even just basics, yellow tail, etc, are phenomenal and there saki menu is comprehensive. The baked hand crab roll is amazing, especially with the dipping sauce.

pO--5KfIEtpB8jtup5Ql2w.text: Do not come here with a large group. I give three stars only because our wait person was working really hard.  However, she was our ONLY wait person. She waited, she ran out food, she ran our drinks and she bussed our table. Not cool when you're rolling 20 deep.  The food was ok. Many items, like the chicken dish, were under cooked. I know it's a sushi place but chicken is chicken and is usually cooked, even in Japan.  The rolls were good but very slow to come out.  Basically they treated a large group of high rolling business people as a group of 20 somethings.  I don't recommend this place. Just go somewhere else especially with a large group.  FYI, we made reservations a week in advance so they knew we were coming.

08drLbJw7x8qpfIWrKTtlw.text: Alex provided an exceptional service. he accommodated our group and made us feel welcome. I will highly recommend my friends and family to come see Alex specifically in the bar. I will be coming back specifically to see Alex W every time I'm in the area #liveyourbestlife

gtpUvEaICHjwQ19QwQJ00Q.text: I came here on a Sunday for lunch around 1pm. I felt underdressed and... um... out of place even though nobody was there except staff. Wait, this is Sunday afternoon, right?  My server was pretty good. He was very attentive and nice. Even when I wanted to order something special that wasn't on the menu he went and found out what they could do (I wanted a crunch roll, which they didn't have the little, round, crunchy bread things).  The sushi was average. The water was... questionable. It tasted like dirty tap water (and I say this as someone who has never even asked for a lemon in their water and grew up drinking well water and untreated water all his life). The couple that walked in later after us also commented on the water being off. So if you plan on drinking water, plan on drinking bottled water.  The place is pretty cool. I could see this being a banging spot to bring that hot date you've been hankering to impress. It is like two rooms both with very large, nice-looking bars. Who knows, maybe it is even a club at night. I could see that - this is Scottsdale, after all. And part of The W, also.  Prices were pretty high (+50$ for two people, no drinks, 4 rolls).   And with that said, I feel like I'd rather come here and party than eat sushi. The hot GF agrees.

zatajdc4eRKyCv9o6bLPbA.text: Grabbed a light snack before The Mavericks show at the Livewire and I was impressed. Happy Hour has a stellar menu and its prices are amazing. The Kobe Beef Potstickers were crazy good, and every piece of sushi was fresh. Looking forward to going back again

_HjtPKZ-ny-QjuqaT1Ojeg.text: I've been to Sushi Roku a handful of times and I LOVE IT! The restaurant is stunning, the staff is extremely friendly, and the food is absolutely delicious. The manager is AWESOME as well. I recommend this place to all of my friends and family.

si9KP1bfe9RPLg0EBgjGeQ.text: Some of the best sushi rolls I ever had! The service was great our servers were very attentive to us like some sushi restaurants this belongs up there! We were welcomed by the host I wish I could recall both the server and host name too bad I forgot it..oh shucks...but I would just like to say they were great, but when compared to the sushi restaurant I went to in Dallas the service is just down 1 level which is still good. Although it's a casual place it's a great place to eat if your traveling around all the states like me! The fish was fresh and was prepared very well, and the crab tasted awesome! The drinks came out in a timely matter as well. If your looking for a great place for a date or just a quick dinner this the place. Also don't forget to make reservations this place is packed! Overall I would recommend this place to anyone.

D9A-acpfHWYCJHiKOroBFg.text: Came here with my fellow Yelper Miss Lisa E, and very much enjoyed this upscale, fun, trendy restaurant.  Located within the W Hotel, makes a great spot for happy hour with friends, or a date night. The way the food is prepared, makes typically "scary" sushi a lot less intimidating for sushi rookies like me who don't typically eat things like octopus, eel, etc.  Everything I tried was quite delicious. I would suggest the fillet wrapped asparagus, and pretty much any of the rolls. The service was impeccable, its almost as if they knew we Yelpers, but seems like they are just that good! Looking forward to coming back.

DlEGx9e3BypkhSoAHDjHKQ.text: When I think of Sushi Roku, I am indifferent.  You know... that feeling... the absence of any emotional reactions.  For me, the dining experience involves so many things. And usually that precedent is set from the moment you walk up to the hostess stand. WHY is this an undervalued position at most restaurants? PLEASE, Sushi Roku, do not put someone at the front desk that cannot seat people properly. After two strolls through the dining room while walking back to tables that weren't open...not once, but twice... I finally asked to just stand where I was until they could find me a seat.   Maybe it was a bad night for them, who knows. But, if you read my reviews you'll see I'm an overly friendly yelper. The fact that I actually got irritated and let the hostess know I was frustrated speaks high volume.  Moving along, the food was great and the server was great. This wasn't my first time here. I've eaten here several times, including breakfast a few times. The  Dishes we had:  Organic Garden Salad - Delicious! Mixed Vegetable Tempura - Broccoli was the best American Kobe Potsticker "Gyoza" - Loved Baked Lobster Roll - MUST TRY! Salmon Sashimi - Maybe wasn't feeling the sushi, just OK  And if you like pear, don't skip the Pear Martini! Garnished with Parmesan Cheese! Amazing flavor and plus a little antipasti bonus.  I've yet to have a full experience at Sushi Roku, but that doesn't mean I'll stop going. It might be one of those ongoing hit and miss situations - I just keep hitting the miss. Looking forward to the hit!

vBLDcDcb7-vbb4lbWqfqQA.text: Nice food and drink selection. Loved the ambiance. Good for a night out on the town. Located inside the W hotel. Valet parking available. Get your ticket stamped by the restaurant. It reduces the cost of parking.

Fw-FMVMaT5KX6Xd03TYncQ.text: Went here for dinner with some girlfriends on Saturday night. It has a nice clean and trendy atmosphere with some tasty bites. It's a little pricey, as are most decent sushi restaurants. Their cocktails are yummy, I had a refreshing St. Germaine, as well as some miso soup and veggie tempura (not a fish person, ew).  Good place for girls night, or dates. If you're a resident of Scottsdale, they even feature a "locals discount" certain times during the summer.. Thumbs up to management!

mvKlal4o9KlBitC6XBaENQ.text: Went to Sushi Roku tonight with my family from CT and had a great experience.  We had Rene as our server and he was fantastic.  He knew the menu, was able to answer all questions regarding gluten free and vegan items, made great suggestions for the dietary restrictions and got everything right!  There were 13 of us yelling out food orders for rolls and appetizers and nothing was missed.  Our drinks were promptly refilled, table pre-bussed, set up nicely for dessert and everything was absolutely delicious!  Sushi Roku doesn't fall short in any regard...great ambiance, upbeat music, good energy, superior service and amazing food.    You can certainly tell that the management is exceptional!

ZbY1bs4Xc0oIwYcx9BvliQ.text: Excellent food in every category....FRESH and delicious, presentation and exotic selection. I love the yellowtail sashimi style YUM and the grilled asparagus & steak....yes you can have steak there too. I took clients to dinner and our server CJ was brilliant guiding us through the menu and making recommendations. Also, Cody the manager made sure we had everything we wanted. The head chef even payed a visit to our table asking if we enjoyed the food, and yes we did!! The restaurant is a winner for impressing your clients or casual night out with friends. You'll love the ambiance too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mk

IYkeeVVSr7Hf5tX3hB2XFg.text: My husband and I went to visit friends in Scottsdale arizona. We always like to try new and different restaurants. We decided to go to Sushi  Roku and meet up with friends. The fish was of high quality and everything was fresh! The atmosphere was very unique, loved it. We had the Toban Yaki which was very expensive but it was worth the money. The premium tofu is a must-have and the spicy tuna was great. We had Nicole as our server. Nicole was very knowledgeable and her personality was lovely. When we asked for suggestions she listened to what each one of liked and she went from there. Everything Nicole brought out to us left us with big grins. Very tasty! Great job Nicole, we will be asking for you and learn more about the menu.

ouPESaTW0SQvQktJCONjdA.text: I have been here from day 1 to present.  The food has remained good, I feel like the specialty cocktails are missing their mark though.  Their selection of sushi is good, but there are a few favs. they are missing.  *can't remember their actual names* Some of the dishes are fabulous like the beef wrapped asparagus but, their tofu sampler (cold) was not good nor flavorful.  When I come with my foodie friend we just tell the sushi chef to prepare some great sushi (omakase style), they make a specialty roll for me & we order our fav hot dishes with some nigori sake.  It is always great this way... however, I don't see the bill and probably wouldn't want to.

AzNBMwGA5x2HuUXVB_mHMg.text: I recently spent the better part of a week at the W Hotel in Scottsdale.  Of course I picked the coldest few days seen in recent years in Phoenix!  Very happy to find that the "hotel restaurant" was Sushi Roku!  I'd been there once before in LA.  Some highlights....  -- very creative, out of the box options -- extremely knowledgable wait team -- impeccable service  A few of my favorites that our group enjoyed....  1.  Black Truffle Tempura Handroll  2. Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus 3.  The triple desert sampler (chocolate "lava" cake was awesome!"  While it wasn't cheap -- it was well worth the cost.  I knew it was pricey when I walked in, but the amazing menu, outstanding wait staff, and quality make you forget about the price!

xpZFfdIwq7_wCo1MplOW9w.text: Wish we had tried this restaurant for dinner instead of dashing in for breakfast.  It is conveniently located and promoted within W Hotel.  However, we did...  Other hotel guests were here, but the breakfast was just awful.    Muffins laced with preservatives and sticky, like the ones you find at convenience stores.  Bacon stiff as a dead stiff.  Redneck toast - skinny, white, and tasteless.  Service was rushed and inattentive.  Except for the beautiful surroundings, this is a place that is unredeemable for American breakfast.

n5qIIOsf2I9GlEIFkwR1fg.text: Kyle H. is amazing - request his section!! Came here during their anniversary week, so 50% off all food... heaven!! Kyle was attentive the entire meal and his recommendations were amazing! Shishito peppers, yellow tail app and crispy spicy tuna on point!! Fun atmosphere and great food!

UIOofD9m1mdK5DDnLzd0Cg.text: One of the best dining experiences in a long time. The food was excellent but our server Sarah stole the show. She is extremely knowledgeable and very personable. Highly recommend!!!!

wYBKakR4P1N7mYH4VW39Ng.text: Love the atmosphere of this place. Fun, exciting, and beautiful. Great for a romantic dinner, nice dinner meeting for business, or getting some food before a night on the town. Our server Sarah was wonderful. Helped us order things we would not have ordered ourselves but knocked our socks off. Her food and beverage knowledge left us wanting for naught. Come in, ask for Sarah, let her take you on a magical culinary adventure as she says. You will not regret it in the least.

7WdaxUxN1gHnwTr7ejLneA.text: I come on in with my girlfriend it was  nice welcome then our server came over did not ask how are we or any thing did not give us his name he just came up and ask "what can I get you" in a really downward voice and then I ordered a beer and a long island I'm half way down with my beer and he take it without asking me if I was done and he never came to check up on us. I felt like he could have been more friendly and kind to me and my girlfriend he could have started by saying "hello, I will be your server tonight what may I get you two tonight" instead of "what can I get you" and have less of a mean look at us and what got me off the most was can you even pay for your drink all because I ask how much it is that really get me mad

GDdLL2KLLxMTOwcjzezztA.text: Went here for the first time last night. The katana roll was FANTASTIC - my new favorite!! Perfectly made with the perfect ratio of fish and rice. We ordered the lava cake, which was really good, too, but slightly overcooked (crispy edges); the sake bombs helped us to overlook that :)  TIP: Dress to impress on weekends

DdBVnSrizjx-3nHecgyvyA.text: Great food and had an incredible waitress named Nicole. She gave solid recommendations on the food and was a very down to earth person. I will definitely come back to this establishment!

W3QmwFua0ndsOPdBlO70Vw.text: If I am in the Old Town area of Scottsdale mid-day, this is my go-to lunch spot. It's never loud at lunch and the atmosphere is totally different from a dinner service there, far more tranquil. It is a place I meet clients for lunch frequently because it is never louder than a dull roar.    For lunch, get one of their Custom Bento Boxes. In the bento box you get to pick two options I get mine with Chicken Kara-age (which I think tastes somewhat like KFC, minus their extra grease) and sashimi which is six pieces consisting of two of each of the following fish, yellowtail, salmon and tuna. One day they were out of regular tuna sashimi and they had to give me fatty tuna (Toro), what a fantastic mistake that was for me and my happy tummy.  I think I read someones review that called the place a "hipster hangout" I've never heard a more inaccurate statement made about this particular establishment. Hipsters like PBR and indie music, all they will get at Sushi Roku is a Sapporo and some fantastic yellowtail. I would call this place "hip" though, the decor is very intimate and interesting, especially at night and they do a very good job of being trendy which of course attracts the people that want to be "seen". What I mean is Hipster, no. Beautiful people and wanabees, yes. Having said that, I do not think there is a restaurant I have ever seen more actual celebrities at in Scottsdale than this one, recent spottings include Kristen Schaal and Rainn Wilson.    For dinner appetizers you can't go wrong with the yellowtail with diced chiles or the hanabi. For mains you can do the "omakase" at the sushi bar if you've got the deep pockets and adventurous appetite or just stick with the ribeye with Japonais sauce which is an umami overload!

2LLuIfTZwCMza8K8SEqiUw.text: Love sitting at the sushi bar, the chef's are always super friendly and really fun to watch. The urchin with the quail egg is a MUST for all you sushi lovers.

Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HzB07qy-S9p8IhKTnE98iA.text: My friends I recently went to Sushi Roku after discovering them on the Whistl app for iPhone. We got there at 6, just in time for their happy hour! We were blown away by the ambience of the restaurant, it was modern, but had a timeless sense of class.  We stuck strictly to the happy hour menu, which features 30+ small bites and drink, including sushi rolls. We started with Edamame Hummus w/ Wonton Chips ($3). It was  justt the right consistency, and very refreshing. The edamame and wonton chips were a nice addition that gave this mediterranean dish a fresh asian twist. We also had the America Kobe Meatballs ($4). They were deep fried, but not greasy at all. The dipping sauce was also an excellent paring with the meatballs. Next up was the Hanabi for $5 (Spicy yellowtail on crispy rice). This was by far our favorite. The crunchiness meeting the soft texture of the sushi was out of this world. It was one of the most unique dishes I've ever had at a sushi bar. We also got A Spicy Yellowtail roll and an Albacore Salsa Roll ($3 each). Both were excellent, exactly what'd you'd expect from a cut roll. To top it all off we got the Bana Berry Spring Rolls ($3). The crunchy exterior meeting the sweet, soft center was excellent. The drizzled caramel on top made it only more perfect.   Overall we had a great experience with the food. We would highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys asian cuisine. Also, if you love finding deals like we do, you should definitely check out the Whistl app on the App store. Free to download and no signup!  Enjoy Fellow Foodies!!

5DYk4puIJ26rUO5gv5pgnw.text: This place is great. Definitely order the spicy hamachi appetizer. Sushi is some of the best I've had in a long time. Highly recommend.

69-39KtKKKq9ANGQ44Jn_w.text: Incredible food, amazing service!  Braised short ribs are to die for, king crab special with champagne butter is delicious!!

n45gCrOrAn7XQMWlfylTYg.text: We were looking for a good sushi happy hour in Phoenix and decided to try Sushi Roku - it did not disappoint!  Walked into the restaurant at 7:30 and it was busy, but not crowded.  Patrons ranged from a group of business associates to an 18th birthday party.    To partake in the specials, we sat in the bar area.  Our server was extremely pleasant and attentive throughout the evening.  We started with the Sushi Roku vodka drink special, a Kirin and a cold sake.  ($3 for sake and $4 for the vodka)  Sake was unfiltered and slightly sweet - we really enjoyed it.  Could have done without the vodka drink, which was way too sweet and seemed nearly non-alcoholic.  Moving onto the food... we ordered the miso eggplant, which for $3 was delicious and a steal.  Also tried the spicy yellowtail roll (average), tuna tartare (slightly below average - was practically minced and not well seasoned) and the Kobe meatballs (great).  Walked out with around a $40 tab and very pleased with the experience.  We'll definitely be back, as there were plenty of other specials on the menu which we didn't get to try.

-vLR-hRpFyCub_FBdxsMmw.text: Had dinner and service was a little slow BUT justen with an "e" had jumped and saved the night by getting the service jumping and he made up for it with great service. Food is excellent too

vxVzqUwI7rYuhp2QsJVy6A.text: We were staying at the W this week for a local conference, so decided to eat here on Sunday night. We live in San Francisco & love Roka Akor, but wanted to try something different. We loved it! The yellowtail sashimi was melt-in-your-mouth delicious & all the specialty rolls we had were great too. And oh! Don't forget the toro tartare! Ermegawd, I was in heaven. The waiter we had was super nice, very attentive & even scored us a free dessert, as he overheard us mention our anniversary was coming up in the next month or so. Sunday nights are a great time to dine here, as all wine & sake by the bottle is 1/2 price! So we had some sweet M &C for a great price. In addition, on Sundays in their bar, they have an all-night Happy Hour stating at 4pm. The drinks were tasty, albeit kinda weak ( not a surprise) but the food was really good & generous portions for only $5 per plate. So we came here after a day of lounging at the pool..then went back to our room, napped, showered, came back for dinner 4-5 hours later. Good times. :)

ufWAAfqeIQKUYOkWiK28kw.text: I lived in NY for while before I moved here to Scottsdale. Sushi Roku makes me miss NY a little less -- not just b/c of the cool decor and the semi-fancy without being too pretentious ambiance, but b/c the food is really good and the manager and chef are extremely friendly and genuine, which is how they are in NY. I don't go out that much, so when I do, I want it to be a relatively meaningful experience. The food is amazing -- MUST get the popcorn shrimp app which is the most elegant lightly fried shrimp I've ever had. The sushi rolls are great. Try not to get a super young server, there's one I won't name who kind of sucks. Other than that, it's a great experience.

kH5r-mGEZO9kczry7Sp3ag.text: OK so where do I start first off the place looks cool and has a really truly awesome assortment of food on the menu. Plenty to choose from including carpoccios which are my fav.   I ordered the   tuna carpaccio = the fish was sliced too thick and had what tasted like a salty bottle bought ponzu. Dont order this if you want carpaccio   Yellowtail carpaccio = delicious sliced thin and had the oils and herbs perfect. A good size too.   Miso soup = the same as everywhere else   The Katana roll = dude this thing is freaking amazing but for 16 bucks I dont know soo good though.   some beef wrapped in asparagus= soo bad I took it back   Spicy Tuna was over minced like mush   All in all the meal was good but for 70 bucks I left hungry and pissed   The waiter was soo weird and creepy. I was there with my gf and a friend and he asked my friend if she was having a rough night, WTF!!! Dont ask a girl if she was having a rough night. Might as well said you look like shit. So weird.  Oh and the fact he only talked to my gf when he was addressing any of us. Talking to him was like pulling teeth soo damn weird.   I did go back a second time and had good food and a waitress with a name with like all syllables. I wish I could remember it because she really is the best

JdKsvcSYRQgnMAia3Fsq7A.text: This one is hard. The whole place is conflicted between excellence and douchetasticness.  THE GOOD (aka: the food) If you've been to another Roku, or even a Nobu, the menu will look familiar, as will the prices.  The sushi selection was pretty deep, with a good specials list, and lots of options. All the fish was very fresh, and as good as you can get in Phoenix, unless you're a regular somewhere else and get the special stuff. My benchmark for this is 'saba'. Usually, if you're not a regular somewhere, you get the dried out, pickled-herring tasting stuff. But Roku sent out the good stuff. Moist and delicious.  The sushi rice was excellent. Some of the portions were a bit awkward, with the rice ball minimized maybe to make the top portion seem larger...? But very good. I would sit at the bar next time.  The hot and cold plates were of the standard "inventive new japanese" type, but very well executed.  THE OKAY (aka: the bar) Decent selection of beers and sake. Some frou frou specialty cocktails. But if you can't make a Vodka Tonic, you're fired. That wasn't tonic. Sent it back, came back again. Not tonic. 1 of 3 things going on here:  1) waitress screwed up twice (doubtful, she seemed competent and sober) 2) bartender screwed up twice 3) tonic is on tap, and tap was screwed up and only delivering carbonation and no syrup. if so, the bartender isn't checking the taps - see #2 above.  I like a Vodka Soda too, so I let it slide and didn't send it back again.  THE UGLY (aka: the overal l experience) Normally, a W hotel is a chill spot in every city. You can count on upscale and relatively low key business/pleasure travelers, great service. Cool vibe. But I'm afraid this W will be plagued by the same velvet rope bullshit that haunted the James and Mondrian when they first opened.   We scurried through the lobby and were greeted by a nicely scripted hostess (who knew how to work the reservations system), and an Atlantic City magician in a Sushi Roku host's suit (who didn't know how to work the reservations system). Guido act in full effect. At least he didn't punch us in the face or anything. Probably not fair to judge him. I'm sorry. He's probably a nice guy, but the demeanor doesn't fit the place. I would be floored if he could point to Japan on a map. Or if he punched me in the face.  The decor is very upscale, modern and generally over-the-top, but well done.  Then as we get escorted in... Host bellows a Jersey Shore approximation of "Irrasshai!", to which all 3000 or so staff bellow back "IRRASSHAI!!!" This happens EVERY FUCKING TIME a new party is seated. The only thing louder was the table of seemingly underage rich kids getting hammered for someone's 19th birthday. "We're bombin, dude!" I think "bombin" means ruining both your sake and beer by mixing them in the same glass. The table was out of control and acted like they were at a Super Sweet 16, but were not approached by mgmt, as far as we could see.   Elsewhere, cougars on the prowl. Some horrified rich people. And some troubled foodies.  OVERALL The food was very good . The experience was pretty cheesy. Some of the staff must find it hard not to chuckle when they're trying to prepare and serve A+ dishes. They need to tone it down to keep a return business. The sake bomber crowd isn't gonna keep coming back at $100/head, and fine diners don't want their conversations (and even thoughts) drowned out by Vegas theatrics, unnecessary "security" and obnoxious guests. The servers are very young and inexperienced, and still in script mode. They need to be able to read when a table doesn't need to be taught about a menu. But I imagine the ones who make it will relax and hit a groove if management lets them.  We'll head back to the bar on a week night, as far away from the "show" as possible, and enjoy some sushi.

Z3hUIJvVKIQEriEngTSYQg.text: This was hands down the best sushi I've ever had. The sushi was cut to perfection and melted in your mouth. No need for soy sauce as menu items were paired with sauce to complement the entree. Yellowtail carpaccio was EXCELLENT!  Service was great too which is important to me as it can ruin any dining experience.  Will be back!

wLgoy9ChOKutTww53ABqHw.text: I failed to find any flaws in my Sushi Roku experience last weekend.   The designers of this place had a clear vision of what they wanted in mind, and they executed it with complete, meticulous precision. You can dislike that vision if you want, because you hate Scottsdale's douchebaggery or whatever the case may be. But then, I would question why you'd bother to come here in the first place.   The environment was typical of W's I've seen around the country: upscale, chic, a bit clubby, all the things that attract male douches and female hotties. The service was professional and prompt. The sushi was the best I've ever had in the desert with the glaring exception of Yasu. The bill for four of us was well over 200 bucks before tip, but we left happy because we got what we paid for.

c9M0UWrfPuNi_b95JDYoAg.text: We are regulars at Sushi Roku and had dinner there last night; as always the dinner was amazing.  The restaurant has great atmosphere and the management team is fantastic.  If you are looking for suggestions on Sushi rolls, just ask.  They are always spot on.  Stick around after and have a cocktail and listen to music in the bar next door.  The Katana Roll, Baked Lobster Roll and the Spicy Tuna Jalapeno rolls are a few of our favorites.

zRMuqEYTLVwAhsfef6gA2A.text: Delish!  Well, this super cool spot was my favorite sushi spot in LA, CA and now they have graced Scottsdale!  I would compare it to Asia De Cuba (but better - not trying that hard) and decor blows ADC away!   Very hip and not too crowded (yet).  Hope it can keep a trendy feel (while still remaining sophisticated).  All sushi rolls were great and loved the Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus (very tiny, but tasty) Loved banana desert & signature cocktails.  The decor is amazing.  Upstairs bar with pool is pure eye candy.  Love the red shades.  A back drop for a great night out for sure.  Service was AMAZING.  Hostess was friendly and professional, GM came to our table - very cool and nice.  Waitress rocked - what more can I say?  LOVED IT!  Going back again tonight!

eZTYw17RJC2uaQ-MzMQK8A.text: Came here for lunch today. Was a little disappointed in the service and food. The restaurant is connected to the W Hotel in Scottsdale, great location. The interior of the restaurant is really nice and modern. As for the service, the waitress took about 15 minutes to come by the table to get our drink order. Once she did, it took another 10 minutes for us to get our drinks. We then ordered the food. She brought out the first order of suchi and had forgotten to bring our edamame for our appetizer. We then asked her for it. Then she brought out another dish and forgot half of it. We then sat for another 15 minutes before any other food came out. I asked the waitress what was taking so long (since there was only 2 others tables in the entire restaurant), she said that everyone was ordering sushi and they were busy. That wasn't the brightest response because 1 we are at a sushi restaurant, so of course people will be ordering sushi, 2 she only had 3 tables to wait on. Once we did get our sushi, the rolls fell a apart. So it just seemed as though everything was just not up to par, especially for the amount of money you pay.   As for the food itself, we had the following:  Spicy Tuna hand roll Softshell Crab Roll Rock Shrimp Jalapeno Roll Cucumber Roll Kobe Skewer  The food itself wasn't bad, it was more of the experience that wasn't great.

vWus3rIZR-mCZ39URLIq-A.text: My relationship with Sushi Roku is a love hate thing, from beginning to end. I went with a group of 7 friends on opening day and we were able to get a reservation simply based on our positions at various hotels around the valley, and saw a 30 minute wait after our 8:30PM reservation, which was ok seeing as they squoze us in. When I pulled up, I was amazed at all the vehicles in the valet lot, so I kept driving and parked around the corner. The place made me feel small from the beginning!  The entire space is beautiful and very well done. It's hip, yet upscale, and a very fun atmosphere. The servers are very friendly even though some of them are not fully trained in the restaurant. The food I had was delicous. Tuna on fried brown rice cake was delicious, as was the salmon and toro sushi. The yakatori sticks were very bland and almost seemed as though they were done with a greek seasoning, rather than a sweet Japanese. The food did come out quickly, even on a day when the place was packed way over capacity. Drinks, however, were not so quick. I had 2 greyhounds @ 14 each and I swear neither of them had any alcohol in them and have heard similar grumblings from others as well. I have to assume their bartenders have previous experience from other places, but it didn't seem as such. I heard a LOT of smashed glasses as well. The whole night seemed like a mess for them.  The restrooms were very cool, if not a bit confusing. They told me to go in through the door to the restrooms and I saw a lot of women standing around and figured I was headed for the womens room. But infact the men and women share the communal sinks and waiting areas, but have their own bathroom area, which was different. I feel the atmosphere was definitely typical Scottsdale but a little different in some areas where it was obvoius they put some neat touches in it.   I had one major gripe with the place, a little out of the restaurants control, was the overzealous attitude of their loss prevention department. These guys thought they were professional bouncers at Las Vegas night clubs.  We had been going back and forth between the restaurant and the lobby all night with no problems. At one point a big black guy said I cant come in, and this was after my whole party just went in front of me. I said "look count chocula, I've been in here all night, and all of my friends just walked by you. Don't stand there and tell me your hands are tied or you are over capicaty or something like that, because I know it is bs. I'm going past you." His co-worker came over and told him to let me in. The guy would have beat  me into the ground if he had wanted to but it worked out.   They need to get their security department going in a proper fashion, and work on the bar quite a bit, and the place will be a real winner. I'm sure that it will come with time, so I'm giving it 4 stars under the assumption that it is going to improve in time.

VcZtOb1xjP7KtEWz4UsPmQ.text: My whole night at Sushi Roku was full of "I should have known better...."  I should have known better to not trust the front desk folks at my hotel to make a restaurant recommendation..... should have  trusted YELP  I should have known better that trendy and hip don't always equal quality dinning .... should have consulted YELP   I should have known better ... when the hostess tells you 30 minutes for the next table and you don't get seated after waiting for a good 45 minutes, its time to get the hell out ..... YELP would have saved me   I should have known better .... when you're waiting for a table and you see a sea full of empty tables that the restaurant could care less if you are waiting or not ..... god YELP me   I should have known better when the restaurant never seats you at a table, keeps making up excuses as to why you can't sit down, you find a bug in your drink and they only comp you for part of your bill .... its time to give that place a big YELPIN review  Ok so bottom line ...  Sushi Roku is a trendy place in Scottsdale, its kind of hip.. but again you're in Scottsdale   I should have known better and left restaurant after being told it would take 30 minutes to get a table.  But instead I decided to take my chances and that was my bad.   The saving graces of the night was my dinner party, and the very helpful and wonderful waiter STAN.  Stan allowed me to give Roku an extra star.    Sum it up: Roku ain't worth it... move on

XZbZzGyXwSqUdPhwwL-etQ.text: I have died and gone to sushi heaven!  The irony is I happened to eat sushi earlier today at a different restaurant, and Sushi Roku's same dish, just blew the other place's right out of the water!  OMG!    Add excellent food (the prices were definitely a bit higher than other sushi places- but still the flavor and quality were tangible things you can actually TASTE), excellent service (Angela was a complete doll!- and the GM Seth rocks!), and fresh and fab decor, and you have a winner!  Mark my words, this will be THE place to be seen for quite some time to come.    On a side note, I also liked the trendy-ness (and yet very approachable and friendly nature) of the hotel in general.  Everyone was super cool and welcoming to my friend and I.....although it doesn't hurt that she is smokin' hot and we are both super friendly and nice!  But it did appear that EVERYONE was greeted and served graciously.  The fillet appetizer (wrapped around asparagus) was divine!  The spicy tuna rolls literally melt in your mouth, and the soft crab rolls are a little slice of heaven.    Be sure to look your best and have fun people watching while enjoying a great meal!  (But save up, 'cause it ain't cheep!)  BTW, we went on a Thurs, and it was pretty packed.  MAKE RESERVATIONS!!  Warmest wishes,  Kirin :)

UOYttmM8kU1Obc2u3CZrYQ.text: I've been meaning to go to Sushi Roku for a while now and finally got the chance.  For starters, I'm less about the sushi and more about the fish. Don't get me wrong, I love a good rainbow roll but sashimi is the main event.  I had the chef's sashimi sampler and I have never had fresher fish in Phoenix. The blue fin had a perfectly delicate flavor while melting in my mouth. I'm usually not a huge fan of uni, but it was so fresh, I had to finish every last bite. The blue fin special with truffles (definitely not to be confused with a blue light special, mostly because of the truffles) was the perfect starter.  I was planning on going for a drink and a couple of small appetizers and ended up eating a full meal (I am powerless against the rainbow roll, especially after a few drinks of saki).  The place looks great. It is clean and well designed. The staff was also excellent with just the right amount of attention without being bothersome.  Overall, it was a great dining experience.

O7sTFCcJZzShCoJTuL3UMA.text: I would love to give this place more than 3 stars. But the service was the worst part of the experience. They serve happy hour all night on Sundays which made up for the bad service. I ordered a pear martini which took forever to get and it's even worst when you are trying to get the attention of someone to order a beverage or food. They were busy watching the football game, And avoiding the table. But the pear martini was delicious. The albacore salsa roll was very flavorful! We also ordered a few spicy salmon and spicy tuna roll. The Kobe slider with bacon jam was sooo good! Didn't expect that. Most defiantly recommend that on the happy our menu along with the albacore salsa roll. The tempera asparagus with aioli sauce was also not so good. Too thick and crunchy tempera almonds a more simple asparagus would have been better with the sauce. Overall I enjoyed the night but probably would only go back to try the main menu on a different day then Sunday, unless I'm up for happy hour and a pear martini.

IAoZqKxj2e58uUK2AWjQ6A.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi place and we come here every week, sometimes more. The sushi and oysters are so fresh and the presentation outstanding. The fried brussel sprouts with truffle oil are a must try. Now let's talk about the service.. nothing shy of spectacular! Everyone is always so accomadating and consistent in anticipating their diners needs. 2 of our favorites are Alex and Mookie because of the high level of service and their friendly personalities. Both have always been willing to go above and beyond to ensure we always have a great dining experience. The managers are always present walking around and make it a point to stop by to welcome us everytine we are there as well as the rest of the staff. Sushi roku has been one of our weekly favs for several years now and will continue to be. Keep up the great work all!!

t8EiE0kIWMU0Qksekv3f9g.text: Went here for lunch & we had bento boxes. Only 3 other people there & the service was poor. The manager ended up coming up to us to ask for our order because the waitress catered more to the larger party than us.   Sushi tasted bad. They messed up my boyfriends order with chicken instead of beef. Got nauseous from the sashimi (which I eat all the time & love) & had to stop eating. Been to a lot of great sushi places & would rate this a 2 out or 10. The miso soup was great & the only thing I really liked.  My boyfriend liked the teriyaki sauce. That's about it.  Decor was nice but for being attached to The W...it was a huge disappointment.

uC4ZCefrkRhcxcioHyfGpA.text: I haven't been a fan of fancy or trendy restaurants lately, so I was a bit hesitant about Sushi Roku.  Located in the W in Scottsdale, we pulled up to the valet among Maseratis and Range Rovers.  I immediately missed my t-shirt, baseball hat and sports bars! BUT... that all changed when we sat down.  The service was amazing, we felt welcome and comfortable, and we were given all kinds of amazing suggestions for food.  The pricing was on the higher end, but fair, and the quality of fish and other items made it VERY apparent that these people REALLY care about their product.  SUSHI/RAW RECOMMENDATIONS: Fluke Kumquat Sakana Roll Tuna Tartare  COOKED RECOMMENDATIONS: Shishito Japanese Peppers Chilean Seabass (the BEST I've ever had) Beef Ribeye Wrapped Asparagus Grilled Octopus  DESSERT RECOMMENDATION: Lemon Sorbet with Raspberry Coulis (has a home-made granola and fresh raspberries...OUTSTANDING)

VvtFA-hN5Wsv86e7PUu7Yg.text: Food is decent to good and service is friendly. That said I don't have much else to say. We had our meals all brought out separately which is somewhat irritating but what makes this review 2 star worthy is the it took over 25 minutes to get everyone fed. We have a party of 7 and we could not eat together. The food was the high end of average and at a weak price. We will not come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AFsP3fJvSIKNpLU-INL_gA.text: Short Review: THIS IS AN INCREDIBLE 5 STAR RESTAURANT!! Long Review: Nestled within Scottsdale W, a 5 STAR RESORT, is Scottsdale's SUSHI ROKU, a 5 STAR RESTAURANT. ABOUT SUSHI ROKU Sushi Roku is part of IDG, Innovative Dinning Group. IDG owns and operates, SUSHI ROKU, ROKU, BOA STEAKHOUSE, KATANA, and ROBATA BAR. Sushi Roku combines the finest, freshest fish from pristine waters around the globe with the kind of artistry that can only be provided by a mature sushi chef ensuring traditional sushi, together with a splash of contemporary California innovation. Sushi Roku has locations in Santa Monica, Pasadena, Newport Beach, Las Vegas, and Scottsdale. THE STORY I've had the pleasure of eating at Sushi Roku a couple of times, and it never disappoints. The last visit was OUTSTANDING! We started with one of their sake flights (see pic). Their sake flights are innovative and bold, and included some Arizona sakes. We had a couple appetizers, including the A-5 Japanese Wagyu Ishi-Yaki, which is grilled over a bincho charcoal, was the best meat that has ever been in my mouth. Sushi Roku's Wagyu appetizer alone is worth the visit. Everything was unique and fresh, and had DELICIOUS BOLD FLAVORS. We ended with desert, the lemon souffle, which was not only the perfect finale to the meal, but my photo was featured in their instagram! instagram.com/sushirokuaz (see pic) SERVICE EXPERIENCE The service was EXCEPTIONAL! We were treated like royalty and our main server was so fun and enjoyable, we kept mentioning that he should have his own show. It was the type of interaction that added to the meal, and was non obtrusive, which I always appreciate. CONCLUSION This restaurant is a gem! This is truly one of the best dining experiences I've had lately. As long as nothing changes, I would happily eat here again and again! I hope I get a chance to experience Sushi Roku's other locations too! 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Valet Parking Available. *Other Locations: Santa Monica, Pasadena, Newport Beach, Las Vegas, and Scottsdale *Their Social Media is TOP NOTCH *For More Information: sushiroku.com

Cfgk6QLZwOAwrL95t_qDUA.text: This is my favorite sushi place! Everyone is so welcoming and the sushi chefs are top of the line. Aaron is great so if he is working, try and sit in front of him.

Q5gCMnHUvm0d2GAqbNOryw.text: Best sushi around. Very friendly professional people. I especially enjoyed visiting with your sushi chef Aaron. Not one thing on the menu I didn't LOVE

Om7AvoER_bMymhomwm0VvA.text: This is one of my favorite sushi spots! A friend recently joined me for dinner and Chef Aaron was amazing! My friend was unfamiliar with the menu but knows what he likes and is very particular. He was able to describe what he was looking for and Aaron made the perfect dish  for him!  Thank you so much Aaron! You never disappoint!

_WPqiziZWCemY7znS2gCcw.text: We made a reservation here via the Yelp App for a Saturday evening of Labor Day. We had a prime table for Scottsdale people watching - from couples to bachelor/bachelorette parties we saw it all here.   We had the bake crab hand roll, asparagus wrapped in beef, and sashimi sampler. Everything was fresh and tasty, but I certainly wish that they had gluten free soy sauce. I would assumed a restaurant this expensive and in a hotel would accommodate gluten free people.   Due to no soy sauce for me, I wouldn't come back for sushi but maybe I'd try something else. Service was fine for a busy Saturday night, but nothing spectacular to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef wrapped asparagus.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crab hand roll.

MnDfMTAdLItzeRcUttNA6g.text: An entirely mediocre and underwhelming dining experience. We made a reservation for Saturday night celebrating a family member's birthday and we had pretty high hopes. We can look past the noise, the yelling, the loud music...all of that is fine if the service and food are dynamite. Well, they weren't....with the exception of Kyle the manager who was fantastic.  Our server couldn't have cared less about our non-trendy family: our water glasses stayed empty, there was no "how is everything?" or "can I get you anything?"   My steak was so unbelievably salty I sent it back half eaten and she kept it on the bill.  At 7:30 on a Saturday they ran out of salmon and cod. The birthday boy had to order chicken, which was mediocre at best.  The runners had their thumbs in the food when they put the plates down on the table.  A salad was brought over that we didn't order and the runner's response was "the server told me to just leave it here."  They cut a large birthday cake into 5 pieces and served it, I've never seen an individual piece of cake so big in my life.  Kyle stepped in and took excellent care of us which is why I'm adding the extra star, otherwise this was most certainly a one-star dinner.

UajRMyn6O08LatfzqUl6bw.text: Best sushi in Arizona. Food is amazing! The pork fried rice and tuna hanabi are the best apps!! Evan, our server, gave us great recommendations, very knowledgeable on the menu and overall did a great job Love this place.

XBtYhh1cta2mpeFtNHTRBg.text: Great quality sushi.   Busy on a Friday night w excellent service and an energetic ambiance. Will def be back

leEpdhEFewKWDfJ3gjEAgQ.text: Kris at Sushi Roku was amazing!! Perfect service and our meal was delicious!! We had a variety of rolls and sashimi, and everything was fresh and so good.

K7CE-OowhBQWQRe791ER3w.text: Terrible experience at this restaurant. We arrived to a relatively empty restaurant. We placed our order before 12.45 and 35mns later the tartare and sushi arrive. 5mns later I am presented with a dish of asparagus and long stem broccoli. Nicely cooked except some pieces were hot and others cold! I was asked whether I'd like a fork with my vegetables. I replied I'd rather have my fish! I called the manager over who told me my cod  dish took longer to prepare. It arrived at 1.30pm.  Nicely cooked but not worth the wait. Because I had enquired about the whereabouts of our food 30mms into the wait and then twice after, the manager arrived with my fish and told me my meal was complementary. We had to ask 2 different servers for extra sauce. I enquired to 3 different servers about my cod dish. Each time I was assured it was on its way. The food being bought out separately is irritating.  Comping a dish is too easy a cop out for restaurants. I dont go out wanting a free meal but a decent one with good service. I will not be returning.

14SebjVu0nZI1335ESJa_w.text: First time at Sushi Roku.... loved the circular booth near the bar.  This is definitely a hip place with club music playing throughout.  We had the Gensai, Senshi and Tuna Jalapeno.  They were all great rolls and the service was great with our server Chris.  She was so helpful with recommendations and just lovely to meet.

benDyKuuB3xR_9HdECDwjA.text: Very impressed with the beautiful interior, food, and service.  Coming from San Francisco, my bf and I were skeptical about Japanese food and Asian food in Arizona. However, we left feeling full and and content.  We ordered: -Special trio of the day (it was delicious! I believe it was octopus, scallop, and tuna) -Ramen: it was surprisingly good. The broth was so rich. -Sashimi platter- spicy tuna rolls, California rolls, and assorted sashimi   I had a ginger lychee mojito that hit the spot.  I'd definitely come back if I visit Arizona again.
