0HMKDwNUA8rQ5hcI3_KiMA.text: Schyler was our bartender and he was fantastic! He knew everything on the menu and could answer all our questions. He made fantastic drinks and was extremely attentive! This place has amazing food and drinks! Go see schyler at the bar!

BgKqZbswnw2qsBpZwA5Nnw.text: We had a fabulous experience here.   The food was amazing, along with the service by Tim.  We went with his recommendations and they did not disappoint.   Brussel sprout chips and the Japanese Wagyu beef (melt in your mouth) were 2 dishes that really impressed us.    If you get Tim as your waiter, tell him what you like and go with his recommendations - so worth it!!

K-5ZJWcHmYFJfZMblaDfEQ.text: Went in for lunch over the weekend & had such an amazing experience. Food was fantastic & service was spectacular!! I will definitely return & tell all my friends about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zXdFCMN8sOaRkPSARPto0w.text: Ambiance is great, but food and service is terrible.   This restaurant is in the W, which is befitting since both are extremely trendy, modern, and classy. However, the service was extremely slow even though the restaurant was not crowded; instead, the waiters were busy flirting with the girls at the hostess stand. I was going to order more food, but got put off at having to wait over 10 minutes to get the waiter's attention.  This place is also extremely over priced. The fish inside the rolls were mushy - this just means that they take the leftover fish cuttings from the sashimi and mash it up to fill the rolls (you can see it in many of the pictures other reviewers have posted). At ~$10 a roll, I would expect much more. The Brussels sprout chips were very tasty and flavorful with the truffle oil addition, however they are deep fried and DRENCHED in oil (not truffle oil). The chef ought to let the oil drain off before serving as the sprouts were sitting in a pool of oil.

jfA6lUCgajoPb0F8xI6V2A.text: Good sushi. Service is bad. Not kidding you on the service. Will completely ignore you when you are waiting to get their attention for the bill.

5MPkfM22Vuq5bZH73WBubg.text: If you are looking between here and Roka Akor, as there are many similarities on the surface, I STRONGLY suggest you choose Sushi Roku.  We visited Roka Akor last weekend, had a nigiri and drinks course, left and went to Sushi Roku, and were so glad we did!  (Research!)  Sushi Roku had a great atmosphere, once you got in.  Parking is a bit tricky as the W valet was overwhelmed, but once we were settled into the cozy, elegant booth things were 100%.  Great service, delicious pieces of tuna (best bluefin!), salmon (including a fatty king!), albacore (not seared like Roka Akor!), chutoro and otoro.  Prices were a skosh high but we all understand Phoenix is not on the ocean.  Between us we also tried two cocktails and a joyous sake flight that was presented with a complete non-condescending explanation.  Large group of happy-looking women flanked the dining area along the banquette and couples and groups alike held down the booths in the middle.  We felt like we were somewhere :-) but somewhere that invites all.  Roka Akor, parking was a breeze and the hostess was a darling but everything else was supersnob, especially the sushi chef who wouldn't serve us our food (even though we were seated at the sushi bar in front of him) but preferred to yell to a server to come bring it to us.  The restaurant was also pretty empty.  Food was meh at best.

rkrA0050JVZT9xcqBwNzjA.text: I really like this place.  Staff is super friendly, the atmosphere is fun, but not loud, and they have some great fusionesk appies.  I know sush in the middle of the desert sounds wierd, but it's tasty.  If you come here, look for Victoria.  She awesome!  Great recommendations, perfect delivery, and she's cute, which is always nice!

sil3ex9mFe4Hbdz9HTux-g.text: Amazing service from Robert... Gotta say great food fish was fresh and what can I say our server made our experience even better. Thanks for everything Robert... See you again soon.

6MXbTBgg2amvVKyCzp2QgA.text: I have to say it was a bit difficult to find since its under the W hotel and if you don't pay attention you'll miss it.  Parking was a bit difficult as well and it was only Sunday night but it was worth it.  Nice atmosphere and the staff is very accommodating and helpful.  The food is delicious and the fish is so fresh and the portions are just right.  It's def worth another visit since we know where it is now : )

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Main bar area

rJPsvIELmBE-mzz9RPMoMQ.text: We LOVED our meal. Sat down immediately at a cozy booth, we had a wonderful and attentive waiter, CJ. We loved his recommendations and his service was impeccable! Definitely ask to be seated in his area and you will sincerely enjoy your meal. The food was scrumptious and the preparations were different than what we have had at other sushi spots across the globe.   What we ate: - Eggplant miso: the miso sauce is amazing and the eggplant was so fresh.  -Albacore sashimi with fried onions: the fried onions add a nice crunch -Tuna tartare with truffle: literally the best tartare I've ever had, melted in your mouth- and the truffle was very present  -Beef ribeye wrapped over asparagus- the sweet sauce was finger licking good.  - Creamy miso popcorn shrimp (replaced with seabass instead of shrimp): thankful that the kitchen was ready to accommodate, also the best creamy Miso sauce. A must order!!  -Spicy tuna crispy rice (aka hanabi): a generous serving of the spicy tuna on top, and it was served immediately so you had a good mix of the hot rice cake with the colder tuna. -Tuna Jalapeno roll- super fresh, served with fried onion, and so much tuna!  Finished off with two of their classic melon mix shooters.   Overall an extremely delicious, and memorable meal. We would definitely recommend coming here and if we return to Scottsdale we would reserve here for sure.

PRhoGoQdzfpwM50Z-SfYDw.text: Several people from my conference raved about the food so I squeezed in a quick lunch this afternoon. Sat at sushi bar... Restaurant is really nice looking. Sushi chefs were very friendly. I got tuna and salmon sashimi and they were happy to explain the different types. The fish had very nice texture. The tuna was a little small, the salmon was perfectly sized and absolutely delicious. I also had a custom-made role since none of their specialty rolls included tuna. I think there were probably 10 pieces so a good size. All in all excellent but I walked out with a $70 bill eating by myself. Not complaining. Just sayin.

4D3i_KkQGL7Rn_eEwlu_UA.text: Pricey but good.  Sits adjacent to the W and has a pretty nice selection of sushi as it relates to flavors and variety.  The website says no casual pool dress, but the place was full of that attire so I am not sure what that is all about.

cQj_6e-kmY6lpj-fZvTuWw.text: Great atmosphere. Wait staff are all young men who are very polished and extremely polite. Our waiter was very excited to talk about the vast variety of sake available, and through a series of a couple of quick questions , he was able to identify what sake he could recommend. And he was got it right! The food was great. The salmon capriccio was excellent

Z-qP6uv6-wUu5iOk27WuqQ.text: Best experience as a business traveler getting tons of attention from the sushi chefs and managers. I love it there and can't wait to try all the concepts in LA.

nIf2OslvRPFD-ZU8z7ECVg.text: Very good sushi and excellent service.  A bit on the pricey side, but to be expected as it is collocated with the W hotel.

uiEifYgl9F2vXO__aA00nw.text: Love this place and its location!!! I always have the best dining experiences at sushi roku. The atmosphere of the restaurant is perfect for a date night, girls night out, or any other fun occasion. The food is fresh, fun, and DELICIOUS!! My favorite thing on the menu is probably the seared salmon sashimi appetizer. I love the smores dessert too. I've tried a variety of dishes on the menu and loved them all. Our waiter Jon was amazing. He was attentive, polite, and gave us great suggestions on what to order. Sushi roku continues to impress me, and I'm sure I'll be back soon. Shoutout to the super awesome and thoughtful manager Mike too!

6bSCS2Yzjs4OG3T8qDrcOg.text: Without question the single worst dining experience in memory. I kept glancing around for a candid camera or something. We left in a stupor of disbelief, disgust and regret.   Four of us show up around 10pm on a Friday night. The place is still fairly busy but not packed by any means. We were seated almost immediately next to the image I would expect to accompany the definition of Scottsdale d-bag couple in the dictionary. Over tanned, tatted up, huge biceps and pudgy middle, fake lips, boobs, everything, tons of makeup, absurd amount of jewelry. Cross between circus clowns and the cast of Jersey Shore. That was as good as it was going to get.   We sat there for at least 15 minutes before a single person stopped by our table. When our late 20something male server showed up he wasn't apologetic. He immediately tried to bond with us like we were long lost bros finally reunited. It was obnoxious, contrived and poorly received considering he was off to a miserable start. We order drinks, which ends up being very confusing for him. How many large bottles of beer? What brand? Five minutes later he stops back to "double check" our drink order. YES, that's the order. Now put it in already. We've been here 20+ minutes and you haven't served us a drink!?   He comes back again to take our food order. In his defense (he really doesn't deserve any), two of us are native Seattleites and consider ourselves sushi connoisseurs (not in a pretentious way - we just have a deep appreciation for and eat it frequently). We ask about the size of the sashimi and nigiri orders and he launches into a long description of the difference between the two. Yes, we know. We order an assortment of nigiri and a roll to start, which is our standard approach to ordering at a place new to us. Sample a bit and assess the quality. After more hemming an hawing, he finally takes our order and leaves. Five minutes later he comes back AGAIN to double check our order. "Now that was all nigiri, right? The sushi with rice underneath?" He says he's going to do us a solid and redeem himself by sending out a free warm crab roll. Ohh, yay! At this point we think this must be a prank. Is this guy high? Inept? Both? What is going on? We confirm, again. He leaves.   Then he FINALLY shows up with our drinks and he's got the beer wrong. At this point he launches into a sob story explanation about how he was called in outside his regular shift, only had 3 hours of sleep, blah, blah. He's now playing the sympathy card. I was getting nauseous. Please just bring the food and leave us alone. The last thing we want to hear about it your problems during our dinner.   At least 20 minutes go by while we enjoy some time without our server making us cringe and the food finally arrives. The portions are small to tiny. The quality is okay at best. I've had better at a conveyor belt place back home. The server comes back and says something like "Isn't that the most amazing roll you've ever had?" Dear God. No, actually, it's not. Please leave.   We foolishly decide to order a couple more items (we were still hungry) and our server tells us the rather expensive snapper on the fresh list is incredible. In the five years he's worked there they've never had it and it's the best fish he's ever had. That should have been our clue not to order it. We did anyway. It comes out and it's seared skin on. It was, again, just okay and certainly not worth the price. Here comes server guy telling us how amazing it was again. Please, please, please just bring the check.   He shows up with the check and, this will shock you, it's wrong. He's charged us for the roll he sent out to redeem himself. We point it out and request it be removed and he's stunned. No waaay. I'm so sorry I'll take that off right away. He shows up five minutes later to "double check" that we wanted the free roll he sent out removed from the bill. I almost fell out of my chair. Then he has the audacity to deliver the final, corrected check and tell us when we come in next time, to request him and he'll give us some free rolls to redeem himself. You have got to be joking? The kicker is the price of such a horrific experience. We were so ready to get the hell out of there we just paid and split. If it had been earlier in the evening I would have spoken to the manager and made sure I wasn't ripped off.   Quick summary - this place is in the W and it's targeted at what I can only assume is their typical demographic. They substantially over charge for mediocre sushi because they can and, based on other reviews, practice suspect billing (like trying to charge us for the comp'd roll). I will never, ever return and hope some day my friends and I can laugh about how we were literally robbed of a couple quality hours together while we endured this debacle of a dining experience.

0QUT8qTCo44A8HaGHuXr_Q.text: The way they treated us was world-class. These well dressed managers Dan and Stephen were on point. Even the guy who filled our water was on it. Their food is amazing especially the steak wrapped asparagus and the miso cod.  With management like this, it is no wonder the W partners with Roku for their target clientele.

uYGoYLpD3RYgpbmEh5QoGg.text: Sushi Roku is the only place I will go to for sushi in AZ. Their food is excellent, service is consistently great from their wait staff, and their manager Dan always goes above and beyond for his customers. You won't be disappointed when you visit Sushi Roku at The W hotel!

vayDhMBNhp6ipIoxuMZ1yw.text: I pass by this place all the time and I never really thought to ever step foot into this place. I went last night for a friends birthday dinner with a large party and I would say this was a great experience. The vibe definitely makes me feel like I'm in Old Town but more chill. They have a very nice environment and it's pretty dark. The menu is plentiful and lots of great choices. Starting out my party ordered the eggplant and the shishito peppers. The peppers were really tender and paired with a really flavorful sauce. We just ended up ordering a huge mix of appetizers and entrees and drinks throughout out the night. The chicken karaage was really good, dip it in the sauce with the shishito sauce. The rolls were delicious and fresh. I will have to say when ordering any steak I highly recommend telling them to go easy on the salt cause they literally emptied the ocean on all the steak dishes even including the mashed potatoes. If you guys ever wanted to get a kidney stone in 2 minutes this is the way to go. No really, everyone in my party agreed that the dish was seasoned with someone's tears. Besides that, I can say that this was good place to eat, and would recommend.  10/10 would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TNJAGRQacboL20_xPOYRlg.text: I always a great experience here! I had Kristen as a server and she recommended each plate we ordered and each plate was superb! She made our night! The ambiance is amazing and overall experience with service was fast and each staff member had a smile when passing by!  The food was very tasty, had a beautiful presentation, and was a good portion size. The price is a little high but that's what you get for a high end sushi place. If you are in need of great service and a face with a beautiful smile, for sure I recommend Kristen!!!! She's freaking awesome! Hope my review helps!

dnHG-MiMewxuj-Af2QEREQ.text: Super nice place with great service. Located in the W with its own entrance off the lobby motor court it is thankfully easy to access. We had a dinner for five on a Saturday night with a reservation and were seated with no wait in a very busy place.  The overall food experience was outstanding and something new to me was having Hamachi Kama, Yellowtail Collar, for the first time ever. I was told by the other dinner guests that this is not something readily available on all menus and is often something even if it is available not listed on the menu.

3BZUNczXAHuUKBzGWM4RyA.text: How can you not have fun at Sushi Roku.  We enjoyed Saki Bombs, Sushi Rolls, Miso Soup and each of us enjoyed Bento Boxes.  You definitely have to order their Brussels Sprout Chips.  It was delicious.    Service was great.  Ambience - The restaurant did need some cleaning.  Don't get me wrong the restaurant had a nice vibe.  Maybe at night it looks a lot prettier than day.

GkmADIZkPcGrt7ow5lOstA.text: Mia was the best server, super quick and made sure we had an amazing experience. Food is amazing and drinks are decently strong

BdCmUHa9O8UT7jN6zWjFnQ.text: Mia was great! She is the only server that acts fast and makes sure her customers are satisfied.

_EJvwoMpfGOZpWzrgyMPJA.text: We always love coming here! They have the best and freshest sushi. Also, the black rice adds a nice flair. We are regulars!

xCyGqt2eE5tVncGAjzitwQ.text: I have been to multiple Sushi Rokus. They are all very well run and consistent from location to location. I usually go to this one for happy hour or drinks to start off the evening. Their food is always prepared very nicely with fresh tasty ingredients. I really enjoy their  charbroiled octopus. Always tender flavorful and delicious . Staff is always there to recommend help and serve you. This location is inside of the W Hotel. There are many choices for sushi in Japanese in the immediate area this is definitely one of the better ones. If you want to try it out they do a happy hour Monday through Friday and all day on Sundays. Definitely worth coming and trying some food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4kJ4MARLF0rywpmbItp3Qg.text: OKish. It is inside the W. I'm not a big fan of hotel restaurants.  Service is outstanding. Food just ok. HH prices are pretty good.

w7pBztOWpBHOQ68hWVgq1g.text: I don't know, I guess since Sushi Roku is in Oldtown's W Hotel, I thought it would be like much of Oldtown and like many fancy restaurants that are in hotels -- overpriced, overhyped, overdone, overconfident, overworn, overtired, overcrowded, overburdened, and overextended. Overall, however, I was overjoyed to find that it was none of these things.   While it certainly aims to be swanky and has some of the classic Oldtown vibes (i.e., the genre of electro-wavy, deep-melodic, bounce-step house music was definitely playing; there's aesthetically adventurous lighting; etc.), none of that became overbearing (had to toss in one more "over-" word). Ultimately, the environment was a nice lively place to eat dinner on a Friday before going out. Also, the food was very solid and that is the important part.  My friends and I started off with garlic edamame. The amount of garlic on these bad boys is aggressive, but, as a fervent and rabid garlic slob, I enthusiastically support it.  Then we split a bottle of sake and some beers. Though sake-lovers, we were all sake-neophytes. Thus, we put our sake-lives in the hands of our server (I believe she said her name was Blair) and she made a fantastic decision that led to us drinking some pear-flavored sake. Marvelous.  I ordered the spicy tuna roll, which obviously didn't reinvent the wheel but was exactly what I wanted, expected and then received. No complaints. Additionally, I ate some yellowtail nigiri and some amberjack nigiri. The amberjack had like a weird lemon-thing going on, which I thought I may enjoy but, unfortunately, found somewhat off-putting. However, that is just the classic case of me ordering incorrectly. So, no foul. The yellowtail nigiri, though, = straight fire-flame-swoll-bang-bang-pow. So, hell yeah.  Lastly, our server Blair (I really hope I am remembering her name correctly) was top-notch. As I already said, great sake selection. Anyone can do that though (except, obviously, me or anyone I was with that night). What set her apart was the complimentary green-tea shots that she hooked us up with because we were celebrating. Blair's the best.

_m0Uhnt6jlpNUT9YXCwkCQ.text: This has quickly become my favorite go-to spot, between the delicious food, incredible drinks, and fabulous service! Go to the bar and ask for Alex!   Can't wait to make plans and go again!

uVfwZrafWJJjegKoldvCBQ.text: WONT BE COMING BACK! NO PICTURE ON MENU. In this day and age where you order blindly and get a surprise for food and it ruin your appetite! How you gonna sell food if you don't even know what it look like?

4Fajmn-QDDHRwdJoeCxZNQ.text: Great atmosphere, excellent food.  I brought some girlfriends to Sushi Roku and had a wonderful experience. Sydney was our server who provided extensive knowledge about the menu and gave us a very personalized experience. Food and cocktails were all on point. Will definitely be coming back!

Fbql3S4VsVhOM5kdxU2Wzg.text: Update - called the restaurant about the edamame and they refunded me for it and for the sushi roll for my inconvenience. Thanks for the great customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hamachi Serrano
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tuna Jalapeno Roll - tiny and not worth $19

YXVlqL9XG7IhE9PPTifCpw.text: EXCEPTIONAL  I haven't had better sushi or service in town. This restaurant is inside the W Hotel in Scottsdale. You can park in the hotel parking or there is easy to find free street parking right outside.   I came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The ambiance was perfect. The 5 of us sat comfortably in their round booths. There were plenty of other parties in the restaurant but honestly, didn't even feel like they were around. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and personable. There was never a time our glasses were not full, recommendations were amazing, and never a dull or awkward or intrusive moment when he came by to check on us. He always seemed to have perfect timing.  As for the food, we ordered a little bit of everything: cold and hot appetizers, steak, wagyu beef, sushi, sashimi, and sake. The fish is so fresh! The amount you pay, is definitely for quality. My favorite has got to the the wagyu beef and toro. Second was the oysters and chocolate lava cake.  Nothing negative comes to mind when I think for Sushi Roku. If you are looking for quality Japanese food and a good night out, this is your place.  Tip: Monday night - 50% off bottles

ZProPJqxWtzOEk7FVNR3NQ.text: I order the seared togarashi - it had a lot of flavor, good texture, and the cilantro jalapeno salad complimented the dish very well. The only negatives about this restaurant are; my service wasn't the best, the dishes were overpriced, and they had very small portions for the price you are paying.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seared Togarashi (crusted salmon sashimi with avocado). To the side was a cilantro jalapeño salad!

2eVU4HfnJM5Pvv8pKHktMQ.text: Great happy hour and awesome service!! No complaints. Happy hour is only offered in the bar area so you cannot sit outside if you want to take advantage of the specials.

_iDJEwWfHkRqpUFjP0eL_w.text: Average sushi and have had better costing less money. The salad was almost $10 and was a handful of mixed greens and nothing else. The nori was like rubber bands but I guess that is to be expected for a nearly $90 order right? Soft shell crab "Where's the meat?" I have eaten soft shell crab for a couple decades and even while I lived in Tokyo and this roll had a thumbnails worth of meat.  I suggest saving your money and ordering from somewhere else.

_p2-AV0bFAXQOOJaqpAqZA.text: What a treat Sushi Roku is!! Located on the ground floor of the W Hotel in Old Town Scottsdale - easy peasy. Loads of great happy hour specials and the menu is spectacular. We went down the list and ordered just about every item on their HH menu - foodwise. Fresh sashimi and sushi - Every bit of it was more delicious than the last. I would return again and again for some of their sushi and snacks. Great service - nice quiet ambiance - clean restrooms!!

ZVhz_s6WJ4577EYmsG_Saw.text: Excellent service, great food, great hh.  The place has a done a great job in improving everything lately. Have Alex at the bar take care of you or Josh at the tables.

rNnbPRc8SCMUz-T-foz2Hg.text: So I usually try not to eat sushi in cities so far from the coast. But we came here for my bachelorette party because one of my friends has celiacs and can't eat gluten anything. So Japanese tends to be safest for her.  The sushi wasn't bad.. I didn't get sick so thats a plus! I did venture into some raw fish and it was okay. Not fresh like what you get in SF.. but okay. But really.. for the price, I'd never go back.. its super expensive for what you get. And my teeny bottle of sake was double what it would have been at a restaurant in SF (and triple just buying it at a store).  The staff was nice, everything looked pretty. But two stars because I have experienced better.. a lot and I will probably never go back.

ohQxbZCBCEFnyL_-wRJbfA.text: Were they out of their minds when they gave this place more than two stars?  Have they never had sushi before?  Have they nothing to compare it to?  Is this what desert dwellers consider good sushi?  Gag me!  Whose brilliant idea was it to place the sushi bar in the middle of the restaurant, and to seat every sushi bar patron with a loud greeting in Japanese as they were led to the bar as if they were royalty?  It was cute once or twice, but all of us sitting at our table by the entrance did not appreciate the fake sentiment by the end of our evening.  It was downright annoying.  While ordering, our server asked if we had ever been to Sushi Roku before in such a manner as to suggest that it was going to be a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience.  When he indicated that their food is served "family style" we initially thought that it meant that we would share dishes, which wouldn't work too well when five out of seven of us were vegetarians.  When he explained that it simply meant that the food is brought out as it is completed by the kitchen, I pointed out the fact that what he really meant is that the kitchen is not organized enough to assure that we will all eat at the same time.  This is unacceptable at a so-called high end restaurant.  I had to laugh at my vegetarian dinnermates.  They all ordered a tofu dish with what they called brown rice risotto.  After tasting the dish, which tasted like fried water, I understood why they thought the edamame was so good.  It's the only thing, other than the overpriced wine, that they actually tasted that night.  As for myself, I went for the sushi assortment, or should I say, the rice cakes with slivers of raw fish placed atop them.  I guess not enough raw fish survived the trek across the desert.  The fish was carefully rationed. I actually took one of the rice cakes and put all of my sushi on it to make a rainbow roll.  In the end, the server was right.  It was a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience for me.  Meaning, I'll never go back there.

-Ws8pCk3ypdx9nsPx6JC2w.text: My boyfriend and I go to Sushi Roku often, food is amazing & the service is what really impresses us.  Julieah & Jennah are awesome, extremely attentive, very acknowledgeable of the menu and pairing foods and beverages! I highly suggest you request a table in their sections if able, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!! Thanks again Julieah & Jennah!!

1MW91-19nHqyRo32nt4jvA.text: Oh Sushi Roku, I really wanted to like you! I had heard such good things from friends and was so excited to finally try your sushi. But you definitely disappointed.   I mean I do come from San Francisco, where you can find some of the most amazing, mind-blowing, met in your mouth sushi... so maybe I am biased. However I can name plenty of other sushi spots in Scottsdale where you can get bigger, tastier rolls for the same price or less (like Sushi Brokers, for example).   Including our tip, the bill was about $150.... For two people!! We ordered miso soup, an appetizer, a bottle of wine (that was half off because of a Sunday special they had going on) and 4 rolls. Now I don't mind paying $75 per person if the food is outstanding, but these rolls were below average and I didn't leave feeling satisfied. Nothing to write home about.  Save your money and hit up Stingray or Geisha during their happy hour. Or, head on over to Sushi Brokers or Sushi on Shea in North Scottsdale but don't waste your $$$ at Sushi Roku. It's totally not worth the over priced menu!

pXm5UrXeVBK6nxseEYjpJQ.text: I went back to Sushi Roku for another bachelorette party and it was a complete 180 from my last review. They're having a great summer Happy Hour (even on weekends!) and we decided to be decadent and order one of everything. The sushi tasted fresh, the vegetable dishes - green beans, roasted eggplant - were flavorful and well cooked, and all of the meat dishes were great too. The cocktails were much better this time around, and cheaper, thanks to Happy Hour :)   Our server was very friendly and fun, and even brought a complimentary round of champagne at the end of our meal to celebrate the bachelorette party. Sushi Roku totally won me over this time, I'm glad I gave it another shot.

3v5xlRY3cFDN9nxUAhcD1g.text: I will say this, the sushi, once you finally get it is amazing so the two stars is for the sushi only. That is about all the nice things I have to say.   I was here with a very large party for a friend's birthday. She warned them (and I do mean warned them) in advanced that it was going to be a large party so you would think that we would have maybe 3 or 4 servers for a party of 40. (not kidding on that number either) So the two servers we had were ok. I would usually name them by name, but alas I won't on this occasion because the service wasn't the best. I am not blaming the servers as they not only had our party of 40 but other tables as well.   Anywho, my gripe is this. For a busy Saturday night, you would think that they would have enough people to handle all of the people that were at this restaurant. The bar was super slow, the sushi bar was well slow. Let's just say everyone else in our party of 40 were almost finished with their sushi by the time myself and another young lady finally got ours. Yes again , it was good, but wow, it took a very long time. We only had three rolls between the two of us.   So don't got with a party larger than 6 max! I watched other tables with smaller parties get their food and drinks at record speed so size does matter in this situation. If you go, go early before it gets too busy so that you won't wait for your food or your drinks. Oh and it is a little pricey so be warned. I have no problem paying for good food, as long as the service is just as good. Catch my drift?

HM78WDWcWOM5kLAyvtLQHQ.text: Beautiful sushi, classy ambience and service was good.  Pricey, but it should be given the quality of food.

QaoL2hAu1xoyE_-yGlS7VA.text: I LOVED this place!  The sushi and sashimi were amazing and the presentation and service were wonderful!   My husband and I recently went to Sushi Roku on a date while visiting family in the Scottsdale area.  We are quite particular about the flavor and freshness of our sushi, but love to try new places when we get a chance.  We decided to go to Sushi Roku based on a recommendation from a friend who has been there.  We were SO glad we did!  The sushi was so fresh and flavorful and the presentation of the food and the service were just as wonderful. We also loved the atmosphere of the restaurant itself.  We chose to sit outdoors in a booth and the Scottsdale weather and the lighting were just perfect for an evening meal.   If you love sushi, you should definitely try this place.  We will definitely go back every chance we get.

vALWt5Za36MoGeXzsdTk3A.text: Beautiful restaurant! Terrrific service!   Wonderful, fresh and authentic cuisine - what more can I say but don't miss the Carpaccio!

lu2rsb2ZIuE9MtlxtktLAg.text: Great summer menu going on right now with fun drinks. So convenient if you're staying at the W.

OSTy9TyoU8ehGSnwkRdzOw.text: Ambiance: 4 stars  I would not come here for the food ever again! I remembered biting into a tempura veggie mix and it had the undercooked taste.  Sushi was very mediocre.    Awesome, eye candy scene (Cougars galore) but the quality of the food just was not up to par with the rest of the sushi/Japanese community.  And of course, way over priced!

nzOH541XTzxO3xp_BwgMUw.text: Went here after supper at the Italian place in fashion square wasn't as fulfilling as we had hoped.  First time eating toro and damn, it was worth every penny! We ended up getting a couple orders along with some spicy tuna roll (which was great) and some other sashimi which I failed to find out what it was but still tasty nonetheless. Along with a couple of the large Kirin beers, it was a treat to eat here. Loved it.

FzdLLIZN3xgg71xlRe5n4A.text: Made the long trip to Scottsdale from Goodyear to check out Sushi Roku and to celebrate our friend's birthday. Beautiful atmosphere and tasty sushi made this a nice experience. I wouldn't say it's the best sushi I've had, but well worth the visit. Our only complaint would be the 45+ minutes we waited for our check after completing our meal. Granted, it was Saturday night and the place was fairly busy, but come on...  After we FINALLY got our bill...gulp....the prices are very high...we ventured upstairs to the open air lounge which is nestled near the W hotel's pool, which I've heard is an experience all in it's self. Lounge was small and a little noisy for us 30+ yr olds...LOL!   Nice experience...would return again.

9mQ4hFLBdK3Y2xeBxbzoDA.text: Sushi Roku is kind of inside of the W hotel ... so you can imagine that the place is certainly is very nice in term of atmosphere or deco ... love the style of this place.   Went there for a Saturday lunch with only few people around and enjoyed the seating outside with such great weather, so the overall ambient was totally 5 stars.   I will check it out again at night and see how the scene likes ...   As for the food, me and my friend shared two of the lunch bento boxes with a variety of food from miso soup, salad, tempura, teriyaki, sushi to roll and dessert (green tea and red bean ice-cream)... Food was ok, not a whole lot to rave about. But again, this type of restaurant, you go there more for the atmosphere than food.  So in that sense, it met my expectation.   Will recommend this place for a night-out, or date place

buNmYDEEmsLBlJHBFE-03Q.text: Do you LOVE great food, a fun atmosphere for any kind of celebration, and spending about $60 per person for a cocktails and bites? If so, Sushi Roku is the place for you. I made a reservation at SR via opentable.com, and our group of 7 were promptly seated. They have a fun offering of cocktails, and a decent wine list too. Our table indulged in several sushi rolls, edamame, and other mains. Go for the panko crusted salmon (2 of us split the entree, and it was plenty), and pass up the beef skewers (they tasted *off*, and were ultimately sent back and taken off the bill). After dinner, we were escorted by the restaurant manager to the velvet roped hotel lounge area where there was *LIVE* music. SO FUN.

T6E1TCFE3EbcyEltmqzdsw.text: Good music great service. Been a fan and a frequent customer of the Hollywood Roku. The sashimi was marginal but other specialties were as expected. Also the drinks were better than the Hotel bar!

GA03CaqyDB9PBimsjDJwtg.text: We came on a Sat night with reservations. The place was busy. Super busy. They tried to seat us on a wet booth and looked at me like I was crazy when I declined. We waited at the bar for 20 minutes for a table.   The wait on our order for 6 rolls - was 45 minutes. Just to get one of our rolls. The drinks were served fast- I will give them that.   We ended up leaving though we weren't full- just to head somewhere else. Food tasted fine. Nothing extraordinary. Service was good. Not her fault. Kitchen was super slow - they did take the rolls off our bill to apologize.  Maybe you will go on a less busy night.

7c2GPbJFw7Fhm84lowHA7g.text: This is really only for the breakfast served at the W hotel...I didn't eat here during lunch or dinner...but bfast was good.  It's a little pricey, but the service is super friendly and the restaurant itself is nice.  Swanky.  It was uber convenient so all good with me.

1Uq2KtFnGTOO-uJNLx0byg.text: I rarely give one star; however, this dining experience was one of four bad ones. Having given this a chance over and over, I'm throwing Sushi Roku under the bus.  Three of the four times I've dined here, the drinks came after the food.  The front staff are friendly but some of the staff was down-right rude. I've worked in the service industry for years and cannot believe the attitudes of the servers.  One of the servers lied to us and told us they were out of pitchers because she didn't want to sell $15.00 pitchers.  The manager actually admitted that she lied and there were plenty of pitchers.  She also lied on our tab and took advantage of a large table who would have tipped more than 30% had she been honest and courteous.  The food I would rate, okay.  I find that they don't use the best ingredients and inexpensive soy sauces, etc.    I would definitely not recommend this place to anyone.  If you want bad service in a convenient W Hotel location, go for it, but Roka Akor far surpasses Sushi Roku.

IBglUukn20GNwiBXH8et_g.text: Craving sushi in Phoenix is probably a death wish.  (Sorry Phoenix people, I'm from California where there's sushi galore!)  I couldn't find any decent sushi nearby, and since I was staying near the W, I yelped and found Sushi Roku!! (Thanks again yelpers!)    We got there in time for happy hour and enjoyed $5 appetizers and discounted rolls.  I had a bellini, my husband had a beer and we had a ton of food to share between us.  Delicious.  A little bit more on the pricey side, but very fresh and tasty.    It also made me feel better that this restaurant is a sister restaurant to Sushi Roku in Los Angeles (one of my friends' favorite places in LA).  :)  Hmmm...just noticed some yelpers had breakfast here. Ew...sushi for breakfast just sounds kind of wrong!

TpQswopwzCQVO3NX9mNpXg.text: Yellowtail, Atmosphere, and Dan the manager from NYC is the reason for the 5-star review. Heard we were in town from New York and he came over and introduced himself.  Thank you for personalizing our visit.

OJmSWZw79s7jiJYXP3wEew.text: Bartender was awful, was more concerned about his plans after work. Tried closing out because of the bad service....had to flag bar back down to get bartender to close us out. While closing out commented that it has been almost 30 minuets since you've been back....he told me I was wrong and he was "trying his best" piss pour service at the bar.

VXPF8iZkAGo45z_51sW-xQ.text: I am only giving this restaurant three stars for the exceptional waiter, without him this would be a two star review. Very small selection on the menu and mediocre quality of the sushi. My wife and I ended up just sharing a plate of chicken fried rice after trying 4 different rolls suggested by the waiter.

2F_C8os7E6WKMlG5nQZzNg.text: Atmosphere to spare and a menu that will speak to everyone. If you can please both my wife (atmosphere) and me (food) you gone magical.

TscC0m0wHxoPraPm1oi6lw.text: One of the best sushi bars in the Phoenix area! The fish is amazing, staff is extremely professional and friendly, and the atmosphere is upbeat yet comfortable. I highly recommend this spot, and will keep coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Live octopus sashimi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Goldeneye nigiri
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Toro &amp; Jalapeno

SYYXAzUFcH68T6CF-_77qw.text: When we arrived, we were asked if we had a reservation. The restaurant was two thirds empty. The hostess said they were booked up, but if we waited a few minutes something might open up. There always an entire wall's worth of tables open. She let us know that a table had opened up.  I overheard the same pitch five times over the course of dinner. When we left, the empty wall of tables had one party and three empty tables. I hate fake exclusivity.  The food was good, the service was fine.

DbI-abHDkYW8Yd2axMA3Cw.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi place in Vegas.  The quality of the seafood is top notch.  The tuna is melt in your mouth amazing.  Great place to try out a lot of different dishes.  Lots of gluten free options to choose from as well.    The service is fantastic, and restaurant is located in Ceasar Forum and its relatively easy to get to.

itQTzvQS8HsgBpCmCFcEHw.text: Blown away by this restaurant! I've been looking for a good place for sushi in the valley for a while.. and I have been extremely disappointed at every turn. Out here it is almost never real, authentic Japanese sushi. I kid you not, it's hard to find one that doesn't put hot sauce on their spicy tuna.. it's frightening actually. Well, I stumbled on this place on a Saturday afternoon. My boyfriend and I were extremely underdressed, as the place looks really upscale. We almost turned around and left because of that, but I'm SOOO glad we didn't. The service was amazing. Very knowledgeable, fun waiters. The place is gorgeous. My cocktail was top-notch. But the SUSHI... OH MY GOD. It was AMAZING. The best sushi I think I've ever had even outside of Arizona. Extremely fresh. Made to perfection. Melt in your mouth, delicious, truly authentic sushi. We will DEFINITELY be back.. and definitely not in our sweats this time.

iX8Sxx0h6iufQMTfE_FrKw.text: Robert is a diligent server. He was obliging and great at suggestions of fish to our preference on the menu selection. He went above and beyond to retrieve the sake sommelier to better acquire our taste pallets and table service.   The wine sommelier's name was Steve. He was knowledge in the different rices and their fermation process. We choose the Otokoyama. They warmed it up for us. Delicious. It is dry and medium in fullness, without the sweet after flavor that I am personally not fond of.   We enjoyed the Brussels sprouts, blue crab tartare, and a special that is not on the menu, but to die for, big eye tuna carpaccio. Then, we ordered the crab handrolls and finished with the matzu platter.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QrwGifiJ9qy0Mmux9PrtrQ.text: What an enjoyable dining experience! The service - Tim was my waiter - was extraordinary!! Engaging, good suggestions, and sincerely interested in how I was enjoying the food. Ok... the sushi rolls are just average. The Katana roll was puzzling in that it reminded me of a manufactured sushi roll offering at my local grocery store... it was NOT even interesting let alone compelling. The tuna/avocado roll was much better... simplicity is their strong suit. The tuna belly (Toro) was SUPERB! What's not to love? The surprise of the evening were the Brussels Sprouts. Order these 1st with a cocktail and study the menu. They are the perfect starter.  Note to self: I'll stick with the sushi in the future and forego the rolls. The guys behind the sushi counter know what they're doing... and the fish is uber fresh! But most important - I'll ask to sit at one of Tim's tables!

k9TBCzmW8Ssd6_vEvxz74w.text: Trendy interesting looking place with friendly staff.  Food was pretty good but just not worth the expense and super small portions.  Great for people watching and burning a hole in your pocket but that's about it.

rBqVWmxY7b3WI-eKK-dabQ.text: Bug infested   Sat at the sushi bar and all of the sudden 4 or 5 small bugs appeared all over the bar.    Manager politely offer an apology but I was surprised to know that this is a known problem to them.   He explained that they been spraying 2 times a week but still have the problem.   They should shut the place down until problem is taken care of.

x0WIsTyEesTle-1KSGBfdA.text: Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.  Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.We had a reservation for 530PM at this establishment, mainly because we couldn't have one for 5PM. It may seem early for sushi, but we had a show to go to and did not want to rush. We arrived a bit early hoping we could get seated a bit early but that was a hard stop. No way that you get seated before 530PM. I find it a little odd, but sure whatever.   The place is very nice, and adjacent to one of the most awesome lounges in the city (the lounge of the W). It is a premium spot and they have turned it into a nice place. The service is good and on par, however we did feel that it was a massive up-selling from the waitress. She suggested very elaborate and large creations when it was clear that we already had our minds made up in what we were having. A bit pushy, not too bad.  The food was amazing. I mean I feel I know sushi, and this was very very well done. Every roll was distinct from each other and never did I feel it was vinegary or otherwise flawed. The only thing I found a little strange was that we were the first to sit, and the place was at low capacity and yet our food came out over a long period of time. Now we were all sharing and talking so no real issue, but imagine if someone truly only wanted something in particular... they might have had to wait until the end of the whole dinner.    With that said, I will come back here though. It is a bit pricey, but for celebration or whatnot it is a very thorough experience and worth the cost.

5W3hLDuw7S5pv78Z9hIjQQ.text: An absolute favorite of ours!! The food is outstanding, service impeccable, and just an overall wonderful dining experience. My husband has eaten sushi in many places and feels this is by far the best, and for the non sushi lovers the steak is amazing. Can't wait to go back.

TwWvcIY776J1wpsEvYgeow.text: Uni. All day long. Uni @ $5 per piece. Uni from Santa Barbara. Uni that melted in my mouth.  I preferred the nigiri over the rolls.  Fun place with what appears to be a good happy hour menu. Decently priced bottles of bubbly. Gets loud on weekends, but it's the W and to be expected.

N4RYGG03Vh6A6ERERUX0Rg.text: This review is a little stale.  Its been a few months, but Sushi Roku popped up as a place I had not reviewed yet.  The sushi?  Great.  That's not what this review is about.  Everyone at my table had been drinking, except me, the night in question.  We ordered up, I collected cash from everyone, and I paid the balance on my card.  When we got the bill back to sign - I noticed it was a little light.  10 dollars was missing from the cash amount.  What ensued was a debacle of the waitress trying to tell me that I counted the money wrong (I didn't) and looking around under the table for the missing money.  I have seen this scam before, and I am sure it works great on drunk patrons.  Not so great on sober ones.  I didnt want to waste anymore time so I just took the 10 bucks out of her tip and we headed out the door.  She chased us down to tell us she found the 10 dollars under the table.  The same one we just looked under with flashlights while she was inside.  I have told several friends about this - and I dont think we will be back.  I can only imagine how many other people have probably been ripped off like this.  After all - it's only 10 bucks, who will notice?  This cheap bastard.  That's who.

_P7Va3_aVxg9Gcl1nHZTRQ.text: I was part of the large group mentioned by another reviewer. I was lucky enough to get the undercooked chicken. I've been very ill since. The chicken was an appetizer and came as part of our tasting menu that the restaurant created for us. I'll never forget the experience because of my current state of hell. Thank you so much for trying to kill me.

4EyylVMxLEGf3Z1RXKmA6g.text: Some of the best sushi hands down since I moved out here from Cali!! I've been here twice already and both times I left smiling. Great fish variety and super fresh! They also had a few fishes I've never had before so it was a great experience. I strictly eat sashimi and/or sushi only and can say this is seriously some of the tastiest and freshest fish I've tried in the valley. The chefs are super friendly and funny. Great customer service all around. I am definitely going to become a regular!

4oEBqKWw4ejGjgjrxPMU7A.text: Dined here for Christmas dinner. In summary, good food but service was something to be desired.   We made reservations via open table for 7:15. We checked in at 7:10 and were told it would be a few minutes before our table was ready. Within those few minutes, we were asked 3 different times if we had checked in. I'm unsure if this was a one-off because it was busy due to the holiday. In any case, we were seated closer to 7:30 and ordered right away as we knew exactly what we wanted. It was 7:45 before we got water for the table and 10 minutes later, we finally got the bottle of sake we had ordered.   We ordered 2 ramens and only one came out so we had to wait another 15 minutes for the 2nd bowl. The sushi and sashimi were pretty good. In short, the kitchen and wait staff seemed overwhelmed and service was definitely lacking.   3 stars for the food and the effort!

CYWi7X1qWHVcbzmpsULj-A.text: This place is the Best I have been too In a while. The seaweed salad was a hearty size and tasty. The Octopus special was to die for and I like the sashimi large slices. I might go back tonight so good and the sushi chefs very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Octopus
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sashimi

AGfbuY0V-qhDtNiWCn0IHg.text: Located in the W Hotel in Scottsdale, AZ. The vibe at Sushi Roku is great! I highly recommend this place for both a great meal and a great atmosphere. Perfect to start the night before going out and hitting the town. The Salmon Carpaccio in Truffle Oil was ridiculously good and the White Lotus Roll goes down as one my favorite rolls ever (also has truffle oil in it). Definitely worth checking this place out!!  Follow me on Instagram @kgsfoodadventures to see food from across the country!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Carpaccio in Truffle Oil
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gensai Roll
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. White Lotus Roll

C558yyhZkLCqHd_sZXbJ1Q.text: The decor of this sushi spot in the W hotel is like an exotic cave. Lots of atmospheric details. We had cocktails and dinner. My first cocktail was very pink and too sweet but I really liked the lychee mojito.  As for the food, it was more fancy fluff and flare than tasty. We had edamame, a bunch of rolls, the fried rice, and three or four desserts.  In my opinion, not one thing stood out as being great. Particularly disappointing was the grilled octopus. It's usually one of my favorite dishes and I was thrilled to see it on the menu but it was flavorless and a bit chewy.   I might go back for cocktails but likely not for food.

qoryMqu4H9fjZwCVkTmfgg.text: If you want to feel fancy, this is the place. If you want a good value for your food, then you should probably go elsewhere. We ordered quite a lot of food. We had the katana roll, the salmon carpaccio, Kobe skewers and quite a number of sushi pieces. You can check the pictures.   Although the decorations were quite amazing, I didn't really come here for the decorations. I guess you can say you are paying for the atmosphere, and if you really like the atmosphere, then it is worth your value.   However, I am more of a value of food kind of guy. I felt that I have tasted sushi exactly the same as this at other places that cost probably half as less. And I think I've tasted sushi better than this at other places half as much as this. I guess what I'm saying is the sushi is overpriced.   They have fancy names and probably have fancier presentation. If you break it down, it just tastes like every other place really.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sushi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kobe skewers
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wagyu

HRwsHHkYpnqlYkL8Slp5iA.text: Decent meal at Sushi Roku in the W hotel. Stopped in for lunch on the weekend and it wasn't very busy. Service was fine, and so was the food. The karaage was ok, good texture but lacking a bit of flavor. It needed a good squeeze of lemon and a lot of the aioli.   The lunch deals are pretty good - we had the chirashi and an unagi donburi. The meal starts with miso soup, which is good but did not come out very hot and was cool very quickly. The chirashi (regular, not deluxe), had a pretty standard selection of fish on it. Everything tasted fine but nothing was very special (but also, can't really complain at the $17 price point). The unagi was a little better - 6 decently sized pieces of unagi that tasted pretty good, but definitely benefited from the eel sauce (needed extra for the rice as well).  Overall it's a pretty standard sushi place as far as I'm concerned, and I'd try others before returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chirashi
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Miso soup
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Karaage

wlEkiWwlJtbtEpeMt-7JhQ.text: Scottsdale social scene is all about being seen, so if that's what you are seeking Sushi Roku is your place. The sushi is over priced for the visitors, which is why I went. But truly if you have folks in from out of town the bar is happening in the lobby of the W and dinner will be lively.  My review is more of 3 1/2 star mostly because the inflation on very basic sushi. You definitely go here for the scene, not necessarily for amazing sushi. If you are not into loud music, rowdy patrons, and slow service; this is will not be your jam.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing!!! Sushimi

C0JvAsckdDLJJWHnz_05vg.text: Love the ambience and customer service here. Our server was fantastic. Came to pick up plates at the right time, didn't come over too many times, but always made sure we had drinks or liked what we had. People should take notes from Emilie! Perfect date night, and the crispy spicy tuna taste even better than anywhere else I've had it. Spicy tuna is not typically my favorite, but I'll definitely be back! Thanks for an enjoyable evening to my hot date and Sushi Roku.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZBKyo_jxF5wmmRJ6djxC2Q.text: Great choice for some good quality food! We were a bit complicated but the servers were very nice and accommodating! We came here to try the uni udon but for some reason it was taken off the menu. After asking about it, they informed us that they were able to make the Uni Udon and it came out amazing! We also got the toro jalapeno cut roll, kumamoto oysters, and the wagyu skewer. Everything was flavorful and would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Uni Udon, Toro and Jalapeno Roll, Happy Hour Kumamoto Oysters, &amp; wagyu skewer

dr2tPXGN4NL_PB5a-WIShQ.text: Stopped by for dinner on a slow Tuesday night. Great location and ambience, however, service and food could've been better. The crunchy tuna roll was soggy, edamame tasted off and we had to ask for wasabi and soy sauce more than once. Waitress was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
