SMXdc8eAIqFYhQ1IutGMQg.text: It's not as good as it once was.  Quite frankly each time I've eaten here the experience went down a notch. Maybe it's just been off nights.

MfRxHU6N0Ae7NoE90zOh1w.text: The sushi is fresh and I had a good time with friends there last night!! They took a pretty big reservation for us pretty last minute so that was super nice of them! I think the food is good but for the price, I think you can get sushi just as good somewhere else!

5V1t_08KGiPRP7SoDE_nXQ.text: Ramen noodle fans, listen up! I've searched all over Scottsdale for a decent ramen noodle and I've finally found the place. I came here with a group for sushi, which was amazing. There is a vast array of options and but what caught my eye was the lone ramen noodle option they had- hakata ramen which was described as a spicy miso pork broth. What was delivered to me was an intensely creamy broth full of deep, rich flavor. The pork had just the right amount of crisp, so delicious. The noodles were also very well done. I've since then come back numerous times just for the ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hakata ramen

DTdHVDuWC6aWqsBloNN9gg.text: This place is all the things I hate about Scottsdale. Loud music in the bar clashing with louder music in the adjacent lounge bar- the cacophony is ear-aching and makes conversation impossible. Servers are friendly- but understaffed for the crowds on a Friday night. The place is a scene- and not in a good way.  Food had a few hits, but the quality wasn't good enough for the price. - Seaweed salad ($11)- this was pretty fantastic, loved the different mix of seaweeds - Organic garden salad ($11) had potential, but drowning in dressing - Uni pasta ($19) super rich with an odd sweetness, one bite was more than enough - Miso eggplant ($10.50) came out nice and hut, this was really tasty - Roasted cauliflower w/ red dates ($12) good, but a small portion for the price - Kimchee cucumber salad ($6.50)- big chunks were awkward to eat and a bit slimy. pass. - Senshi roll- ($16)- not impressed, small without much flavor  Will leave this place for the masses.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seaweed Salad
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Miso Eggplant Dengaku
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted Cauliflower w/ dates

Yik16qfO5fxjDuyDL5vXxw.text: Swanky vibes, delicious eats and half off bottles of wine on Sunday. It's safe to say that Sushi Roku was a great experience!   Not many other restaurants in the area are open late night on a Sunday, so this was one of our only options when hunger struck at around ten pm. I went here because I was staying at the W, but if you are in the area and are craving solid Japanese food I'd say it's definitely worth going out of your way. Especially if you want some quality late night eats.   If you aren't a sushi lover then don't fret. The menu has a ton of meat, noodle and veggie dishes to choose from. I started off with miso soup. Prices are definitely steeper than your average sushi spot (what else could be expected at the W?). 7$ for miso soup is hefty but this was honestly some of the best miso soup that I've ever had. For my main I went with chicken fried rice. The portion was absolutely huge and came with a ton of high quality chicken and was topped with lots of fresh scallions.   When I passed by on Friday + Saturday night it was very crowded, so I'd suggest calling ahead for a weekend dinner. There is also a nice sized outdoor seating section with heat lamps.   Prices are high but so is quality and portions are big. Would definitely recommend.

fv8O2Fm9Af5CbA8MNKn5kw.text: This place is one of my favorites in Scottsdale. They always have the freshest fish and oysters. The oysters here are some of the best I have ever had actually. Service is always really good but can be slow sometimes. Location is great right next to the W lounge always makes for a great night.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8JVNJXt3iSNO-dUAypvQEQ.text: This is my 3rd time at Sushi Roku and I'm already looking forward to the next time. Sushi chef Aaron is amazing!  I don't even need to look at the menu. I just tell him the things I like and he creates a masterpiece. My only problem is that I live in California and only get to Scottsdale 2-3 times a year. Can't wait for the next trip. Sushi Roku is the best sushi bar EVER!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chef Aaron creation

EfDHOHjX8H6q80W5l_-m4w.text: Love! Love! Love! Dined here for dinner the other night and had a great experience. Not only is the ambience really fun and cool but the sushi is incredible! I have very high standards coming from LA and Sushi Roku did not disappoint. Everything from the miso eggplant to the salmon with truffle oil was delicious. We will definitely be back next time we're in Scottsdale!

gMWzZ60rHiINs_YARUenLg.text: The drinks here are amazing thanks to our lovely bartender Sarah! She went above and beyond to make the cocktails to our liking. Kyle was also very attentive to us and made sure our experience was exceptional. Love Sushi Roku! Also thank you Sous Chef Joey for the Brussels sprouts! So yummy!

Kx82pvLmDMNR2Eg7CzWzOg.text: I don't often give 5 stars, but Sushi Roku earned it tonight.  Delicious sushi in a very upscale setting.   The Katana roll was very tasty,  expertly prepared and quick to my sushi bar seat. Perhaps marginally overpriced at $19.50, but includes three W hotel premium.    Kimchee cucumber sunomono also very good,  although came out well after sushi.  But,  I'd rather have sushi out quickly so not too concerned.    Pleasant desert choices from chocolate volcano cake to michi, to s'mores.  The frozen lemon souffle was delicious.     Esteban's service was attentive and engaging.  He definitely looks out for the customers and to provide a nice dining experience.    Well done tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frozen lemon souffle.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

olNhxwDf2Pr2TXkZmI6zCA.text: This is certainly one of the best sushi places I've had not only in Scottsdale but anywhere. The quality is incredible and the rolls, although simple, are incredibly well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Cp_hG07VeimU9qYgw_8NXw.text: Pretty good sushi We did order the halibut sliders and was expecting something along the lines suitable for a sushi restaurant (i.e. rice patties as the bun). I was hoping they thought outside the box w these but no, plain ole buns w deep fried halibut. :-/  Ehh just ok  Everything else was great

FPsUAMHrn4vYidKBMSfNqQ.text: My favorite upscale sushi in scottsdale. The W hotel is beautiful and Roku is no different. The vibe is upbeat with trendy music playing in the background. Everyone in the restaurant is sexy and dressed to impress. Great date place or pre-party place in walking distance of many clubs nearby.

4oO10Z8KpH8YrVOGXIVWFw.text: Sushi Roku is a cute chic restaurant inside the W, but I was unimpressed with the semi slow service and small variety of sushi variety on the menu.  All in all, I think it's a good place to hang out in groups because of the decor and the drink selection.

5EGMTiXVXd_2_zIKx7BXIA.text: Mediocre. I went safe with a spicy tuna cut roll and it looked good but the consistency was like mush.  There was nothing else in there to give it that crunch that makes them so good.  Also, the only thing that looked good in the sushi case was yellowtail and it had excellent consistency but lacked flavor.  The miso soup was too salty at a rip off at $4.  I ate here for convenience only (stayed at the W).  Definitely a skippable experience.

DssgkbbL3bXmAHzHY5ORKw.text: The sushi bar here just rock.  Second and third visit to  Sushi Roku, P made a bee line for the sushi bar.  That made all the difference.    First time here we sat at a booth and while the food was good, there wasn't anything to make me want to go out of my way to come back.  But the sushi bar just transform the experience.  The sushi chefs are friendly and willing to engage you and what's fresh and good.   I put my trust and their recommendation and left happy and satisfied.

apxNz3aligwSuQUjoIki_w.text: The sushi was OK, but I would spend my sushi budget on another of the many places in the valley where you can get very good sushi for a reasonable price.  My wife and I went for lunch on a Monday - the place was almost empty at 12:30.  The first demerit was the fact that they had the AC turned down to 60 degrees.  Ironically, the doors were opened wide to the patio as if they were trying to cool the desert  - the electric company must love them.   We decided to stay warm and sit outside on the patio which fronts Camelback Rd  - pretty busy and loud with road noice (second demerit).  A salad, a roll, four sushi (8 pieces) and water to drink plus tip was almost $70... quite a bit more than your average lunch.  I would not have minded if the sushi was outstanding, but it wasn't.  Although the quality seemed to be very good, as you would expect, but the sushi themselves were very moderately sized.

rADjdxIUhTdorl9xbUnXPg.text: Asked the server if the chef did omakase and we were very pleased with what came out of the kitchen and from the sushi bar. Great service decor and food.

1MtR2ikuVxWXaXfpj_Ueyw.text: Love the W but don't love that this is where I had to eat breakfast when i was there for my stay-cation.  Don't get me wrong, the Eggs Benny are fantastic and the sushi is too, but the pricing is eye-popping-high and the service "yokunai desu!!"  Kind of expect a jacket-required/reservation needed for their Shibuya style high prices but maybe they want to weed out the $ 30k millionaires.  Um, we're not in Tokyo anymore, Toto.  Since there are no other options when dining at the W, I will have to admit, I will probably be back, but not by choice.

oG2JJsxAPXhBAxA_5QztdQ.text: My only complaint is they are pricey compared to other quality sushi restaurants ie sakana on Hayden and Indian school but the food was good service was good and the ambience is comfortable

2iNbvO0-5WbdbEa-H99c-g.text: Came back to Sushi Roku with a friend and it was still fabulous.  They've expanded their happy hour menu.  We ordered the Sauteed Chinese Green Beans, Miso Eggplant Dengaku, Spicy Tuna Roll, Spicy Yellowtail Roll and the Tuna Tartar with Avocado & Crostini.  Everything was so flavorful, fresh and delicious.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  We got all that food for under 20 bucks!  Sushi Roku is the best kept secret for quality sushi at amazing prices.  The W Hotel is so beautiful too!

pxoOFiA_iyVbFd6ixSr6WA.text: Mmmmm, Mmmmmm, Great food.  The popcorn shrimp here are to die for-they leave a wonderful lasting impression.  So does their desert plate...The service was wonderful and quick and attending to us.  Also, we had been lounging at the pool all day and were not looking so sharp but they didn't seem to have a dress code or anything as they were more than welcoming.  It is a bit pricey but i'm not sure you can expect anything less when going to a W Hotel.  I recommend this place to anyone who wants a more chic sushi experience, cool atmosphere, doesn't mind paying the extra dollar and enjoys tasty food.

2_bIQPP2rFBpxMZQtUDugw.text: I treat myself periodically to this place and felt the need to finally write a review about how great this place is.  To be honest....Sushi is not really my thing, but when I'm in the right mood to enjoy a place with outstanding sushi and pleasant atmosphere this seems to be the best that I have found.  It's always clean, very friendly service and the last time I was in I had a server named Kyle who did not disappoint me one bit about his recommendation on a roll and prompt with any special requests I had.  Good choice when you are in the mood for sushi!

QZ_RdxvhbIdhjUgqZETbiw.text: This was a night of new taste experiences for me.  We arrived and the atmosphere was very light, ambient, and loungy.  No surprises since this is at the W Hotel.  The restaurant staff was very friendly, and we were greeted fairly quickly.  We ordered the edamame which was a first for me, (I'm behind the times on this one)  A nice different taste.   I ordered a blackberry smash which was nothing short of wonderful.  I definitely could have ordered a double.  Another person in our party had a cold sake that I found was soo good, I had to try it twice.  Our waiter was very friendly, down to earth and low key.  Amongst us we ordered some sushi, I ordered the Ji-Dori chicken and the other person in our group ordered the Braised Pork.  Apparently they were out of pork so that was not available which was a disappointment.   Food was out at a decent time and the sauce with the mushrooms and potatoes had a wonderful zing and afterbite.  Our sushi eater had his eyes rolling back the entire time with his head agaisnt the booth so I can only assume the experience was nothing short of orgasmic.  We only had a small snafu with a groupon discount, but that was corrected without issue.  I'll be sure again to come to try the pork and have multiple blackberry smashes.  Even though I have not been won over to try sushi, I'm more than willing to have this restaurant experience again.

Xirv9T8j9dRf26hcpnyfAg.text: Loved the decor. The "strawberry fizz" drink was delicious and had quite the kick without tasting alcoholic. Also had a taste of the "pear martini" which was a bit sweet for me but my dining partner loved it. The yellowtail carpaccio with peppers was yummy. Had to send back the rock shrimp because it was soggy and weird... ick! Tried some new things for sushi... liked my first taste of kanpachi, the ikura (one of my usual  favorites) was good, nothing special. Also tried uni--- really good! Had tried it once before but it wasn't fresh enough. Basically, you'll pay ridiculous prices but the fish quality is actually good. Mom had the chilean seabass which was pretty good except not cooked all the way through, ick! Service was great and our server was a sweetheart. Wouldn't rush back due to price, but it was still a fun, satisfying dinner with a few hiccups!

VNeXI6-yju6DKGdCNfGIJw.text: I would definately agree with some other reviewers that this is an ambience place. At that, it is gorgeous. The food was pretty good but really nothing spectacular. Some interesting technique to put sticky rice on a kabab which gave the rice a nice texture. I saved up my OpenTable rewards points to go here on Valentine's day and ended up feeling guilty when we left. Staff was nice but I am all about the food and this place just didn't cut it for me, especially for the price/hype.

zSSDBOlMdJb-7AjWTnTtxg.text: If I could give this 3.5 stars I would. The food is a solid 3 - really nothing special, especially considering the price. It's not bad, but it doesn't stand out. The ambiance is a 4. the place is beautiful.

N-RlXPTeMsiSTfUz6ZiWzA.text: Not much of a hang out in Scottsdale person, but we happened to stumble on a Groupon for this place one day.  (And it was an awesome Groupon)  The place had a very nice atmosphere and decor, and we went a little earlier so it wasn't super busy.  I always feel bad for the servers that get those groupons because I know some assholes dont tip very well when bills are discounted, but our server Zach, was upbeat and very helpful in helping us pick out menu items.  The quality of the fish was excellent.  The spicy tuna on the rice cake thing was soooooooo good.  This place is definitely pricey, but if you can afford it, its definitely worth it.

eHcxUqf7ZhhM4VYO7Qc4tw.text: The sushi was pretty good for happy hour! I don't like it nearly as much as ZEN32 but the waiters were cute and its a little fancier than some other local sushi joints. A good choice if your tired of other sushi places in the valley.

1SYQ1OeLhF2GEQJXDTj4GQ.text: Decided to go with friends and check out their happy hour.  The atmosphere and setting very nice and clean, maybe because there was only two other parties in the restaurant.  The service was great, the waiter was very nice and helpful.  Sushi, I only had the california roll, but they do use real crab, plus their wasbi was really good, soo much better than Stingray, which in my opinion is over priced and not worth, and the rock thing, seriously, I don't know of any Asian that has a rock on their kitchen counter to set their rice spatula at home nor for their chopsticks.  I tried their Kobe sliders, I've had better at Roka.. I think if you are going to the W and the restraurant enjoy the sushi, serivce and maybe the drinks, but everything else, is up to you for review.

tNFds-fiivdN7nWTX1Yphw.text: Like many restaurants in Scottsdale, this is all style and no substance.  The food is good, but subpar for the prices paid.  I even returned a glass of wine because it simply was not worth the $10.00 cost.  And we did not think the menu was anything special or unique.

9LEt-B8ibQwJWGHnV-CcTQ.text: So, the first word that comes to my mind is LOUD.  The food was good, and the drinks were good, but it was hard to hear the people at my table.   I can't think of anything that stands out on the menu as being great, but we had a few rolls, the shrimp cups (those were the best), and some tempura.  All in all, it was a scene, pricey, and decent food.  Will I go back?  Not sure.

Jn3wD3u1HqWoxH_S1Yx0ww.text: Since I live in Florida I'm a little spoiled with good sushi quality. I didn't feel this restaurant had great sushi and it was extremely overpriced.

742tWNAPvrSfsi7J9ph4sQ.text: I love this place for the ambiance and the appetizers. The Hanabi is ridiculously good. I usually order three or four orders of these things (seriously) and rarely order an entree. On the odd occasion when I have, it was good not great which is why I can't with a clear conscience give it five stars. Also the Tuna Sashimi Carpaccio and Yellowtail Diced Chilies appetizers are amazing. We usually get two of each of those as well. If I could just rate the appetizers I would give it five stars all day long but like I said the entrees were just okay. The margaritas and martinis are tasty but a bit pricey and not very big. I highly recommend the appetizers though!

iH5QfHlFMHS_l5lQDlf1KQ.text: Liked it!  It's in the W hotel and my first trial of this chain.  The decor is great and I loved the large tables.  Sushi quality was very good.  I still prefer Nobu, but this chain is very comparable.  I had the usual mix of what I like: edamame beans, unagi sushi, a sashimi mix, rolls and their rock shrimp.  I first fell in love with rock shrimp at Nobu, and I think Sushi Roku does a very good version of it!  Tasty and good sized potions.  The fish has a nice flavor and texture.  The rolls were good quality - we had a spicy salmon roll (not on the menu but they allowed the subsitution), tuna toro with jalapeno, and a dynamite.  This place is pricey but I was happy with the meal and service and would return.

W6oXg8mTmdWjSDjft_mndw.text: Loved all the sushi and plates we ordered. Excellent service and a nice place to eat. Maybe a bit pricey but in a special occasion its worth it. I don't recall anything I didn't like so if you like sushi in general you can try anything and will be really good. The only thing I remember not liking as much was the spring rolls with strawberries for dessert. All other desserts were really good.

H3_syf5p6u9WOvY9GBE0IQ.text: Didn't know what our group waned to eat so we left it to the waiter. We told him the things we liked so he could sprinkle it throughout our menu. It was a surprise followed by surprise. Everything was so good! The vibe was definitely club-ish and dark with loud electronic dance music. Lots of suits, money and egos flooding the place but I didn't mind. As long as the food spoke for itself, which it did.

xRsiEifY1iCLYnrxASJauw.text: Wow. Is the only word I can think of. Menu is beyond imagination. Excellent   Will return.

UcjnPnneSg2GefjsXt_icA.text: First I want to say the food was amazing. We tried literally everything on the HH menu, and had sake to wash it down. Food was amazing. Service was so-so. They screwed up our tabs, overcharging me and other in our party. We didn't have any flatwear/chopsticks for a straight minute, and had to flag down someone to get some minutes after our food arrived. Service needs to be tightened up, they need a manager on duty at all times or something. Also it's not a bad idea to have your food runner smile. He hates his job and he projects it, dampening our loose, and fun group.

2DTXz13uIYOpRh0dqXpfWA.text: Yummy mix of traditional and Californian style sushi - some wicked combinations but a little bastardised at times [sacrificing the simple elegance of quality ingredients for loud and bold flavours].  Flavour comment above may be more of a personal preference than a 'criticism' as I enjoy the simplicity of more traditional Japanese fare.  Busy vibe and great service.  Favourite dishes: yellowtail sashimi with crispy onions, fillet wrapped asparagus and the sinful [yet shamefully un-Japanese] mouth watering popcorn shrimp morsels.

U2zON3_RZNVmQ8EFZSHixg.text: SooOoo hard to find good sushi in Scottsdale.

6nqn5AR7-v-1-XOGX0kmxg.text: I came here on Wednesday night before an event and I was in a terrible hurry. The hostess was naturally a bit overwhelmed because there were so many people crowding the connecting bar and almost flooding into the restaurant. When j told her I was in a hurry she suggested I take a seat at the bar. We found a table in the bar area and were immediately greeted by Alex our server. He was absolutely wonderful and immediately took our food and drink order. He completely took care of us and we were eating in a matter of minutes. I give this place 5 stars because of Alex's 5 star treatment to us. He fulfilled our every request quickly and speedily and got us to our event on time!

I9rwGNRpxTOhvRp2fZKsOQ.text: It was ok... Decent food, creative cocktails. Nice modern atmosphere. Not bad for an evening out in Scottsdale.

s5_aVSHGeB1ekCj6ZPlivw.text: I'll admit I went here out of convenience, 100%. I was staying at the W for a conference, needed to get some work done, so I got takeout and took it up to my room. I got three pretty straightforward items: edamame, yellowtail sashimi with diced chiles (supposedly a "specialty of the house"), and the tuna jalapeno hand roll - and was underwhelmed with all of them.   The texture of the edamame was off on about half of the pods I got - grainy and not moist at all. The pieces that were prepared well were actually delicious, with just the right amount of salt. But WTH, why was half of it wonky?   The yellowtail sashimi was completely overpowered by the sauce it was covered in. Don't get me wrong, the flavors were good, just completely imbalanced. Way too much sauce, and somehow, something with diced chiles didn't even have a hint of spice to it. The yellowtail was sliced so thin that it was unrecognizable even as fish, and the sauce effectively cooked it. This is a dish I particularly love, that my favorite sushi restaurant at home serves perfectly, so I was very disappointed.  These two dishes behind me, I move on to my tuna jalapeno roll. Based on its name, I'm expecting a very clean, crisp roll. When I open the box, I am accosted with huge dollops of spicy mayo on top of each piece. I dab it off so that the roll looks vaguely appetizing, if a bit smeared. I've never tasted a roll so bland in all my life. Apparently that's why it was swimming in mayo - to give it some flavor. Also, it was supposed to come with toro, but they were out of toro and subbed regular tuna, but charged me the same. Toro is a lot more expensive than regular tuna, so I wasn't thrilled about that, but I was expensing dinner, so the cost was really didn't matter.   That said, if I was actually spending my own money, I definitely would not spend it here. Yeah, I'm not from Arizona, I've always lived by some water, so maybe this is the best you can do here, but I really doubt it.

8AvBXMWja3qNDaS3Ai1-lA.text: I love sushi, and it doesn't get better unless you're in Japan. I'm a fan of the elusive bluefin "otoro" sushi, which is next to impossible to find. Sushi Roku, which means sushi 6, after the 6 chefs that started it, has both the bluefin belly as well as the choice cuts from the rest of the fish. The bluefin (Nigiri or Sashimi) will set you back $24 for 4 pieces of the choice cut Hon Maguro or $38 for 4 pieces  of the otoro belly. There's the master chef "Makuto San" who has a rotating staff of 5 assistants that he supervises. The master chef was born in Japan, and unlike most of the sushi chefs in Arizona, is actually Japanese and not Korean. They actually have REAL Kobe beef at Sushi Roku, which is also next to impossible to find. When ordering Kobe anything, please pronounce it "Ko Bay" not "Ko Bee" like a certain moron who's parents are too dumb to name their son properly. When ordering Sake, either Salmon or the drink, please pronounce it "Saw Kay" not "Saw Key," you will avoid sounding uneducated. Remember that the best Sake alcohol is served cold, not hot and comes in several different varieties as wine does, and has subtle changes that will please pallet. Please enjoy, it's a great place to eat.

hWIsEl9aJTGfmeAxllyKWQ.text: My new favorite restaurant in Scottsdale; this place has amazing food, drinks, and ambiance! I dined here with a girlfriend and we sat at a hightop table by the bar which was a great place to see the bartender making these unique drinks that entailed fire. We had to know what they were! The manager came to our table and told us all about this speciality drink which was Sushi Roku's take on a traditional drink, the Old Fashioned but with a twist that included smoking the cocktail glass with a cherrywood charcoal before pouring the drink in. I decided to try one with my favorite whisky Crown Royal; the smoky flavor mixed with the sweetness of the cocktail was delicious! I ordered asparagus wrapped with filet, which was another delicious treat! I cannot wait to return to see what other tasty cocktails the mixologist behind the bar has up his sleeve, and to enjoy another great evening with excellent food and excellent service.

xu3ycorvomdgv7VPtI0uGQ.text: Expected an amazing experience... Was a bit let down. Sushi was ok - but not creative at all. Was trying not to compare, but the sushi at Virago in Nashville is leaps and bounds better (try the Ecuador roll!). Server was pushy and annoying. Was glad to get out of there and get to the "Living Room" at our hotel - the W Scottsdale where Sushi Roku resides.    Tip: if you stay at the W you get a card for a free "appetizer tasting" at sushi roku. This ended up being just an amuse from the chef that they "took off the bill" because of the card we received - and after lots of questions about what we liked and didn't like - 2 meatballs came out as the amuse. That is NOT an appetizer tasting experience - it was an amuse - which in nashville means super cool thing a chef makes that is free and makes you happy. NOT the same at Sushi Roku. Left me disappointed.

v4tRjy0JkBkFQ9ONEhO2ug.text: Absolutely one of my favorite sushi places in all of the state...the filet wrapped asparagus is amazing, spicy tuna on crispy rice cakes are great, all the sashimi rules, the baked crab roll...unlike anything I've ever had, delicious. They have awesome happy hour specials but beware its a very small inside bar, so get there early.  They have amazing mixologists and always have a nice seasonal drink menu.

MaiItfWiP9WIEiGRUhUxLA.text: Sundays have Happy Hour alllll day.  That means great drink and food specials just 50 feet away from the gorgeous W Hotel pool.  Great and quick service right in the heart of Old Town.  You can't beat that.

ULEDYjV_YK3soCdY68qz1A.text: This place has been reviewed enough that I really can't add anything more.  Good food although the hot stuff especially the beef wrapped asparagus things were better than anything raw.  I don't think I'm going to be invited back.  I started doing saki bombs...I know weird when's it's just two people and I kept getting the shot glass stuck somehow in the beer glass.  The waitress was going nuts I could see the sushi chef giving me a stink eye...big mess.  In fairness to them I don't think it was the glasses but somehow I was dropping them wrong in my drunken state.  My apologies so I'm giving them an extra star.  I am sure they know who I am from this review.  I apologize deeply.

qZv5yCyfn-vcDKh9qX9-Ug.text: I've heard good things about Sushi Roku, but I also heard it was quite pricey. That kind of made me hesitant to try it out since there's so many sushi places in Old Town Scottsdale. But last weekend I had dinner there, and it's definitely worth a try.   The atmosphere is exactly what you'd expect from a restaurant inside a W Resort in Scottsdale. It's hip and trendy. If you hate the Old Town crowd, you may want to avoid this place on a Friday/Saturday night.   The staff is super friendly. We had to wait a few minutes for our table (even though we had a reservation), so we hit up the bar. The bartender was really good about recommending some of their specialty drinks, and explaining what was in it. When we did get to our table the waiter was really good about guiding us through their menu.   This place serves a lot more than the standard rolls you find everywhere else.  We had a Toro and Jalapeno roll. Excellent. Exactly what it sounds like.  A garden roll. Really good, it had a Mizuna sauce (think spicy mustard) which really enhanced the flavor.  And a Crunch Spicy Tuna with Avocado. I was a fan, and I'm not usually too thrilled by tempura.   The fish was all fresh and fantastic. Prices were a little more than most places in the area, but nothing to complain about. I would recommend anyone hit this place up with a group before heading over to the bars and clubs in the area.

v070XdJk65EhUoJo7PRRqQ.text: Halibut.  Yellow-tail belly. Seaweed salad. Katana roll, Tori Jalapeno.  Sushi Chef.  Dinner was good, service has been generally good on most dinners here, but every so often I will get left alone and not helped properly.  The sushi is generally good however, extremely over priced compared to other sushi places in the area.  Very trendy and worth a visit, however, unless you are staying at the W, i doubt it would become a regular stop, outside of their AMAZING happy hour specials.

b7DviUUp8LHe5x57OIsvMQ.text: The service we received was incredible. The yellowtail carpaccio was one of the best appetizers I've ever had. We loved the sake as well! I will definitely be returning soon. It was an amazing experience!

NkEjpg3S8ZJlye74DY5Cdw.text: Not what one would expect for a Scottsdale restaurant. We had a large party (15) and made reservations far in advance. The staff was ill prepared to wait on a group of this size. Although we all arrived together, our entrees were all brought out at different times and two people never got their main entree. A few of us had the fried rice and it was very greasy and made one person sick to her stomach. We complained to the manager who comped us a bottle of champagne upstairs at Shade Lounge and also brought out some special desserts. Overall very disappointing and not worth the expense.

w9WHNOXbT-PcqIAAUJSQ-A.text: The sushi is ok but the eye candy is ridiculous.  People in scottsdale don't wear clothes.  Its amazing

F0GXpVazoLe68BLoODj9-w.text: This was my second time eating here. The first time I thought it was just ok, but this most recent time our server Nicole made us have such a great experience. She was very attentive to our party and had a great attitude! We will all definitely be coming back to see her and eat the amazing food!

2Mq3fs_C6IqpJOjKXpjdGQ.text: I have just experience food heaven and a food coma all in one! I have always wanted to try this place because I have heard such good things. Their sunset menu before a show at the Gammage Theater was the perfect excuse. Honestly it was such a good deal for so much food and such tasty options. I went with my sister and we each tried something different off the menu and shared. For starters we got the edamame hummus and garden salad. The wonton chips with the hummus were so good and the salad was so light and refreshing.   For the second course I got the vegetable tempura and popcorn shrimp. Both of which were good, but I would go with the shrimp. The vegetable tempura was good but a bit heavy before the final course.   I got the salmon as my main course and my sister got the filet. The salmon was perfectly cooked, but I didn't need the rice and the sauce was slightly too sweet for me. The filet was so good with a great teriyaki sweet sauce and perfectly smooth mashed potatoes. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful in our selections and the ambiance was nice. Not super crowded but we had an early reservation. I want to go back and try the rest of the menu.

dSZAs9l120Md68Hb4c8BHg.text: Food and service excellent, but young and inexperienced Restaurant Manager in way over his head for such a nice restaurant. Rude and unpolished treatment of customers. Won't be returning anytime soon.

qy3kyKluqHVplCplemLEiA.text: Good sushi, a bit on the expensive side compared to all the other sushi near by. Service was attentive and helpful as my cocktail took a while to make it to the table.

QSCurBPnUuQ69s9pIgGA7g.text: in arizona for business and came to sushi roku to celebrate a birthday with some of my employees - ALL of us were so wow'd by our experience!  one of us had a severe gluten allergy but our server Jennah had such amazing recommendations.  she was so patient and attentive!  i didnt expect sushi roku to have such an extensive "cooked" portion of their menu too!  the sushi was super fresh and the cocktail list was awesome.  once a server myself, it was nice to see the bus staff, food runners and both managers Mike and Dan, check on us multiple times during the course of our meal on what seemed to be a busy thursday night.  both food and service was spot on!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

0Ou842my10jPHBH0ziLEPw.text: Amazing sushi! We were sent by the Doubletree - Very fast service and the waiter we had was very nice - sorry can't remember his name. We went all out and got edamame and a roll of some sort, several different sushi plates, fish, and shared desserts. Everything was great!

F1QpNv26O8pVm1CqGqAIAQ.text: Was recently there for a friends birthday party.  The portions were very small and expensive.  I order the grill chicken as the entre, Lets just say as an avid griller theirs was no comparison to mine, There was no taste to it had no spices or anything, they grilled aplain piece of chicken and covered it in cheap teriyaki sauce, as for the mashed potatos they were plain too, seemed to be fake potatos not real ones no flavor or spices, they also had grilled asperagus on the plate too, also plain no flavor.. To top it all off I was forced to pay 20% gratuity for avaerage service.

k8KMSm2KidMK0bfGeZoFFQ.text: Probably the best sushi in town. Fresh fish - always ! (not easy in AZ) We always enjoy the strong drinks . Not much changes in the menu and the specials repeat, so I would like to see more creativity but overall I love this place!  The bar upstairs should be open for people who eat at the restaurant. You should not sand in line or pay the bouncer to get in after you spent $200 at the restaurant...  I would definitely recommend trying this place! I think they have great happy hours and summer specials right now. Worth a try !

Hftvq9iEuxWzZ8F7_H32DQ.text: Cool atmosphere, friendly service...unique bathrooms (with unisex sinks).  But that's about it.  Serving sizes were pathetic. (I spend $30 for THAT?) Other sushi joints give you double the portions for the same price, if not half the price you'd pay at Roku. Quality was right on par with most other sushi bars. I did feel like I was being hounded to 1) buy a drink, 2) buy edamame, or 3) order more sushi (which many people probably do, considering the portion sizes).  I'm unlikely to return to this venue, unless I begin to miss the decor and snotty valet people.

4kUIXXMY3vwtEInTbn_1jA.text: The restaurant is beautiful and it was a great hangout location. The food was good but by no means spectacular. I expected to be blown away by the food for the price. Small portions and not a lot of creativity for the price. Service was great

ujo2TBkTb2PsF5NhZvKlJg.text: Delicious!  There's one in LA that we used to go to, and the AZ one is just as good even though we're landlocked here!  Must gets are the:   -Spicy tuna on crispy rice   -Marinated Cod   -Baked crab hand roll in soy paper

b8hInm8rrQkLrupEzaIurw.text: This is a great place for groups. It's loctaed in the W Hotel. Good location. Every time a group walks in the chefs make lots of noise. They gave shots on the house and made the meal quite enjoyable!  The sushi was good, not spectacular but very good!

378Lw7vGI5IYHBA8djRLOw.text: We came for happy hour... Planned to stay for dinner but after we realized it would take 20 minutes for someone to greet us and to get the appetizer we decided to head to another sushi place for the main course. There are far better sushi restaurants in Scottsdale.

uu1CaXKuSLJZfO-eYAe6wg.text: Overpriced sushi, underwhelming small portion specialties, and arrogant, W-type servers. A scene for some (skanky women and douchey men in trucker hats), overpriced hotel food for most.

wbr1YEej-i5VPAfJ8El18A.text: Excellent quality and selection of sushi, all fresh and prepared in a unique way.  I would recommend the the Omakase sashimi appetizer, as well as the grilled octopus.  The soft shell crab roll and the individual sushi that we ordered were also excellent.  The only reason I wouldn't give Sushi Roku 5 stars is I was charged for wine that I didn't order and sent back (and unfortunately didn't notice that night that it was on the bill) and the parking is $12 - albeit you get a $6 credit from the restaurant.

79_6uIxazJkKhLjES-GXzw.text: Terrible service, management, and overpriced. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! Overbooking tables, then telling customers that they have a 1 hour limit for dinner for 4? Just embarrassing. Will never return, refer or recommend!

9NDaEzNpxaZmvYBSI5Gv9g.text: Service was very slow. Food delivery was inconsistent. Not worth the price we paid. Won't go back.

ItpJqhRWr94NtCVaGPKCUg.text: Good sushi.  Retarded servers and infested with snobby young Scottsdale douche bags.  If i were to go again, I would go before the Snottsdale kids wake up and I would sit at the bar :-)

LE6O9B30SkOfTShBS29FyQ.text: We loved sushi roku in the W! Rio was an amazing server, Dan and Steve were so fun....thanks to that trio we enjoyed delicious sushi and blanc de blue and will be back!

EhpzTX7hCAQl5w7wl--ffw.text: Awesome! We got a nice cozy booth...had an awesome server-The guy with two names! Haha :) anyway..spicy tuna roll, the edamame, and the kimchee cucumber sunomono were premier! Went two nights..valet was a breeze :) but def a place to dress highline style as patrons are seemingly there to be seen. Haha :) had a blast each night because of how friendly EVERYONE was to us..hostess, mgr., and def our server. Will be back for sure!

hGhfTJUNWlJfQTETc_hymg.text: Sitting at the sushi bar here is the best. The two times I've been here, they've had a good variety of fresh fish here, more than what I've found at other sushi places around town. Finally I've found my amberjack sashimi!!! If you're looking for some great selection of fresh sashimi, come here!

pndsvBhfsytGWDuOGf2p-w.text: This is by far the best sushi establishment I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing. The staff was unbelievably helpful. Our server, Max, was so knowledgable, my girlfriend and I didn't even have to order ourselves. He would bring is things to try and everything was amazing. Truly an experience I will never forget. I don't think I could ever go anywhere else after being so spoiled by the great staff and amazing sushi. Great job!!

yeNcfo9wNAzLAMZ8MOC4pA.text: Will make this short and sweet. Been there twice and both times the food and service was fantastic. I can't say enough on how great the food is. A little pricey but in my opinion well worth it!!

_HhBl3UQKlIIhta9x6dfhg.text: I can't remember when I've actually spit out my food because it was so bad, but that's what happened to me with Sushi Roku's tofu.  I had ordered their "premium homemade tofu" three ways (truffles, caviar and lemon oil, scallions and sesame oil).  The tofu had this sourness that concerned me about its freshness...and then I literally spit out the truffle tofu because it had a rotten taste to it!  Bleh!!    I wasn't expecting great Japanese food in Phoenix, but I thought Sushi Roku would be a good bet since it's part of a group that has restaurants in SoCal and Vegas.  Wrong bet.  The king crab miso soup tasted like the instant miso soup you buy at the grocery store with old frozen crab stuck in it.  Ironically, I had thought it'd be safer to minimize the sushi since I'm surrounded by desert, but the spicy scallop roll was the one item that was actually wasn't bad - nice chunks of scallops that weren't overly sauced.    I've had decent sushi/Japanese food in Phoenix before...but it was definitely not at Sushi Roku.  To add insult to injury, they charge high prices for the bad food and slow service.  Thank goodness I didn't get sick after eating that tofu!

imrmjKW0wBR6Ep6cT41_DQ.text: Delicious decor and stylish food!  Great Bento box for late lunch.  Nice service and professional management.

HKfLEWKKBPw6G_zrEEF89Q.text: Happy hour is the time to come here. Cheap drinks and dishes. Sushi is fresh and delicious! Appetizers are always on point.

TlvRXmmLgXZa7sEU5x-M9A.text: This place never disappoints. I've eaten at  both the Los Angeles and Pasadena, CA location. The Scottsdale location did not disappoint!  The decor here was nicer than the other locations, still rocking that chic and hip vibe that the W hotel and roku restaurants always have. We came with a large group of people, so we ordered a ton of dishes. Here are some highlights and must haves: 1) yellow tail with diced green chile: paper thin slices of hamachi bathed in a yuzu sauce topped with tiny pieces of diced green and red chile. It was delicious as always! 2) spicy tuna on crispy rice: i always order this at every establishment that offers it on the menu and I find that roku does it the best. The rice it's served on is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and comes out warm. It's piled on high with spicy tuna that's bursting with flavor and heat.  3) miso marinated cod: this is another dish I always order when it's available. It's not as good as Nobu Matsuhisa's, but still delicious. The fish is so delicate, it flakes apart easily with a fork and melts in your mouth releasing the flavors and sweetness of both the fish and miso marinade. Absolutely delicious! 4) Chilean sea bass: this is another really delicate fish that had great flavor and served nicely seasoned sauted spinach.  5) crunchy spicy tuna and avocado roll: tuna and avocado with tempura flake crust 6) spicy tuna and shrimp in rice paper roll (I forget the actual name of it): the rice paper gives this roll a unique and delicious flavor.  7) rock shrimp: tempura style mixed with a sweet sauce.   8) mixed seafood tempura: the batter was light and flaky. The scallop and asparagus were my favorites.  9) edamame (soybeans): made al dente and came out steaming hot to our table lightly salted. Delicious!   Everything here from the service to the food to the ambience is great. This place rocks!!

gLqtfBIHJDCKb2AF62-ETQ.text: Located in the W Hotel in Scottsdale.  Great sushi dishes and a great atmosphere.  I've only been there once but the service was great and the food was very taste and fresh.

B6E718aJEAelMePbxZI1Ag.text: Sushi Roku (and the adjoining Scottsdale W Hotel) is the type of place that you either love or hate. It's a total scene, with well dressed, beautiful people jockeying for position and pulling every string they can to bypass the line, get seated immediately, etc. etc. So, my advice to people is to know what you're getting into.....go with the right mindset....and enjoy yourself, because it's quite a show!   There are two different atmospheres to Roku, so you DO have a choice. The main dining room is fun, loud, and buzzing with activity. This is where all the action is. The only thing is, don't anticipate a deep, meaningful conversation with your dining companions. Yell some small talk, sip your drink, and enjoy the food!  The upstairs open patio is another story. While it definitely doesn't have the buzz of the main room, it is filled with large booths and tables, overlooking the W's pool deck. This is a MUCH more tranquil experience, allowing you to enjoy your conversation without straining or yelling.   The food is very good. And, for what they charge, it should be. It took me back to the couple of times I've been to Nobu........some of the best sushi I've ever had......some of the largest dinner tabs I've ever had, as well.   The appetizer selection is large and there are daily specials. On our last trip we tried a Tuna Tartar special, as well as their "Hanabi" Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice Cakes. Both are excellent. For dinner, we stuck to rolls, focusing on items such as Tako Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, and Katana Roll....all involving the adjective "spicy"....what can I say? We like it spicy.   On a previous visit, some main courses hit the table. The Chilean Sea Bass was excellent, so don't be afraid to order off the Entree Menu if sushi isn't your thing.   Lastly, the service is wonderful. We've been twice and everyone has been great to us. You are never left wondering where your server has gone and their GM, Seth, and the other managers are constantly making the rounds and ensuring that everything is to your liking.   All in all, I'm a fan of Roku. Beautiful setting, beautiful people, and the option of submerging yourself into the scene downstairs, or enjoying a quieter meal on their new patio.

0vl_K_vp-pwrXyR8owkH3Q.text: Awful service. Stated couldn't split a 6 person check because he couldn't remember what each of us ordered.. When we labeled them for him still got it wrong. Manager was no help stated that he just wanted us in and out and he didn't even apologize for the issue plus HE was wearing diamond earrings with a tux. If I want to go to a nice restaurant and have a $300 bill I shouldn't have to deal with bad service and will take my business elsewhere.

6omxKM4-9izdfBOhD7iRog.text: I thought Suski Roku was great.  It is way better than any hotel restaurant I've been to (except David Burke's Primehouse, of course).    I had edamame, a california roll and a shima roll -- shrimp wrapped spicy tuna w/ cilantro and avocado.  They were both fresh and excellent.  The nice part was that I could see the sushi man actually making them about 25 feet away.  Nice!  I did think they needed more creative sushi rolls but was definitely happy with the two that I had.    The place looks great.  Nice tables, booths, everything.  A little dark with the lack of lighting but I'm fine with that--I know my dad would have complained about how hard it is to read the menu.    For hotel guests, I guess they serve non-Asian food here for breakfast and lunch.

3xMFlMny4_W5yycWSp-4cA.text: Outstanding food and great service.  Very hip place to be seen.  Brought my young kids here and they loved it too.  Thought it was cool seeing all the young 20-something's eating out before hitting the town on a Saturday night.

cIRQ3JBHLICZrGj-qSGApA.text: Have been to Sushi Roku a couple times.. Both times the Food was GREAT the Staff Was Great... For years I have just driven by, now that I know this is an awesome establishment, I will absolutely be stopping by more often.  If you have never been, you need to check this one out.  For Real!

Hp99IGY7WpCCeRQU5CKsOA.text: warning! biased opinion here.  get to know the chefs. once they get to know you, you're experience will be stellar! first, i dont eat rolls! second i've been to japan numerous times and have had sushi there. third. i know where sushi roku is located (arizona) for those who forget. fourth i make a reservation any time im having dinner there. that said, have the grace and faith to let the chef make you what he would eat or what he thinks would best suit your tastes. (be honest! if you dont like uni say so!!!, if you normally eat rolls try omakese at your local sushi spot befor trying it here!! ) the chefs here have a strong head chef that teaches not just cutting techniques for the numerous fish that other sushi bars nearby dont carry, but also about how to best "service' the guest.  if your expecting super fast rolls and unrealistic low cost, you made the wrong decision.

zPWuHKOJUn3VSKKR5reCeA.text: Fantastic late dinner! Our server, Jess, was very attentive, and recognized my wife's chocolatini (special request, not on menu) wasn't as requested. Very inventive menu. I recommend the beef tataki app! We had sushi rolls and a couple cocktails. Perfect! Thee Wagyu roll was ridiculously good. I remembered a "free white choc brownie" offer somewhere, and Jess was quick to ask if I was on Yelp!.....and yes, it was amazing.

ioaG5Oa-YMZAPP80RUgEwA.text: Surprisingly I'm going to give 4 stars to Sushi Roku.  Here's why...  Being that it was my first time to this location I was SUPER skeptical because it sits at the W hotel in old town Scottsdale, which is nice but, it's a restaurant, not some hot Sushi/club scene that came here from LA as people portray it to be.   So I was smart, I went on a Monday night when I knew the affliction and UFC crowd would be to a minimum and the staff could actually concentrate and relax instead of bustling around rushing because of a shouting, rude clientele.   Not to my surprise the experience was exceptional, the staff was hands down friendly, confident in the chef and on track with recommendations including a delicious pairing with a bottle of chilled sake.   I opted for the steak wrapped asparagus to begin and the stimulus menu for a main course.  To those who don't know, the stimulus menu is a 3 course meal served for $30.00 where you can choose either "Land" or "Sea" and yes, it's okay to mis-match them too.   I had the "Land" as my first course which constitutes 3 of the restaurants most popular items, steak, chicken, etc and all were prepared absolutely to spec, well except maybe my steak was a tad cold but meh, everything was going awesome so far so why screw it up by complaining.  The second course however I had the "Sea" version in which 4 different pieces of nigiri are served with 3 different types of roll, also note, you can substitute fish in case you aren't feeling shrimp or whatever they serve you, a total plus.   Third course is green tea ice cream, always a winner in my book.  To sum it up I'd say this location met my expectations with what I had become accustomed to with the LA locations, I'll be back for sure, just never on a weekend, not in Scottsdale at least.

6mhpk-hp7zVjxCLI74ENNw.text: I was en route to Japan, when I flew over the W hotel in Scottsdale. I looked down and noticed a bunch of cool tables and booths located next to the sidewalk. I couldn't make out what the sign in front said because I was already at 2500 ft. and ascending. I asked the guy next to me if he knew, and he said " I'm in the middle seat, I can only see wingtips you moron".  So I made a mental note to myself  to find out which restaurant was located there. 2 weeks later, I had returned. I found out that it was Sushi Roku. I thought to myself, there's no way it could it be as good as the sushi I just had in Japan for the last 2 weeks. Well, Ive only been wrong 3 times in my life before the day I ate at Sushi Roku. Now I can honestly say Ive been wrong 4 times. I had no idea how fantastic everything is here. The decor blew me away from the get go. It's an interior designers heaven. Very modern and clean. I was floored by the warm greetings and smiles my wife and I received right as I walked in the door. Now then, there's sushi and then there's Sushi. The Toro sashimi I had was so fresh, I thought it was gonna swim right out of my mouth!! I mean Harrow!!!  Everything from the Filet Wrapped Asparagus to the Shima roll was fantastic. Ironically, our servers name was Ross too. Classic.  He was able to answer any questions we had, and he also suggested several menu items that we ended up ordering, which lead me to write this review. God he was impressive. Fantastic experience overall.   I cant wait to go back!!

dBdxWprROgckMb6YKRNDtQ.text: So I typically stay at the W when I am in Scottsdale, AZ, so this is an easy go to for our team. I have had breakfast here a few times and dinner once.   Breakfast service is not the best at all and is very slow. The food is amazing though. I've had the Huevos Rancheros multiple times and they are so good. They are not definitely what I would expect when you say Huevos Rancheros as I am from a very Hispanic hometown, but they are delicious.   Dinner service tends to be better as I am assuming this restaurant is made for dinner. We had a handful of rolls, Miso Soup, and the Asian BBQ Shortribs "Yakiniku." By far the only stand out item was the Beef Skewers! They were to die for. All of the other food was definitely average to me. I have definitely had better sushi in Dallas, Austin, and Atlanta. For the price point I don't think this would be a favorite restaurant of mine, but for the convienence, it isn't horrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos Ranchero breakfast!

TEa7wnUQioZ7Tze3rwHaAw.text: Best crab sushi I've had. We enjoyed albacore sushi, a spicy yellowtail toll and a Philadelphia roll as well. It was all second to none.  However, the edamame disappointed; it was undercooked. Ambiance is five stars. Server was super nice, although service was a little slow, but we were in no hurry. Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-ccenysqShafAYAuv99ZuQ.text: Meh. Overrated. Acceptable food, creative rolls and fish, excellent service but the food is, in my humble, "yet incredibly spoiled for sushi" opinion, this was just "OK". I've eaten sushi & sashimi all over the world and looked forward to trying Roku Scottsdale (we've been to another location and were underwhelmed but thought we'd try again). We were staying at the W and based on their website (silly me!) we thought we'd give it a try (from the W website: "Voted "Top 10 Asian Restaurants" by Arizona Republic, Sushi Roku, our Scottsdale restaurant, pushes the boundaries of modern Asian cuisine with a dazzling array of fresh sushi, luscious salads, thoughtful appetizers, and an extensive selection of hot entrees.:) Top 10 Asian restaurants? Pushes the boundaries??? Dazzling array???? Me thinks not so much.... The yellowtail with diced chilies (aka jalapeno slices) was the best dish we had, I would recommend that. OToro was quite good, the rest? Not memorable (I can't even recall what we had). We had ordered salted edamame as a starter, however, it came out after we finished all of our sashimi and sushi and it was burned, actually inedible. Great 1/2 price Sake deal mid week was a nice touch though. Again, the chefs and the servers were excellent, but I would recommend Kodo Sushi & Sake in No. Scottsdale WAY more.

xg5Bbamg71NQlIoJJbi-Pg.text: Came in on a Monday night when it was relatively quiet and had some wonderful food! But, it wasn't the best sushi as it didn't seem super fresh.   I got the softshell crab, spicy tuna and yellowtail roll. Very filling but was definitely still hungry after spending ~$60. The sushi portions are very small, and it's probably best to combine it with something a little more carb heavy.   Although it wasn't very busy in the restaurant, service was a little slow.  Not sure I'll be coming back for sushi here!

nnUo9xkl7i0yZA8PsJNw0g.text: After losing our reservations for a bachelorette party the manager allowed us to come 2 hours later.. 930pm and promised to seat us then. When we got there there was no reservation and nobody knew what we were talking about. When we finally got seated they placed us in a booth and added a chair on the end for the bride... not very special. Service was terrible, food was overpriced and seriously doused in sesame oil and the entire evening seemed like a huge inconvenience to their staff. I will never ever return... pick a place like RA or roaring fork if you like to be treated like a paying customer.

Kg5vxgCiTFyJaXNkwBts4g.text: This was my second time at Sushi Roku, and I must say I came back for not only the amazing sushi and sashimi selection, but for the service as well. I'm leaving this review because the manager, Mr. Mike Kirsch, gave me and my friends amazing service. Simply top notch. I had friends from out of town that were visiting and they thought I was a VIP of some sort because of the attentive service I was receiving. Everything on my order was correct, and compliments to the chef as well (I believe it was Joey).   The popcorn shrimp was simply amazing. The timing of our different orders getting to the table was perfect! I would recommend Sushi Roku in Scottsdale to anyone and will be taking all of my visitors from out of town here so they can receive the same level of service I received from other members of the Sushi Roku team, including Mr. Kirsch (I hope I spelled that right haha).

H6tAy56IfbxoHMclSdkiBQ.text: We came to Sushi Roku for a family dinner. The food that did make it to our table was delicious. However, the service was absolutely atrocious. I am guessing the restaurant was short staffed, because there were 15-20min stretches where we wouldn't see our server at all. It took an hour before we were able to place our order, and the food we did receive was delivered over a 45min span - and we didn't receive everything we ordered. It would have been more acceptable if the server and/or manager would check in and explain that the kitchen is behind, but we were left to wonder what was going on, which obviously led to frustration on our part. We decided to cancel the food that we were still waiting for because we were fed up with how long it was taking, and hit In n' Out on our way home so we could actually have dinner. Maybe others will have a more positive experience, but we will not be returning.

uxM7FdhF58W-j9nUQOdA7A.text: Where do I start?  We went to this restaurant last night and it was horrendous service & management!  The hostess tried seating us at a table with wet seats and table - very obvious it wasn't cleaned & set up yet!  After we were walked back to the front, it took over 10 min to wipe it up and get it set up. Only giving us 2 menus for 3 people. Ok - I can deal with that...but the rest of the night went downhill!  It took a while for the waiter to come to the table. When he did, we ordered drinks & water immediately.   The bus boy finally came over with only 2 waters!??  Cocktails took over 45 minutes!  We were asked to order from the kitchen cuz the sushi bar was backed up!  What - we want sushi!  Food took forever to come! Almost sent the cocktails back since they took soooo long!  Our last order of 1 roll and 2 hand rolls took over 45 min and when the waiter came back he said they hadn't even started it yet. He had a look like "maybe you people should cut your losses and leave". Our order never came out so we decided to leave!  The manager actually came out and told us the waiter mentioned our issues and he gave us a discount. Really? It was honestly the worst service I've ever had in a restaurant.  He didn't want our take on the night?  After leaving we heard from others that they also had TERRIBLE service!  Needless to say - we won't ever go Back

Fcbd3wO3u8qIxmzTZxw14g.text: Great fresh sushi! Every food that was put on the table was delicious. I'm definitely coming back here. It is very pricey, but worth it.

5LCtRrPgZ7V14DkHb4rKdw.text: Just ordered sushi from them via Uber Eats. The food showed up warmer than room temperature and scattered as if the delivery guy was using this bag as a means to win a pillow fight. I understand Roku isn't liable for what happens when it leaves the restaurant but the food was subpar it would be more fit for a five dollar plate atmosphere in a strip mall. The overall experience was collectively horrible. They lost my business indefinitely.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $55.00 worth of food delivered by Uber Eats... rough.

JMOhK9k3bCucGQ4BqH6dkA.text: Excellent Service, Delicious food and drinks. This past Thursday was the first time I had been to Sushi Roku, definitely will be back the next time we are in Scottsdale. Our bartender/waiter Alex makes incredible drinks and his customer service is terrific. He made the whole dining experience for our table of 7 ladies lots of fun!!

2WdeOprmPKSd8qVHyX3W8g.text: This place is the bees knees. Nicole is great and Mr. Chow made some great rolls. Excellent service, quick, and very nice staff!

A4AK43d6DimK43t_c1u7sg.text: Not bad, yet not too impressed to be coming back. We came here for happy hour and sat belly up at the bar. We ordered from a few items on the menu as well as the happy hour menu. The fried rice was way to greasy and salty for my taste. We also ordered the oysters and they tasted okay but had a little fishy after taste. The service was  not bad at all, but I wanted this sushi joint to make my taste buds dance and unfortunately it didn't accomplish that. Sorry Sushi Roku, we won't be coming back.

EevzypSBl3WP56e1vGfyOg.text: Everything was delicious. The service was helpful and on time and she was definitely willing to make recommendations for the meal. Sake selection was great and I would definitely recommend.
