fh_keycVJs5QkCDHCucUOA.text: Really good food, and a cool atmosphere! Fast service, though the workers seemed a bit frantic. The bar also doesn't have normal options, only their specialty drinks. Luckily the bartender was really nice, and even though it was busy, when we told her what was in a Mai Thai, she was willing to make it. She also made a fantastic mojito!!!

RCRg_cGWZ_ScFz3V8YX6yQ.text: Ive been to a few rokus.. but the one in scottsdale is where you need to go. Ask for Dan the manager if you want sake. He'll explain it in depth. Hes passionate knowledgable and personable, especially when it comes to sake.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. May your blessings overflow..

B_L5FEZkqC-obaem-EXqVA.text: Went here when I was in town for business. There were plenty of reservations for the same day Thursday night and it was busy but not overcrowded. Service was a little bit on the slower side but the sushi was fresh and tasty. Downside of the night is when we ordered mochi for dessert (chocolate, green tea, and passion fruit) and it took 15 minutes from them to bring out the mochi but in the flavors green tea, mango, and Sakura. When I told the server who wasn't our waiter that we ordered different flavors, he then proceeded to tell me they were out of chocolate and that Sakura was their passion fruit (Sakura for the record is cherry blossom, not passion fruit). While still delicious, we did not appreciate the switcheroo and then the attempt to convince us that Sakura = passion fruit.

rdozpfiVPIbz0o1FEkHgTg.text: Came in on a Tuesday night for happy hour with a girl friend, the bartender recommended some great dishes and drinks. The bartender, I didn't get his name, recommended we try the Smoked Old Fashion and the Pear Martini, both fantastic presentation and flavor. You'll have to try them!Our favorites on the happy hour menu were the Tai with black salt, spicy tuna with fried rice cakes, and the beef and shrimp skewers. Food took a couple extra minutes to come out but was well worth the wait.

6y81cbblfHVz0mUrUYD_nw.text: This was extremely sisterlous. Every bit was sisterly delicious, my taste buds are just wanting more and more!

hvpwQOpVXmjXTi-Tg4chQg.text: Rob is the BEST!!  Makes you feel at home. I never wanted to leave! Was my first birthday meal here in Scottsdale....  UNBELIEVABLE fresh fish!!  SO fucking delicious!!!! This is my place now!!!!

k3F4PnlvZt1Y26bFYmx-IA.text: Went in tonight with my boyfriend for our anniversary and it was perfect!! LOVED our server/bartender.. I forgot her name but she's the adorable blonde bartender that works all the time.. Shoutout to her for making our night so special! Food was amazing as always. The general manager, Steve, bought our dessert. Thanks for everything!!!!! Definitely worth 5 stars :)

voi6lmm1BQhGJh5m7cb_3Q.text: Had dinner here tonight for the International Sushi Day and have to say was very good. Had the edamame, shishito peppers, soft shell crab rolls, tuna tartare, fried rice, and wagu skewers. For it being International Sushi Day and half price would come again. My only wish was the sashimi octopus we had the first time we came. Hopefully next time. My girls even liked it overall. We will be back next time can make it to Scottsdale.

M71gy3HucYYseXSTlhHRTQ.text: I was here 3 weeks ago with friends. I went back the next night alone. The staff was friendly and welcoming, the bartenders Sam and Regis both remembered my name from the night before. The service was prompt, the food great and the atmosphere awesome. I will be back in AZ next week and will def visit this venue.  It is THE place to start out also,  with your friday and saturday night shenanigans ( :

AZlrLLIR7Djub6zpCwxcPw.text: Spend a lot of my Friday night happy hours here! Great food and the bartenders are so awesome and friendly! Get here early to get a spot in the bar for happy hour

3LZCq_YQ12NjokQCLRMrEw.text: Great spot for sushi in old town!  We have been there dozens of times and each time the food and service is on point.  The management is great there as well and if it's your birthday the hook up the desserts.  The yellowtail with diced chilis and ponzu sauce, steak wrapped asparagus and popcorn shrimp with miso sauce are our go to apps.  As for main courses there are too many to choose, but you can't go wrong with the sushi rolls and the jalapeno and sriracha rolls with tuna are amazing.  And for dessert you have to go with the assorted mochi ice cream. The best flavors are pistachio (when available), passion fruit, mango, and blueberry.  Enjoy!

9_2E6gnqzU9bU1_Jy6lqbw.text: Came in the other night with my parents, the staff was extremely knowledgeable from the waiters to the bussers. There was an exceptionally friendly busser named Skyler that was a fairly neat guy.The food was fantastic though, especially the salmon and the waiters were helpful in explaining the dishes. 5/5 stars I will definitely be coming back.

FWKQDaz9U73E_ED-ALWpxA.text: Five star sushi all the way. Staff was very polite and server had great suggestions. Coconut Saki was delicious. Best part besides the sashimi was spicy pork belly fried rice.

ydDWBJZHuGsfEOd4p57bbA.text: Went here for dinner last night, and I have to say, each time we've visited, we have had nothing but exceptional service. Jon was our server; his knowledge of the menu is outstanding. We even let him order for us! His recommendations exceeded our expectations! You truly have an asset on your hands! We will definitely be back and will request him again! Great job to him and all of the staff!

akvagq0Ij7edi5elWt-6Cw.text: I experienced the BEST service I have ever received at Sushi Roku this past weekend, if I could rate this place 10 stars I would. We had a large group in for a friend's birthday, and had to wait about 15 minutes for our table due to a conflict. Although we were hardly bothered by the wait, the manager came by to apologize for the inconvenience, and even sent us a few free appetizers. He stopped by several times to see how we were doing, and our waitress made sure to make the night as special as she could for our group. I highly recommend this restaurant for a nice and affordable night out--the staff is so friendly and the food is phenomenal!

ska6Y1NW8dUNGDI8RjSZJw.text: My review is based mostly on the excellent service I received from Jenn the bartender...she was absolutely delightful! I came here with my friend (both new to the area) and we had a lot of fun joking around with her. She was both professional and fun...I've been working in the service industry for 5 years...I know great service and I'll definitely be back! We ordered 4 specialty rolls, all of them were delicious...this place was not disappointing in any way. Overall wonderful dining experience, can't go wrong here.

d1-eGmSjPBIsPfWJRhm5Aw.text: Always enjoy coming here for sashimi and Japanese beer.  Had a particularly great time with Giovanni as our server a couple of weekends ago.  None of us at the table knew anything about sake and Giovanni went to great lengths to walk us through it all.  The sushi is always great, but our server's attentiveness made a great start to our evening.  He even went so far as to offer to help us get tickets to a concert that was going on at the hotel that night.

VyBz20qiYFgkXTnxL76r0g.text: Never before have I had such amazing sushi and incredible service! We will be back! I would say the only thing we didn't like was the music.

3QvRSS1WERlwQHk8xD4yHw.text: Great Night Out.... Took our nephew out for his birthday this last week and was so thankful for the amazing dining experience at Roku.   The design of the space is cool and stylish. The food was delicious fresh and tasty from beginning to end.   The star of the evening was our server Amy. As soon as we begin our dining experience she was welcoming, charming and just plane on point. She guided us through our progressive meal with great knowledge of the menu items as well of a sense of fun and care you don't often get with dining in the Scottsdale area.  Hats off to Roku for a great menu and who the manager who hired Amy. Her service alone was worth the expense of the evening.

DN7jVkMaO9vWDXNbLPtfJQ.text: Agree with other reviewers. Expensive but it's located in the W so I would expect to pay $17 a roll (not with a smile.) Sushi was fresh but nothing unique or interesting. Straightforward. Shima roll with jalapeno is a nice fresh spicy choice. If you're looking for a no thrills sushi place with a lounge vibe and good service this will do you great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shima roll with jalapeño.

TunlRfqdfWjTcn4_JI4xvw.text: The food here is way overpriced. You are paying for the location and the atmosphere. I've tried lots of sushi and this wasn't even that good. I might give it a better review if the food was actually decent but you don't even get your money's worth. I will stick with sushi brokers as my go to sushi spot.

kR4liWl4dRiK77PliA-jyg.text: We checked out Sushi Roku at the W for a fun night out with friends and sushi.  The restaurant was surprisingly quiet with an almost empty dining room. The dining room itself is serene and lovely and we were seated in a comfy half-moon banquette table perfect for our party of 4.   Our server (whose name I am forgetting and I'm so mad at myself!) was excellent - she had a wonderful, fun personality and gave some great suggestions on items to order.   One of our party is on a very strict diet and asked for vegetable sushi rolls. The server was initially hesitant about this as the way that they usually make vegetarian sushi is different than what my friend was requesting. However, she went to the sushi chef to see what could be done and he was kind enough to accommodate the request. Not only that, but the vegetarian sushi rolls were beautiful!   We started with delicious yellowtail with ponzu sauce and chiles - it reminded me more of a carpaccio because the yellowtail was very thinly sliced and a bit scarce to find amongst the other elements of the dish. We also got an order of the shishito peppers, as they're usually a favorite of mine! Their shishitos were pretty good, but the ones toward the bottom of the bowl were somewhat greasy and were really overwhelmed by the soy garlic sauce they were prepared in.   We began with Miso Soup (good, always a great comfort food) and then got a variety of sushi including the obligatory tuna, yellowtail, and salmon as well as scallop, a roll with eel, and a spicy tuna roll. We also ordered the teriyaki jidori chicken skewers, which was tasty.   We got a few different desserts including the Chocolate Volcano (yummy, as to be expected of a molten chocolate cake pretty much anywhere) and the banana spring rolls, which were not much of a hit.  The floor manager stopped in to check on our table, which was a nice touch and something I always appreciate as we were able to let him know that our server was doing such a nice job.  Overall, service and ambiance were excellent and the food was just okay for the price.

fbjBD3mSTg-fzHF-x7jYgQ.text: This was probably some of the best sushi I have had in a while, but the prices are off the chart. Everything was easily 2X as pricey as any other place I have been. I know good fresh fish is not cheap, but there is a $42 sushi appetizer on the menu which seemed obscene. The service was exceptional and the sushi was great, but $145 for dinner of 2 is just too much money regardless of the quality or the service.

S6TvV-Yl21puOj8p_6yp5Q.text: So I really was looking forward to coming back here but it was quite disappointing. I will start by saying they were very quick to help us figure out a seating situation for our group of 8 which was nice. We settled on the patio which may have been the reason for the poor service or the server could have been being over worked however when we could call her name for assistance we were often ignored u til she had time to help. It took a LONG time to get our checks and they won't split them for you. You have to do it.   The way the food comes out is strange. It was all at different times and so all of us were eating sporadically and not together. The food was average. I am pregnant so I could not have the sushi but my husband said it was good. The atmosphere is definitely what makes the place. Would likely come back for a night out with the girls for drinks and atmosphere and probably skip the restaurant.

QEWGyAh0R-rr6rZIwGmtZQ.text: Excellent food & service Friday evening.  Giovanni our server was tip top.  A couple of menu items were 86'd - so he simply recommended other menu options.  Dan - the wine/sake somm - offered excellent sake pairings.  Steve GM - checked in on us a few times as if we were regulars.  Will definitely be back.....

9sfzUvBYRXRZtJUC2qXqpA.text: Guys, super nice place and the food is outstanding, high quality with great service.  The manager Justen is trenedous and makes every dining experience very memorable!  *A must visit if in Scottsdale!

pF6hyM_VcyJQtJ8b3W3IKQ.text: This was my first time with my friends.  The waiter was OK. He introduced himself and asked us if it was our first time so I said yes and that it was my friend from Chile, South America.  The waiter did not explain, offer or promote anything.  So we ordered some California rolls and other foods, there was 4 of us. The food was excellent,  we had sushi before from a scale of 1 to 10 I will give it an 8. Suddenly I saw this very nice looking lady carrying couples of plates so she stopped and came over with a radiant smile and explained the dishes and introduced her self. It was very pleasant and great she said her name is Sarah and came back to ask us if we need anything and I ask a few questions about the menu and drinks. Due to her awesome personality and warm smile we all felt like we were at home. Sarah mentioned her passion for foods and the interaction with people,  she loves to meet others and make them feel at home. I WILL BE BACK JUST BECAUSE SARAH MADE OUR NIGHT MORE MEMORABLE. The manager was an awesome person as well. Thank you Sarah for being a real person and make our night something to remember.  I will refer Sushi Roku to all my friends.   Lewis

Z5j7uLW-gD8ZdHB-xTq4sw.text: My wife and I had a date night last night so we decided to check this place out. As first timers we came away impressed with the overall experience. The food was very good, the service was excellent. Our server CJ was fantastic. He was super friendly and informed. He made some excellent recommendations, including the oysters with a lime wasabi type dressing, so good! The blue fin belly was very good and fresh as well.  There wasn't anything we ordered that wasn't good. I'm not sure sushi snobs would be blown away by this place, but we will definitely be back. I would say this place makes our top 5 for sushi in the valley. I would give Sushi Roku 4.5 stars if I could.

vT4kTyNmW3poZWVNEniOlA.text: The food is simply perfect. Come for happy hour to try many items at a discount. The steak wrapped asparagus is amazing.

4HEf9FsGTOHDPYKyAjQPZQ.text: I love Sushi and have tried many Sushi places in the area, but for some reason kept missing out on Sushi Roku...well, a nice gentleman decided to take me there for my birthday dinner and what a treat!!  We were seated at a cozy booth with a view of the sushi bar, which is perfect if you want an intimate dining experience but you want to observe the excitement of the sushi bar in action.    Our waiter greeted us right away and he was outstanding throughout the whole evening!  Unfortunately I did not catch his name.  He told us about the Arizona Restaurant week menu and the alcohol and the 'real' menu...I had major conflicts of interest!  We ended up opting for a feast of a little bit of everything Hahah! We ordered two options on the AZ restaurant week menu because the variety of the options was impressive!  Seemed like a great way to try a bit of everything since we had never eaten there!  And I had to try one of the Signature rolls; when I go to Sushi places I like to try their 'specialty' or something weird and unique!  As for the drinks I ordered white wine (Citra Pinot Grigio, Italy) to go with the mounds of fish coming our way and my date opted for kirin Ichiban beer, and the AZ restaurant week menu surprised us with a complimentary Roku Fusion Cocktail!  The Breakdown:   The signature roll we chose was the Tako Roll: Spicy Octopus; it was my FAVORITE thing of the night!  I find sometimes at sushi restaurants when they say spicy it is just more like a bit of a zing that you have to spice up with Wasabi, but Sushi Roku wasn't lying!  It came with spicy tuna dressing the top of the octopus roll and an interesting spicy reddish sauce drizzled across the top...Delicious!!! Great way to start the evening!   1st course:  I chose 'Appetizers From the Sea' because I love fish, which came with Tuna Tataki, Salmon Sashimi and Tai Usuzukuri.  And my date chose 'Appetizers from the Farm' which entailed Kobe beef skewers, Fillet Mignon wrapped Asparagus, and Crispy Ji-Dori Chicken.  My favorites from each (yes we shared) were the Salmon Tataki, which had an amazing sauce (Truffle Tamari Soy) and the Kobe Beef Skewer (black pepper sauce)...my date liked the Tuna Tataki (close 2nd for me) and the asparagus wrapped with fillet Mignon (amazing).  We both decided we would forever pass on the Tai Usuzukuri (very blah) and the Crispy Ji-Dori chicken (over fried and just blah compared to the others).    2nd course: I opted for the 5 pieces of Roku Signature Style Sushi (Tai, Yellowtail, Salmon, Albacore, Tuna), accompanied with 3 pieces of Spicy Salmon Cut Roll and 3 pieces of California Cut Roll.  It was all quite amazing and a great assortment!  I loved the albacore sashimi!  But it was all good because I love tuna in general!  My date ordered the Grilled sirloin steak "Japonaise" with Japanese style potatoes; it was a pleasant surprise because we both didn't know what to expect.  It was a big tender steak with a unique gingery sauce and the potatoes and green beans that accompanied it were also Delicious.  Both plates left the table empty!    And yes still going: 3rd course:  DESSERT! The waiter brought out both the Mini Chocolate Volcano and a Fresh Fruit Sorbet!  They were both tasty but we could unfortunately barely eat them because we were so full!  The Sorbet tasted very fresh and fruity with beautiful fresh strawberries.  I love chocolate, so the Chocolate Volcano was decadently rich and wonderful, in which I dipped the fresh Strawberries from the other dessert; YUM!   Oh and when the surprise Roku Fusion drink showed up we were amazed at such a great Restaurant Week deal for $30!  BTW they did not skimp on the alcohol ;)  If you ever want to try Sushi Roku, Arizona Restaurant Week is a great time to go because you get a great variety from the menu!  It was a wonderful experience for us when we were just expecting to try a few different rolls and drinks!!  I should also note the Tako Roll (spicy octopus) was not included with the Restaurant Week special.    I know I will be back because their anniversary falls on the same day as my birthday (September 26th) and everything on the menu is half off!!! WooHoo!    And one last thanks to my anonymous server!  I hope I get to enjoy your service again! As much as the sushi bar looks enjoyable and fun; I wouldn't have traded that for such an excellent dining experience!

P5J11aTjpC95XQqShLVsGA.text: Tonight we made the mistake of not making reservations, for their 50% off sushi night. I will own up to that. But myself and two others showed up at 4:55 not thinking this would be a problem. Three cold hostesses informed us that they don't open until 5:30, and that they are fully booked. Having worked in the restaurant industry myself I completely understood the fact that they were fully booked on this night, again, my bad. They told us the bar top (5 seats) was open though, and to return at 5:30 when they open. We went to the bar at the W to order a drink. At 5:25 we walked over to the hostess stand. The first thing they said to us was that we couldn't take our drinks in. Fine, understood. But the tone again was not appreciated. Then we look and the 5 seats at the bar are FULL. I'm sorry, at 4:55 you told us we couldn't be seated until 5:30. And at 5:25 those seats are taken? I'm giving roku 2 stars because I know their sushi is good. Which is why we wanted to dine there. And again, I get that we should have made a reservation. But the ice queens at the front door coupled with the early seating when we were told we couldn't sit down, made us feel like we weren't worthy of sushi roku scottsdale.

H51S6HZdlqOiBygNfQJnIw.text: This is a pretty solid sushi restaurant. A bit pricey, but the ambience is awesome. My boyfriend and I went last month, and our table wasn't ready until 20 min after our reservation. The bf wasn't exactly pleased as he had spent a lot of time planning the evening. The GM Steve was very gracious though, and brought us some amazing appetizers! Definitely helped to smooth things over. Everything we had was amazing. My favorite was probably the yellowtail appetizer!

M7PmS_tHiNTWO2k0RwE8ew.text: Love this place. The best sushi in town and our favorite server- Sarah S. !!! We will be back soon!

em56XY0OgJ3NNAhc9GSzog.text: Great sushi & atmosphere. First time here with a group of girls, we arrived around 8 PM on Sat night and there was no wait but the place was pretty busy. Our waiter CJ was so nice & attentive. Wine was $10-16 a glass, I got a cab for $12 & it was good. We got an array of sushi for the table, all was great. The roasted cauliflower is to die for!!!!! The only weird thing was I got the baked crab roll and it wasn't sliced, it was just one long sushi roll, sort of awkward, especially because we just had chopsticks & no knife or anything. But food was great! Will be back.

yE_AcXe2wC0fAKT7ATbGrA.text: Food is fantastic ! Server, Sara Soaf is cheerful, helpful and a hoot !  Would highly recommend both.

VnMmwyMetQEzc1DGc5LqfA.text: Great spot inside the W hotel. Convenient location in addition to amazing food! Staff was very friendly & helpful.   On the more formal & expensive side but worth it if you're looking for high quality sushi etc.

9apz_3587TiwJkKc84z92g.text: We went here for my wife's birthday dinner and it did not disappoint. It has a cool ambience and great tasting sushi.   Devin did a wonderful job as our server. He was knowledgeable and attentive. Sushi chef Toby made the best little crab roll I've ever had!   We'll definitely be back.

jrg-3EvFcG00kSup-7DnOg.text: This is more than 3, but not as good as 4 Japanese restaurant & bar. The place is in the W hotel, right next to the lobby. Location is good, parking is convenient. Love the decoration, very contemporary. (It is a lovely place to have a drink and at the same time get some sushi & sashimi.) we went there for lunch, so didn't have drink. (Not sure about the drinking price) they have lunch bento box, and you may order two from the list. Love the flexibility and the combination.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lunch bento box, sashimi and vegetable tempura.
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. lunch bento box. Grilled salmon and spicy tuna &amp; California roll. The rolls are not very impressive, but the salmon is good.

Kr4jVe5INvYqVuRmEGfcGQ.text: Nicole saved our day after a long day she started our meal off with some quick side orders, was totally attentive and very nice, the food was great and the live octopus was great.

nJL9tDknZIisrDQTQu2Ycg.text: Very impressed,  hands down one of the best restaurants in the area.  The menu was unbelievable and the service was even better.  The food was diverse and amazing, it was some sort of experience that combined the art of the culinary past mixed with the present. The freshness of everything is where I was most surprised being that this particular location is in AZ. I can confidently say it's one of the top sushi restaurants I have ever visited and will be going back for more.

jbuusIKX1LVsVcq_jGS61Q.text: Sushi Roku is my go-to for any occasion or none at all. Everything is delicious but my heart belongs to the pork belly. I adore the hostess Juliana. She's always accommodating, poised, and elegant and first impressions last so it's a good thing she's one of the first people to greet you at Sushi Roku. The restaurant is inside of the W hotel so put on your Sunday's best because this is the place to see and be seen!

7iFrMD_ivbuHaTOCp6cm0w.text: I'm not a huge Sushi person, but our host was, so game on!  I had the Makoto Roll (Spicy Yellowtail & Shrimp Tempura wrapped wtih Seared Tuna, Spicy Creamy Sauce 17) and it was the best of all the things we had.  I don't even know what the others ordered, but they were all just ok.  The atmosphere is really chic, the wait staff is helpful and attentive.  Our host had said this was a great place, but I wasn't overly impressed, though I would never say that to him.  Maybe if I was more of sushi person I would have thought more highly of it?

GyHv4bje4Svp7JJDH3pXqQ.text: I've been dining here frequently for the last year and every experience has been great!!  If you're lucky enough to have Brian or CJ wait on you you're in for a treat!!  All of their recommendations were outstanding.  It is a perfect destination to take that special someone!!

w0egWSaiLLPG3PoyemAx2w.text: This place is AMAZING. Food, drinks, atmosphere was fun, exciting, and delicious. Thank you Dan for taking care of your customers! Me and my friends will be back 100%! This is a must go restaurant!

8XCKSPQjDJW8fYC3foxdag.text: My favorite place to bring my family and friends. Great food, service and atmosphere. Can't beat the all day happy hour on Sunday's. We always request to have Jenna as our server. She has great knowledge of the menu. We recommend this place to everyone.

_NN36DW_zoqE2Zl3CDNiYw.text: Nice ambiance and decor. The food is just okay, to put it mildly: my friend and I ended up with food poisoning after visiting this place. Service was slow. Overall: good for drinks, not for food. An overpriced and pretentious place.

-DmB3pMGRYPumVUPcj8Z0Q.text: Chris was a great waitress and there were chaotic kitchen issues but Guillermo was incredible in helping the situation.

MOBynMGbT76Y2NAfnHpCPw.text: Me and my boyfriend had dinner at the sushi bar here. The sushi chef went out of his way to prepare us fresh sashimi and get to know us. The ambience was great. The hot apps we ordered were octopus and Brussels and they were excellent.

p_8Wk7_NS6lOB8U6qRCZsA.text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here and we had a wonderful dining experience. The restaurant is trendy yet  inviting. We had appetizers, dinner and then a dessert tray with 3 different desserts. The highlight of the evening was our waitress, Sydney! She made us feel so special that evening! Great night, food and service!!

ganavChzXmaeeAi4nu-O1g.text: Sydney is the BEST server at Sushi Roku. Every time that I come here she makes me feel home. Would give her 6/5 stars if I could!!! This place is awesome - definitely check it out!

uyxpk7Ga7KSvXDTe05N3UQ.text: Kristen was the most amazing server! She handled 18 of us ladies on an epic bachelorette like a pro. She handled all of the ordering and we all left so satisfied as a result. Book your dinner and make sure she's your server!

mlvfdLAFUiK5OtbF3rUVKg.text: Great food, and great service. Our server Mia was slammed but made time to make sure we were taken care of! We will be back and will ask for Alex and Mia!

RxwwCRRj1lOQCLvrH4b9Pg.text: Hands down the best sushi I have had in a long time.  Our server, Raelyn, was spot on with her suggestions and as sweet as can be.  Brussels sprouts, baked crab roll, jalapeno roll, and tuna poke were phenomenal!  Zen drink was also spectacular.  Only word of advice is go a little later in the evening to avoid the drunks coming from the pool party at the W.

VMzFXqb9zvdrvENVcNa5oA.text: I had heard this place was just OK, despite frequenting the W in the last few months. I made my way over on a very busy Saturday night and requested a table for one. The feeling I leave this restaurant with is extremely happy and satisfied as the staff was unparalleled in their welcoming attitude toward me. I think because I was sitting alone, they may have felt sorry for me LOL, not realizing it was quite fantastic.  The fish was fresh, I ordered the chef's choice sushi eight piece. They were single pieces of fish prepared with ingredients that would accentuate the flavor of the pieces perfectly.  All of the staff seem to know the menu extremely well and all made similar recommendations which turned out to be epic. The brussel sprouts chips were very decent and light. I will be back. as much for the wonderful staff as much as for the amazing and fresh fare.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Neighboring patrons celebrating her birthday they were having a great time!
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chef&#39;s Choice Sushi

whUw_V8K8ANrYorjsA3PUg.text: I went to Sushi Roku last night just to grab a quick bite and a drink before an event, and I was blown away. Our bartender Alex was not only extremely accommodating of our dietary restrictions, he was almost excited to help navigate our experience. I wasn't expecting to be so delighted with my experience that I was inclined to yelp, but here I am! It's awesome to be pleasantly surprised by amazing service. Thanks Alex!

xt4dod0akSlO2SkPGX8TEA.text: My husband and I dined at Sushi Roku for the first time this evening. Ayden was our server and he was one-of-a-kind spectacular! He was extremely  informative, professional and thoughtful. Ayden answered my many questions about the impressive menu and suggested the perfect pairing of delicacy and drink. We were honored to have the manager, Kyle introduce himself and offer his warm welcome.  We savored each selection that was offered us. I am fortunate to have dined at all of the top restaurants in Scottsdale and without a doubt Sushi Roku is amongst the best in quality, atmosphere, presentation and by far, service. We will most definitely return to dine at Sushi Roku again. I highly recommend Sushi Roku, and of course ask to sit in Ayden's section and may I suggest the avocado appetizer and the crab roll with butter sauce.

4maYBKUlZ3YT6JxamtxkTQ.text: Sushi Roku was fresh, flavorful and so delicious! We had awesome service and the night was one we won't forget, thank you!

4BUZpF4lcJhE9LQv7u2dyQ.text: Well... it wasn't great.  We went for an event at the W related to The auto auction and decided to grab a quick bite at the high top table near the entrance. We thought we were lucky... nope.  Table wasn't cleared completely, so the hostess decided to help by picking up an almost full saucer of soy sauce and dripping it all over my lap and floor. She looked at me and just turned around and walked away. She was young, and i think embarrassed. Regardless, no apology.  When i returned from the rest room the server, who took forever was visibly over loaded. Between the mediocre sushi and slow service it was actually a terrible experience. The one highlight was the sea bass, exceptional and almost worth the trip.  Overall, the experience was crowded, loud and service was slow and very inexperienced (poorly trained) for such an upscale establishment.

jbYG59MlaFvyn2h5_k_E6g.text: I had the most AMAZING plate today at Sushi Roku. My server, Rob, recommended the tuna tartar with a yuzu guacamole. It melts in your mouth. The tuna was so fresh and the guacamole was nothing like I've ever tasted before. I highly recommend this dish and make sure you ask to sit in Rob's section.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

02hN1d63SI-V4SFupy5HoQ.text: After a horrible experience last time, this time is much better. We ordered several appetizers and two rolls. The eggplant was the best of them all. I used to really like their veggie tempura but for some reason, the breading is really thick on the veggies. It felt like eating fried bread instead of tempura. The Brussel sprout chips were good when done well, but really oily and lots of burnt ones so you taste the bitterness of burnt veggies. The rolls were pretty good. The tamago was done well too.

vEHOqRHdhCEZIvHaGJ0tOg.text: I went here a couple of days ago and really want to give this place a high rating because I thoroughly enjoyed every dish that was brought out. The only thing making me write a different review is how dirty our area was when we arrived. I ended up sitting on something very sticky and gross and didn't notice until I got up to straighten out my blouse. We sat at the sushi bar and the counter was all dirty as well. I spent 95 dollars at what is known to be an upscale restaurant but was very disappointed by their lack of cleanliness.

C18K04dFWQSb1O41IArqHQ.text: Wonderful service , good atmosphere and delicious food. My all time favorite was the tuna carpaccio and blue fin tuna sashimi. Ordered the poke tuna and ribeye steak, both could be good also but the sauce was a bit salty. Overall, everything was perfect. FYI: was celebrating our 3 years being engaged. Definitely will be back ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EME2vuFUOtAmbCB4vXnq_w.text: I had my bday party 7/7 & this place was wonderful.About 16 guests and they all loved it..The service was off the chain the food delicious and in excess .They served all the food right on time where we never noticed not having food ..Like i said everyone was impressed and stuffed .So have no doubts if deciding to have a large party here.Ohh and we got a free round of shots

HF7heAXJE6jDN9NBJlFJ6g.text: Food was great Terrible drink service, waited 30 mins for a drink. Asked multiple servers where our drinks were and no one seemed to know. Wish we had chosen a different restaurant on our vacation

0gy0aIcikiRAghe_ZZIDzw.text: A++++++++  Great service, vibe, sushi is great! Perfect spot to grab a drink or for a date night. Highly recommend.

h2jnkKwI9bc72xttRqlgxQ.text: Too expensive and poorly executed.   The rice fell apart and lacked proper texture.   The sushi itself was presented well but the price was really sky high for fish that was just....meh

veOosTr0ZSWrTt6co7Yy0g.text: Just had dinner there for the first time last night. Yum!   The ambience of the restaurant is very nice. Not too loud but not too quiet, with nice lighting and decor. Waitress came up to us quickly to take our drink order and get us settled with menus.   We decided to get the fried chicken, Brussels sprout chips, and gyoza for appetizers. All were delicious! The Brussel sprout chips and fried chicken were my favorite!   For dinner we split the pork belly fried rice, tuna jalapeno sushi roll, and the daily special which was a scallop dinner. Again, food was great. Sushi was tasty, fried rice was amazing, and the scallops were good too. A bit different, as I'm used to typical pan seared scallops, but still very flavorful.   Drinks were strong and refreshing, and overall experience great. Would definitely go back to try more!

8hEo3ivIADsbn_9pEPSUUQ.text: Terrible customer service. Had a reservation and got seated 40 minutes later for a table of 8 when our reservation was for 12. The ambiance was nice but everything else was terrible.

S_Z5VZEJBFREaIlu15tMHg.text: The food here was delicious but their suggested gratuity is way off! You have people drinking here and senior citizens who may not pay attention and just put what you recommend. If you go here pay attention to your bill so you don't get robbed on gratuity! This is breaking the law and deceiving their customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5jdxQ8CzLh6q7LjO4WtHPw.text: Rob was amazing! Food was great-flavors were unbelievable, service was above and beyond, and the fish was fresh. The king crab roll was delicious. I had the best time! We will definitely come back again and again!! Recommended for all.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

yolibJZpwPrVuwy30ruy0Q.text: Had a reservation for 12 and they put us at a table for 8. Terrible customer service. We also waited 30 min for our reservation. The place is cool. Food decent. But don't come here

089Rlf-FJrjKYyVDke00-Q.text: No one receives five stars from me.  I narrowed down the search for sushi by searching yelp within Old Town Scottsdale for sushi joints with two $$ and below. This one fit my budget for happy hour only. After happy hour, this place is too expensive for my budget.  Here, I order several things off of the the happy hour menu. My first choice was the albacore Sashimi with the ponzu sauce. I was very impressed by the flavor of the sashimi, and the fried/crisped slivered onion strips were a wonderful and not overpowering garnish. However I felt that the albacore was a little bit too thin. Not enough substance.   Next, I also ordered the spicy tuna hand roll - and boy was it spicy! It had a very good combination of spiciness and flavor it was not overpoweringly spicy, and the roll was of a decent size. Same deal with the salmon skin roll. Nice and salty just like how I like my salmon skin, and ditto with the size of the roll. A good solid flavor to the salmon skin - good taste.   I must admit that I ordered doubles of the wagyu beef on a skewer. The beef was well-cooked, not too fatty, nice and tender, and with lots of sauce on it. The sauce was delish, and the meat was very flavorful and cooked very well (not well-done, but just slightly less than medium). I ordered two skewers, but in all fairness, may not be worth $7 each skewer.   I do slightly regret not trying out the edamame hummus and spicy edamame, but I ordered enough happy hour selections to make me satisfied and empty my wallet, so I quit while I was ahead.  Keep in mind that, at this joint, you pay for the vibe and the rent just as much as for the food and service. I gladly paid, but it's not something I can afford on a regular basis.  The staff was very attentive. I had no less than three very good looking waitresses waiting on me as well as two other waiters. My food came instantly after I ordered it within about a couple of minutes after each order. And every time they brought the meal out to me they gave a brief description of what it was that I was receiving.   All of the waiters and waitresses seem very happy and I believe they are well-paid this place is a very well-run operation the employees are very professional and the appearance of the restaurant is very good and clean.   I do like the food dear however I would limit my purchases to happy hour it also helps that they have very good music and lighting inside the restaurant which produces a very nice relaxing ambiance

NKvHzmDjapZNRKVQZJ06xA.text: YUMMMMM. Try the KEN Saki! They have delicious roasted cauliflower and really amazing crispy Brussels sprouts! The sushi is always good!!!!! I love going here when I haven friends or family come from out of town!

tc7ZAZVqBB8b-xp1CRNK8A.text: We really enjoyed our dining experience at Sushi Roku last week! It was our first time visiting and we did need some guidance when ordering.  Our server, Evan made some great  recommendations for us.  He was very knowledgeable and such a big help. The food was delicious. Can't wait to go back!

HmtYyvCCBjGSGR5rNSmvuA.text: My first time here, the food and service was great! Our server Mia was so sweet and Alex took great care of us!

EuUuvE19P6MVsTuzzPUJag.text: I've eaten at this particular location several times as the W is my go to hotel when I used to visit Phoenix and it's always been consistent. Now that I'm a Phoenix resident, I've decided to take advantage of their happy hour anytime I'm in the area.   What I like most about this restaurant besides the delicious tasting sushi is that a business traveler can get in and out of this restaurant fairly quickly in between meetings. What I mean by that is if you're staying at the W and want breakfast, this restaurant converts to that. When it's time for lunch and dinner it turns into Sushi Roku.   Staff is great here, always friendly. There are a variety of rolls and the best thing about the sushi here is that the portions are big and you never leave hungry. Try the Truffle Tempura, the tuna jalapeno and if you can't make up your mind just order the Chef's Special and you get a good variety of fresh and creatively prepared sushi. The key word here is fresh. Everything is delicious.  Little tip, if you aren't craving sushi and have a bigger budget, try the filet mignon. It's really yummy and at medium rare, it's prepared to perfection.

dTmUF_tg_kBfSMhBNBbWaw.text: Was in town for a girls weekend, staying in the W Hotel. This place was perfect for a late dinner on night one when everyone was flying in and just wanted to stay close. I wish I took more pictures of the actual food but it was all so delicious we gobbled it up asap.   Appetizers - Premium edamame, Brussels sprouts chips, Beef rib eye wrapped asparagus, Hokkaido Scallop Sashimi  Entrees - tons of sashimi pieces, plus rolls: Crunchy spicy tuna, Shima, Katana, Tuna Jalapeno (my favorite!), Spicy Scallop.  Dessert - Smores and Chocolate Lava cake  All of it came out quick and really tasty. The wait staff was really great and made awesome recommendations (the hostesses weren't the warmest but I'll chalk that up to a slammed waiting area and Brody Jenner and some guy from the Jersey Shore being there!).

oJ77MYusPEJB6XjL02GRFA.text: This was my families first time here and we will definitely be back! Evan was our server and he was phenomenal! He gave us great food and drink recommendations and we loved everything he chose for us! By far my favorite sushi restaurant!

NNWHsUPdGOH-UQW8aRXXzg.text: I never write reviews on here, but had to say something.  Granted, we had dinner here on Christmas evening, but regardless of that it was an extremely disappointing experience.  I live in Chicago and have been to their sister restaurant Katana several times and have had a good experience.  There were five of us, and we were seated at two tables put together, and they squeezed three of us on the booth side.  The problem was, the tables were different thickness so the person in the middle didn't have a level area to eat on.  They reluctantly moved us to another table, where we were ignored for ~10 minutes and our initial order of drinks and edamame was seemingly forgotten.  We finally were able to get some orders in, and our waiter was very apologetic and nice (Jacob was his name I think?). The food that came was pretty underwhelming to be honest, and after ordering apps we were informed that last call for food was happening because they were closing at 8 (we were seated at 7:30).  No one had mentioned this beforehand.  I ordered a sushi roll and some sashimi - the sushi roll came and had Saran Wrap in it (what the sushi chefs use to make sure it stays in place, so I ate it anyways) but that was pretty off putting.  The sushi chefs were cleaning up and packing up everything, and my sashimi never came, so I never said anything.    As I mentioned above, I understand it was Christmas and they might have been working a skeleton crew, but then don't have the restaurant open if you can't deliver for your customers.  Overall was a horrible experience that didn't improve at any point to be honest, and the food was very mediocre. Scottsdale has some of the best food in the country in my opinion, spend your time elsewhere.    Note:they did remove some things off our bill but it was still a $200 meal.  A visit from the manager would have gone a long way.

NQ7cQBuHfhnCCcsrtPEEaw.text: A great place to dine and drink!  The sushi is always fresh and top notch.   Even their filet mignon was awesome for those who are not into sushi.  Great service all around.  CJ our server was by far one of the best servers we ever encountered and we dine out a lot.  The manager, Guillermo, was very gracious and welcoming.  He runs a great restaurant with an awesome team.   Well done by all !! We will be back for sure.

m8NO4cJ8-dkMzzcLxYIJuw.text: There is not a single thing we ordered that I wouldn't get seconds of. The list in order of absolute love:  1) Brussels sprout chips (tossed in truffle oil) 2) Shishito peppers 3) unknown name tuna role recommended by the chef with spicy tuna and jalapenos inside and fresh tuna on top - AMAZING 4) Beef rib eye wrapped asparagus 5) Crunchy spicy tuna tempura 6) Avocado Hanabi 7) Roasted Cauliflower  To reinstate, I loved all of it. Granted this list is short on sushi and it's not that we don't love sushi, it's that we LOVE appetizers and couldn't make a single choice. But for those on a budget, you might have to make some choices, and I hope this helps. It was the perfect filling amount for three semi-hungry ladies.   The vibe of the place is perfect. It's in a hotel, and the only way I would notice was the swim suit wearing ladies at the bar. But that's not a bother to me as the waitstaff is incredibly friendly and professional. Note, the night we were there it was mostly a young, handsome, male staff. I'm not complaining just noticing.   Next time I'm in a city with Roku, I'm coming back.

eldMM6TICA6vaTokFksfeQ.text: Kris was amazing! Had a few issues but she was incredibly accommodating! Guillermo was a greaT GM as well.

Ko5p6VpOb29sKEvj7TQl1w.text: Kris is best server of the year - we had so many issues and she solved everything so grateful.

aACvENVpTyv-YegsxHsSzw.text: I live within walking distance so I eat here at least once a week, it is amazing! There is no better place to get dressed up and have some sushi and then drinks upstairs. Tip: Eat at the sushi bar and ask for Aaron, he is amazing!

-NO9dMcmbkjaQc-Y8QdPvQ.text: Good Izakaya and Sushi. Little on the pricey side for portion size. Party of 3 with no alcoholic drinks came out to $280 before tip.

cZ0YKG40fP-sYucINZoufw.text: I have tried many other Sushi Restaurants, but for my money, Sushi Roku has the best Sushi in the valley. Everything on their menu has a very unique freshness and high quality taste. Our server Rob, took the time time to really explain our menu. He made our dining experience very memorable, and we will be coming back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Sushi Combo was amazing.

dloSf-1U3IB4btYmecz1fg.text: Brussels Sprouts chips were good. Cosmopolitan was great! Spicy tuna roll was sort of good. Beef wrapped asparagus was great! Only thing that was unusual was when we were walking in and the staff was yelling out, but I suppose enough people like it to the point where it's become their "thing". The waitress was super nice especially considering the fact that she was working December 24th.

yKPy-IyHtNQm3XCQXt7F7A.text: I love sushi and Japanese food, I tried this place for delivery because I was craving ramen but I was disappointed. Their $15 pork ramen came with 2 tiny slices of pork, the spinach salad was 1/2 a cup for $7 it was salty n tasted like strong vinegar... couldn't eat it. The California roll was good but standard and you get 6 pieces for $10+. This place is overpriced.

YX_JhjOLXsOqeIEOryO1vg.text: Crystal is the best bartender in Scottsdale! We will be back to Sushi Roku just because of her!  HH is great and a good value. Nice place with a personal ambiance, dimly lit at night. Food is outstanding. HH Kobe Skewers FTW!

THilTKpySuvDJBcNjdJLDQ.text: Went into Roku knowing nothing about sushi, and now I feel like I know everything thanks to our server. The food was all such great quality. Also I didn't even have to order our server picked everything for us! Also had a bottle of sake I've never had before which I am now in love with. Again thanks to the server. His name was Jon and he was very professional, knowledgable, and yet still super causal with us! Thanks again Jon I'll be asking for him again.

IbmIkiBDdbFJQaOjtRJT5A.text: Went here when this place had their anniversary week and all food for dinner was 50% off. I walked by this place several times. Scoped out the menu but was too afraid to commit due to the price and my lack of success with Asian food let alone sushi in Scottsdale.  I'm from Seattle where grade A sushi is sold from grocery stores.  This place did not disappoint. Their wide selection of fresh fish is impressive along with their A5 wagyu beef. The New Zealand King salmon melted in your mouth as well as their thick slices of sashimi (yellow tail, tuna toro, snapper) gave you the perfect amount of balance of flavor on your tongue.  If you're not into raw fish, their japanese fried chicken is crispy and juicy-you really don't even need the aioli that comes with it.  I did also have their BBQ short ribs that were supposed to be Korean style. It wasn't bad but it was doused in a lot of sauce and a bit too salty for my liking. I typically like short ribs dried and grilled without being sauced.  Service was impeccable. Rene was very knowledgeable of the menu and did a great job describing the seafood items and the chefs preparation of each item. Having worked at upscale restaurants before, I'm truly impressed by this individual.   Overall good place but probably a bit outside my price range for how much I normally eat on any given day. Great value during promotions such as their anniversary week.

6C85XFdCb5Zqd3ZRIdsE4Q.text: I am an avid patron of sushi restaurants and had never tried sushi roku before this past weekend when my girlfriend and I decided to give it a try. Immediately I felt comfortable with the decor, lighting and layout; it felt like a place I would enjoy. All of those emotions came to fruition with our server, John. He was friendly, energetic and clearly knowledgeable and able to answer all of our questions. Then the food came brining it all together. Starting with the edamame and though out all of our various rolls, I was very pleased. With all of this said, I cannot wait to come back and have recommended sushi roku to some friends ( and to sit in John's section if at all possible)

V8E_GKAYdkbL4qpGiQ7oqw.text: There are a few times in life when a meal is so expertly crafted and planned that it is nothing short of genius. Tonight I had one of these! Dan is a great manager and makes the experience so much more fun!

nmJx-tgy4kKyH0ZCz4JOMg.text: One of my first experiences going to an actual sushi restaurant. I was skeptical to go but it was a great time. The rolls we ordered were delicious. The Atmosphere was very satisfying and our server, Jon, was incredibly humble and nice. I will definitely be going back!

H6IH-4HheE0Pn1DFAup72w.text: I love Sushi Roku! It's my go-to. Dan is the man! The yellowtail with diced chilies is the BEST thing on the menu. I come once a week and it never disappoints! Such a good vibe and fun time

rE0PAYF2SN4AJEzFvUy9XA.text: First time at Sushi Roku was for a Valentine's Day dinner. Had reservations for 8:30pm arrived 15 minutes early. As I walked in, the atmosphere seemed alright but man the hostess did not know how to greet or check people in. Waited about 10 minutes and not a single effort was taken to greet us nor did she ask if we had reservations. Took a little longer to be seated and the lighting inside was too dark which didn't do well with the tiny little print on the menu. Only highlight of the night was the sushi. The sushi was absolutely delicious. The appetizer did come out after our sushi but still overall the food was delicious and well displayed. Long story story food was delicious but service could have been better.

HrAW3UbEWbf389dH8PpcQA.text: Great location in the W and the food was good but I would not exceptional.  In addition made reservations but they were not able to seat us for almost 40 minutes - made the reservation more or less pointless.    Overall the crunchy tuna roll was my favorite.  Nothing was bad but that definitely stuck out from the 10 dishes we ordered.

9XSkpqAcgWECNrnv6s8I5g.text: 3.5 really.  Good sushi and it seemed fresh.  But...the service was not good at all.  I was asked to move at the sushi bar when I first sat down (still not sure why as I was the ONLY person at a 20+ person bar).  The food took not too long, but I had to ask to get a drink refill.    I had the sushi lunch special $17.  Overpriced, but hey this is Scottsdale.  Many people raved about this place but it's like an overpriced RA Sushi.    I won't be back...to many other choices.

7UHa1N4NaVE-PYgtDpXmqg.text: Rob our sever took great care of us.  His service was amazing.  Great place to have breakfast, lunch and dinner!  The food was delicious and sushi/sashimi were fresh.  Drinks were great as well.  All the people working were very friendly and hospitable.  Thank you Rob & Sushi Roku for taking good care of us on my birthday!

sgTjmui-VaVPDfCeLOknsg.text: I had posted a review previously that was not meant for this restaurant. My friends all state this is a great place to go and fantastic food with excellent service.

Zq-uxrso-p3sH__3yLc7HA.text: Never been here before, but they were having a "half-off" promotion to celebrate their birthday.  Basically half off your entire bill.  Great deal.  However if I was to judge this place based on their normal prices, I'm not sure I would've considered this place worth the money.  The place is set on the bottom floor of W Hotel in Scottsdale and it meshes very well with the reputation and the vibe of the hotel.  Hip, sheik, trendy, while at times bordering on over the top.  The hostesses are screaming at the sushi bar everytime they walk their guests to their tables (sounded like they were yelling fishaaaay or something).  Got really annoying after awhile.  But I digress.  For the appetizer we got the crispy rice asparagus.  Basically an asparagus skewer covered in a fried batter of rice and peanuts.  The saltiness took me by surprise.  Not bad, but not what I anticipated.  For the main dish, we got the twelve piece assortment to share.  In reality it was more of a 20 piece dish as they served a mixture of california rolls, crab tempura, and a mix of different sashimis.  Basically reads like a greatest hits menu.  The albacore and octopus weren't really my thing, but the crab, tuna, and salmon were all pretty good.  It was more than enough sushi for two.  We washed it down with some saki of course.  For dessert we had a chocolate lava cake.  They got this one right, as the chocolate was moist on the outside and liquid hot on in the inside.  All totaled, one appetizer plus the sushi assortment, saki for two, dessert for two, with the 50% discount and tip was $55.  Great deal with the discount.  Normal prices are somewhat in line with some of the popular sushi venues I've been to (though you pay a little more for the venue I'd imagine).  Personally I like going to the small local mom and pop Japanese establishments like Hana, Tokyo Lobby, and Cherryblossom.  The prices are right, the quality is just as good (if not better), and its feels like a more authentic experience.  But thats just me.  If you're not picky about atmosphere or price and just want a sushi fix, this trendy Scottsdale spot will suffice.

tKxF0_ndUGTmBqe052GHFA.text: I went here for the first time the other week. The food was a little pricy but well worth it. Our server Giovanni was more then helpful to recommend us with some new rolls (new Favorites) that I have never tried before. This place is a must for any sushi lover. Also thx to Giovanni for turning me on to their amazing smoked old fashion cocktail.

FmP9BlSirwAhoz-O6iNjYg.text: Great ambiance. I had the Matsu 8 piece chef sushi custom and the grilled octopus. The sushi was fantastic. Each were custom made from the chef. The grilled octopus were too grilled for my liking and the price I expected a bigger portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Roku - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Matsu

UocGihK9fD1qVk4VLB4ElQ.text: Located in the W Hotel in Old Town Scottsdale, this hipster hangout is always busy. I recommend a reservation if you're planning to dine here. The Better Half and I drop in here from time to time. Since I don't eat Sushi, I order: Ji-Dori Chicken Skewers withTeriyaki Sauce - $10 yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP1... Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus with Soy Mirin Sauce - $15 yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP1... yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP1... And for Dessert, a warm Chocolate Cake...yum! yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP1... yelp.com/biz_photos/DwP1... The Chicken Skewers are very tasty. The Teriyaki Sauce they are glazed are sweet and have the right amount of "sour" kick to it to balance the flavor. The Filet Mignon wrapped Asparagus is awesome...the Filet is tender and juicy and the Asparagus compliments it well. Of course, the Chocolate Cake dessert is a nice ending for the meal. The service can be a bit slow at times, depends on the server. Generally speaking, it's pretty good considering how busy they are. The people watching here is pretty good...watching all of the hipsters is hilarious. Return Factor - 93%

v75_SRcNjWLd-5CMBdh_1w.text: Food was very good but definitely overpriced. I highly recommend the sashimi platter. The coconut shrimp was actually very tasty. The roasted cauliflower was not worth the price. It said it has pine nuts but the nuts were definitely not pine nuts. The pear martini was too sweet. The overall atmosphere is intimate and enjoyable. The service was pretty good

hoEwg-SRkQ_Sz_DH7XIp-Q.text: Good food and awesome Sunday night deal with the half off wine bottle! Thanks CJ for being a great server!

U7q-pmqa8uMqTcdnGFvNdQ.text: Good space and atmosphere. The happy hour is an awesome deal with lots of rolls and appetizers, beer and sake on special.   Would recommend the "hanagi" (sp) spicy tuna roll. It's deep fried rice with the spicy tuna and sauce on top. Our server told us the restaurant won an award for it.   Only reason it's 4 out of 5 stars is they don't always read reservation notes, it was my finances birthday and they didn't acknowledge it.

YOY3sjxg79vKsJ89pQd_eQ.text: We go her at least 3 times a month!!    The customer service is always amazing.  We normally sit at the sushi bar, or ask for CJ.  This guy looks 12, but damn he knows his stuff!!!   He often just brings us dishes based on what we say we like, and so far we have never been disappointed!!    The food is fabulous- you cant go wrong!!  The Yellowfin tuna plate is to die for! The hanabi and the filet wrapped asparagus are also amazing and we get almost every time.

QIeG6UJiNtxp5-J8Z1kTWg.text: Last night my wife and I went into Roku (where we haven't gone in quite some time) and had a great experience. We travel a lot during the summer so we do not get a lot of time to go to our favorite spots. Roku is one of them and it was unreal. Jon served us a complex order and gave us some great recommendations that my wife loved! Happy wife is happy life! Thank you to Roku and the staff

yPt1QCMMMeXmuYAClcUAng.text: I was able to dine here for breakfast and lunch! The food was amazing and I would definitely go back again. In addition, the service was awesome! Victoria was our sever and she took care of us very well! Victoria made our dining experience amazing and will request her the next dine we time at Sushi Roku!

AvxTG_TgPRorFxwv1twNBA.text: Excellent sushi!! Very fresh fish. Loved the carpaccios and the yellow fin spicy roll. Very friendly and attentive servers. For dessert we had the mochi which are great! The strawberry one is delicious!  Loved that they had champagne- elderflower cocktails, my current favorite!!

MQfa4N1mw9ItPvoyIXoPZA.text: This place is awesome. I experienced fantastic service, delicious sushi, and great omakase from Mike.  He was very knowledgeable on sake wine and liquor.  Every time I'm in Phoenix this is my go to spot. They take great care of me when I stay at the W. Also check out their happy hour!

2HM9POcy2UxCg8friwW6Wg.text: We came here during anniversary week which meant our food was half off! What a great special and they were slammed. We will definitely go back even with out a special going on.  We started off with the sashimi which was yellow tail with a spicy sauce and fresh cut cucumber and jalapenos on top. YUM this was probably our favorite out of everything. The we got a couple of rolls  - soft shell crab and a crispy spicy tuna. The soft shell crab was huge and delicious. Great fresh flavor. The spicy tuna though is part of the reason for a star deduction. I was under the impression it would be, well... spicy and, well... crunchy. It was neither. The flavor of the fish was good and the sushi itself but the batter wasn't cooked until it was crispy so it took a lot of the flavor away instead of enhancing it.   We finished the night off with tempura popcorn shrimp which was very close behind the sashimi. These things are so delicious and popable and its a huge portion that could have easily been shared between 4 people instead of two. It comes with shaved asparagus and mushrooms and the sauce is just creamy and delicious.  Our server Kristen was amazing. She was just so cute and patient with the two tables next to us (one was really annoying and demanding and outright rude and the other just needed a lot of attention).   The other reason for my star deduction is that when a new guest comes in and is seated, the hostess yells out something that sounds like "airhsay" (totally butchered that but I dont know how to spell it) and the sushi chefs and staff yell it back. After hearing it about 50 times during our meal and having it interrupt our conversation, you just get mad about it. Please take note staff of the restaurant...its not you guys its the yelling during the meal! Its really, really annoying.  Anyway, I was very happy with everything in the end and would definitely go back there for sushi (I have been really picky about where I eat sushi out here).

AXE5WzwZDghnlO7W_n4zpA.text: Great location, ambiance, and food...who would have thought you could get quality sushi in the desert???  Yes it's more California style sushi vs. traditional but more mass appeal for a place like Scottsdale.  Baked lobster roll was absolutely delicious.  Spent about $200 for 4 people, but we did have sake, wine and beer to go with our meal.  Would gladly come back.

rVgEXMkf4uk5B73TJMHXdg.text: Amazing!!  Great atmosphere and unbelievable service!! Bianca was out server and she rocked!  Blue fin Tuna, fluke sashimi were some of our favorites. What a great spot and amazing service. Will be back!!

nRmQzZtNlNccQ2chQRATyA.text: We love sushi and loved the unique spin to many of the items on the menu. The food was outstanding. However, the restaurant is noisy and filled with young, "beautiful people", so do not come here if you are looking for a quiet romantic night. The overall vibe of the W in Scottsdale is one of snobbery and elitism, very disappointing for a W, and we have travelled to many across the country and usually enjoy attentive and upscale service. The good news is that although the hotel is lacking, the wait staff at this restaurant is exceptional and really made our evening. CJ deserves special recognition for making it a great night. It was easy to see that he loves his job- he knows the menu, helped us pick great plates to share and was friendly and engaging. Because of the food and CJ, we will be back to eat, but will stay at another hotel.

jAL1tJnYuvdeiXc9dpIVOw.text: We were staying at the W and decided to grab dinner here one night. Very friendly wait staff.  Ordered truffle edamame, crunch spicy tuna roll, makato roll, and popcorn shrimp tempura.  Truffle edamame - loved it, great flavor The sushi rolls were good, nothing amazing. Shrimp tempura was also ok.  Overall food was ok/ good- nothing exceptional.

KRRPqwjF83rjMHeroR5oqA.text: Ate here while watching spring training. It's a little pricey but the ambiance, service and food quality are worth the price. They have a great selection of drinks, sushi, entree dishes and desserts. If you enjoy good sushi and a quiet, casual but nice ambiance, you will enjoy this spot.

qEfY-AYIuEzKTOJNOlq6AA.text: Food- mediocre  Service- terrible, so SLOW It's hard to enjoy your dinner when you're constantly looking to flag your server!

eWBqL1Mm-rK1I985OeMX2g.text: This was the beginning of my birthday / NYE night at the W Hotel. Gorgeous, ambient,  classy restaurant with a beautiful flow.  Love the booth seating and the place is super clean with a very upscale feel, it is a perfect addition to The W.  We were a party of 8 and we had reservations -we were warmly greeted and promptly seated. Solid menu which also includes non sushi options(plus GF.) We had a few apps to share at our table - Filet wrapped asparagus, Edamame, Hummus, Oysters, Seared albacore. The wrapped asparagus was delicious and tender,  the Hummus and wonton's were a big hit as well. The oysters and albacore were fresh and yummy. Besides having a really nice menu they have a wonderful selection of Sake's and Asian martini's .  I knew i would be drinking so i steered clear of having sushi for dinner, so instead i had a fabulous Prime rib served with a super yum garlic sauce, my dining companions had the sushi assortment and the Lobster, scallops and prawns ..all plates were presented well and were delicious .Service was outstanding, they really took care of us and helped to make my birthday dinner very special .  Cannot wait to return ! We all had a brilliant time.

w7NxZ2QTsOf321ea5Af6Jw.text: This has been my favorite sushi place for a while now. At least the one in Vegas and Katana in LA. The menu at this location is different and the fish didn't taste as fresh. But the service was great and the atmosphere was very hip and fun. I'd go again.

_sLuueGTHhOVn_vLQJWOpg.text: It's a treat to go back to Sushi Roku in Scottsdale. My favorite sushi place other than Morimoto's in Napa. However, Sushi Roku's service is leagues ahead. I was on a short trip, this time, and made it a point to go twice for dinner this trip. Logan was our server on my first trip and the first dinner of this trip. He is exceptional in his service, manners, and brilliant recommendations. My second dinner was lovely and interactive thanks to Sarah's service. She made dinner a treat by her wonderful tasting suggestions, and her attentiveness to our experience. Great work Dan, GM for making this establishment so amazing! Service is exceptional. Can't wait to return.

kIJIYV4XOsOkwx2t2mraTw.text: Had an amazing dinner the other evening the food is spectacular and service outstanding! I am gluten free and they were very accommodating to that! If I could give 5 more stars I would !

ml7kIVuvk1uzi3Gp_hYVqw.text: The sushi was amazing and the staff was the greatest. It was a special event for my daughter and they treated her like a princess. The sushi was so fresh and it tasted amazing. I highly recommend it, if your down in Scottsdale.

gMm-IAJ7H-ccsoa3MYtMpA.text: Loved my experience at Sushi Roku! After being seated by the beautiful and kind Julianna, to enjoy the amazing top quality sushi. The innovative menu was perfect, the beef rib eye wrapped asparagus was delicious and low carb! Perfect combination! I would definitely go back, and recommend this venue to others to try.

d6fkAMb7F9UqTVBod-H8cA.text: This is the greatest place in Scottsdale for sushi and drinks. Logan is an awesome server and can't thank Dan the man enough for being such a great manager!!!!!
